reviews.review: After logging in some time at the Daylight day club we were hungry and looking for a good place to get our grub on within Mandalay Bay. A friend remembered having a good experience here so we figured it should be pretty good. Well, it fell a little short of the mark with pricey food and slow service. My tuna melt was good, but it better damn well be for $16! The accompanying seasoned criss-cut fries were a tad overdone, making them overly crunchy. The service was nice but slow; it seemed like it took forever for the food to come out and we were HUNGRY. It was crowded, to be sure, with 4th of July weekend and the MMA fights and all, but it seemed like they should've anticipated this and staffed appropriately. Not a special destination in my book.

Side steamed veggies: broccoli had black-moldy goodness on it. 

French onion soup: HUGE & covered in a massive amount of cheese .... Delicious. 

Like the atmosphere and staff was friendly & attentive. 3 stars because they gave me veggies that should have been tossed out but instead served it to me - great presentation though. 

Customer service 5 stars. 
Soup: 4 stars.

I stay at Mandalay Bay for two weeks at a time about 5 times a year so I am always looking for a place to eat. Citizens is ok but the customer service is lacking. The food is pretty typical of what you get in Vegas prep aired to an average standard at an inflated price. The staff is also pretty typical Vegas, lacK of experience with a pulse. I often dine alone since my trips are for business. I work for one of the shows out here so I am always around the building. The often blank stare no personality hostess is put off by having to seat one and will always try and get you to sit at the bar. The bar with its uncomfortable foo foo hard plastic bar stools is always loud due to its hard tile surfaces. The service is unpredictable depending on who is working at the bar. The take out can be a good option but it's take it as it is. Pre made and don,t ask for it any other way. Once again young no personality who gives a shit attitude. Even Burger King will give it to you your way if you ask at a fraction of the price. They are open all the time which is a plus since I often finish working late.

This is for the bakery section only, although Citizen offers meals as well. 

The Raspberry shortbread was really, really good. Buttery, thick, shale-like layers with a generous amount of raspberry filling and crumbles on top. The banana chip muffin was okay, but the chips were interesting in that they melted at the slightest touch. If I blew on it, three chips disinegrated immediately! 

When I asked for the banana chip muffin, they accidentally gave me banana bread, and when I went back to the counter to exchange it, they told me to keep it so I gave it to my homie who said it was the best thing of the 5 things we got. 

With so many other bakery options on the Strip, I wouldn't make a special trip here, but it was nice that they had counter seating available for snackers like us :)

OK so I'm a sucker for good shrimp cocktail. I may have had the best shrimp cocktail I have had in about five years. I recommend great service and everybody smiling my fatness beer. Clean good for families good for fun

I am writing this review because of excellent service we received from Teasha. She waited on us for breakfast during Interbike 2016 and was so good that we returned to the restaurant the next morning and asked for her. She was cheerful, helpful and extremely efficient. She didn't even write anything down but got all of our orders perfectly. Marjorie Rugg - you have a great waitress in Teasha and we hope to see her again next September while we are attending Interbike 2017.

I can only review the take-out togo spot centered between the Kitchen and the Bar.

This spot I believe is 24 hours, as I find myself wandering in here to get to my room at 4 AM.  Basic food that will help you get on your way, and isn't fastfoody and greasy.  If you are from Southern California, think of it as an expensive, upscale Corner Bakery.

The items I got here were the turkey and avocado sandwhich (Very good, even at $14) and the breakfast burrito (decent, at $14).

You pay top dollar for being in the lobby of a top-notch Casino/Hotel (Mandalay Bay), so if you're looking for a dollar menu, call a taxi and have them take you off the strip.  Food on the strip will always have twice the price tag.

I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a conference and tried many of the restaurants there. Citizens was one of the better ones. Firstly, the food is very good. The cob salad is perfect. I liked their clean fresh decor. 

The service was mixed. Depending of who's working there, you may or may not have a good experience. I often walked by to see if I Katie was working at the bar. If she was, I'd definitely walk in for a meal. You need more like her Citizens.

A few colleagues and I stopped by Citizens Kitchen and Bar located in the Mandalay Bay Hotel on the evening of Monday, October 17th.  I ordered the French Dip which consisted of thin sliced prime rib, caramelized onions, Provolone cheese, and Au Jus.  It came with a side of fries (which were hot temperature wise and salted perfectly) and a pickle spear.  It was somewhat challenging to dip in the Au Jus because of the bread.  It was more of a hoagie bun and full of meat, so it made it hard to get that big sandwich into the little "cup" of Au Jus.  However, when I was able to dip it, it was good.

Justin, our waiter, was FANTASTIC!!!  He was very talkative and friendly, and checked up on us quite a bit to ensure that we had everything we needed.  He is an asset to the restaurant.

If you are hungry late night, or anytime really, then sneak into Citizens for a bite.  You'll walk away happy!

Had breakfast here.  Decided not to do a buffet and come into this restaurant in Mandalay Bay.  It was relaxing and food was excellent.  Crab Cake Benedict was excellent.  Breakfast Burrito was good, but I didn't like french fries inside burrito and it was not that flavorful.  This place isn't cheap but it was good.  Service was good.  No lines to get in when buffet restaurant had a wait.
The food was pretty good. But one of the employees there named Diana was the best!! She deserves 2 raises. She's got it goin on... She be parkin lot pimpin in her dunks!

Just had lunch at Citizens.  We had the mahi mahi fish tacos and the chicken quesadilla - both were very good.  The tacos has big filets of fish , rather than the usual chunks.  Fish was delicious as well as the entire taco.  Bustling, but relaxed atmosphere, good service even though the place was busy.  I also tried the Ginger Snap juice smoothie - was very good.  There was a choice of 6-8 juice smoothies.  This place offers comfort food, but plenty of healthy options too.  We saw a few burgers come past - they looked great.

We tried the pre-show special for $29.  It came with either salad or onion soup,  prime rib,  and chocolate cake.   Salad was pretty decent but the prime rib tasted very dry.  Definitely not worth $29.  :(

We just came out of LIGHT club and wanted some late night grub. This was delicious!!! We ordered the French dip and lobster roll with potato salad and coleslaw. The coleslaw was great, and I'm sure the potato salad would be to someone else (big cut pieces of potato), but I love my mother-in-laws the best. This was a breath of fresh air from the food at LVH hotel. Bill was $45 we ordered waters ;) they need to work on better service though, it took mustache forever.

Service was phenomenal, first night we had a server named Kevin, who described the whole menu to us being newbies. Every time I turned around my drink was re filled, even got a to go cup of water. Went back in the morning for breakfast and phenomenal service again. Our waiter was Jeff who also explained meals into detail. Breakfast was a huge portion and well worth the money. Deffinetly   will be back again before leaving.
This is the perfect late night spot. The food is actually pretty damn amazing. We had the French onion soup, the blue cheese burger and the mahi tacos. So glad we went. Would definitely go again.
The absolute best chicken wings I have had in years.  Other than that, pretty pedestrian.  Considering the price, I cannot give it more than 3 stars; and even that is sketchy.

Really pricey for the quality. However, it is a go-to for a quick bite for breakfast. The warm sandwiches may be a little too greasy for the health conscious. They also have Krispie Kreme donuts for a ridic price. Freshly made juices may be your best deal.
The best breakfast in Las Vegas! Especially since I refuse to go to any of the buffets. The service was prompt and our waiter was great.

After a very long flight it was suggested we check out Citizens for a late dinner. We asked to be seated inside because the band playing in the bar outside was SO loud. It didn't make a difference. Our server greeted  us quickly and was very enthusiastic. We ordered the fish & chips and the tuna melt plus waters. Food presentation was beautiful.  unfortunately the fish was over cooked and the potato salad, al though made in house, lacked flavor. In the end our bill was $50 for a mediocre meal. The fish and chips was definitely over priced, $26!
This was the worst customer service I had in my life.  I don't know if it as racist but they refused to seat met girlfriend and I.   And they were freely sitting other Caucasian people.

Affordable dining when compared to the rest of the restaurants at M Bay.  The staff is very accomodating and handled a large party of eleven under a tight time constraint.  Rushing off to see Michael Jackson The One and did not want to miss any portion of the show.  Most popular and newest of the Cirque shows in Vegas.  Very good service by Justin!

Nice large sandwiches, while the Loco Moco needed additional gravy.  Salads were also huge.  Also good for late nights.
If you are craving a Bloody Mary, this is the place to be. Best I have ever had! If you happen to have Lotus as your sever, you are indeed lucky in Vegas!   Great evening.

So Weird to be in Vegas at the Mandalay and not have much choice for good food after 10 p.m. (that are above standard Denny's type food). This place is better than Denny's but the price for what we got is not equivalent to the lack of quality in the dishes. 

If you are starving, it will get you by. With extra spending. 
If you want some GOOD food of quality and care in preparation and presentation, PASS!
Awesome. We just drove in from LA and wanted a quick bite. This restaurant is great, the portions are just right and service reminded me of old Vegas. Our server was Eric and he was awesome
We ate lunch here, it was just ok.  Not great, but not horrible.  We ate burgers and the wings. Price wasn't too bad.

Spend your money elsewhere!!!! The music is RIDICULOUSLY loud. I don't know how anyone inside could have a conversation. We asked to be seated outside because we did not want to eat breakfast and have to yell at each other. The hostess said she'd tell her manager, but that didn't happen. We are still sitting here and it's blasting. Extremely inappropriate for a morning setting. We ordered coffee and water and received those pretty quickly. Not sure what is up with the water here, but it was disgusting. We also received them in skinny glasses without ice, while tables around us received them in bigger glasses with ice. The waitress took our order and it's easily been 20 minutes and we have not gotten our order. There is a couple that was seated about 10 minutes after us and they already received their food. Are you freaking serious?!? 

(10 minutes later) ANOTHER table was given their food that came in 5 minutes ago. If I could give this place zero stars I would. Our waitress never checked on us to tell us why the food was taking so long. So we left. HORRID service. Now I see why they have such mixed reviews. I guess if you complain about the music they treat you like shit.

First off I don't understand why this place only has 3 stars, we really enjoyed it. Hubby and I came here for the hangover brunch on Sunday after an epic Vegas night. I had the chicken chilaquiles, super cheesy and a little spicy. The highlight for me was the most perfect Bloody Mary, they have the option of bottomless Bloody Marys but you have to hook them up yourself, I opted to have the bartender make mine and it was delish. My husband had the bacon burger and he loved it. The service was on point, everyone was asking how we were doing not just our server. Seriously loved this place!!

2 egg breakfast and the ultimate breakfast (don't remember what it was called but it was basically 2 egg bfast + pancakes). Service was very prompt as we were in a hurry - EXCELLENT mimosa cocktails 
Bit pricey for bfast but with it -
A great casual place to grab a drink during the day at The Mandalay Bay. Very nice atmosphere and vibe. While we didn't eat this time, we have our last trip and the food is spot on!

My husband and I went here to grab a late dinner after a concert. First the good... the mahi mahi fish tacos were amazing! The bad, which FAR outweighed the good... we went at 11pm and about two-thousand people were waiting directly in front to get into the club. Basically we just sat and ate while trying to avoid seeing women wearing dresses so short we could literally see butt cheeks! Also, the club is SO LOUD that we couldn't even talk during our meal. This place is probably great during the day when the area isn't full of BOOMING music and people trying too hard to look umm... not sure how to be P.C here. I'd be willing to go here again but only before the sun goes down!

Food & service alone would have been 4 stars, "management" deducted 2.  Small issue, could have easily been rectified, no biggie, but ended up talking to this "Marjorie" person who said that she was the GM. What a pathetic excuse for anybody who believes that they are actually running a business. Make the customer feel like a jackass, then berate your staff (within earshot of at least 5 other customers, who, by the way were also appalled by her behavior). I actually tipped the server double because I felt so bad that he was subjected to this hostile work environment even though what happened was not his fault. PS. Marjorie; I saw your electronically generated responses to other Yelp posts. Save your time & please don't respond that way to mine, if you don't have time to respond personally, don't bother. After witnessing the way you openly insult your customers & your own staff there is nothing more I need to hear from you unless it's your supervisors contact information.

Citizens Kitchen & Bar is located inside the Mandalay Bay hotel. They offer the typical American fare. The interesting thing about this place that I did not know at first is that they have an actual restaurant and they also have a to-go area where all of the salads and sandwiches are basically pre-made and ready to be sold. I came here twice on my most recent visit and ate once at the restaurant and I also got some food to-go the other time.

When I did eat at the restaurant, the service was great. The host was very nice and so was the server. The manager even stopped by to ask how my meal was going. They definitely take customer service seriously here which is a good thing!

Food:
Chicken Cobb Salad- Chicken, cheese, egg, cucumber, tomato and bacon. The salad was pretty good and refreshing. They also give you a choice of what dressing you want, but I stuck with the typical cobb salad dressing which is bleu cheese. $18

Turkey Avocado- Turkey, cheese, sprouts, tomato, lettuce, avocado, lemon aioli on a cranberry walnut bread. A really good sandwich for the most part. It tasted really healthy which is good since I always eat the worst food while I'm in Vegas. $18

French Dip Steak- Thin sliced prime rib, caramelized onions, provolone cheese and au jus. Served with cole slaw and a pickle. This was probably one of the best tasting French dips that I've had. Towards the end it started to be a little on the salty side, but overall I thought it was a delicious sandwich. $19

Typically, I would probably lower it to 3 stars since the prices are pretty high for the amount of food, but it is Vegas and nothing in Vegas is cheap. I've spent over $10 on a lousy piece of pizza before so I'd rather spend $20+ on a delicious sandwich! I would definitely recommend Citizens Kitchen & Bar to anyone that is at the Mandalay Bay and is looking for your typical American food.

Ask for Chris. He gives you that genuine feeling that you would expect from this concept. Not only does he give sincere, efficient service, he is happy to do it. MORE SERVERS SHOULD BE LIKE CHRIS. Fine diner my whole life, this guy has got what it takes.

Staying at Mandalay Bay and this seemed like a good place to get dinner.

I actually just had the calamari and a cocktail. The drink seemed pretty watered-down, but the food was really good. Loved the sauces.

Only giving it three stars because of the service. The waiter took my order, and checked on me about a minute after my food was delivered, and then disappeared. The server that brought out my food accidentally spilled one of the sauces all over my table. He only half wiped it up and gave me another napkin. I ended up grabbing another napkin off an adjacent table and finished cleaning up the mess myself.

I finished my drink and set my plate aside, waiting to put in another drink order and possibly order dessert. Nobody checked on me- I was just ignored. After about 15 minutes- I gave up and waved the waiter down for my bill. I went next door to Starbucks for coffee and dessert.

I don't like being constantly bothered by waiters, but I would think if someone's drink is empty or they are clearly done eating- they would make some effort to see if the diner wants something else. It wasn't even busy.

I'll probably end up eating there again- since the food was good, and reasonably priced for a Las Vegas restaurant.

We were heading to Starbucks but decided to check Citizens out for coffee since it was something new. So disappointed! First off, we waited in line for almost 30 minutes. I understand, Vegas is busy and everyone wants coffee BUT the line isn't long because this place is busy, the line is long because the service is so slow. You think a place that offers coffee and breakfast would be better staffed in the morning. There was only one girl working the register for the to-go cafe and restaurant. She was supper sweet and it wasn't her fault the wait was so long.  So it was finally our turn...Yay! Right? Well, we waited for a very long time to be told that they were out of mocha lattes. Wth?  Ugh. Go to Starbucks!
Solid for breakfast.  Basic but well executed menu.  Eggs Benedict with eggs done perfectly, but bland sauce.  Pancakes fluffy and cooked right.  Pricey for breakfast, but hey . . . it's Vegas.

Love this place. The service that Kiana and Daniel provided was excellent. And I am sure that it all comes from great management Joe(manager) was very kind and welcoming. The Mac and Cheese is unbelievably delicious.

My party and I are currently staying at the Mandalay Bay and we were pleasantly surprised to find a deli-style restaurant on premises, that is reasonably priced and open 24 hours. The food is excellent, we have eaten at least one meal a day at Citizens for the last week and plan on continuing the streak until we leave next week. The staff is incredibly helpful, personable and professional. In particular, we've had exemplary service from Cory, Cady, Justin and especially Brianda, they have all gone above and beyond in being helpful and attentive. (I know I've forgotten some names that also deserve a mention.... sorry).
Favorites: Corned beef reuben, French onion soup, open-face Prime Rib sandwich, Carrot cake
So-so: Pastrami sandwich - too crisp for my taste (management promptly took it off our bill and offered a replacement free of charge.)
Outside patio is loud at night with a music venue nearby but hey, you're in Vegas not a library!

I must say I have been to every major hotel in Las Vegas and you probably know how hard it is to get the best food so efficiently sometimes. I'm here at the JC K jewelry show and I must eat quick and I must eat good and healthy and with a lot of taste yes that's what I like and I have happen to find that for my morning take in my lunch and also dinner if I'm not going to fancy restaurant here at the citizens the service is fast the food is delicious and extremely well prepared from the Apple cinnamon muffin which is my favorite to the kale salad which has an anonymous amount of taste try it you'll be addicted.

Sorry, sometimes you got to be honest on a review.  The waiter was great, very attentive and at one point seemed like he was going to sit down with us to tell us about every item on the menu - maybe he was new.  The first hint was during a conference with 30,000 people this place had tons of open tables.  Food was not so great at dinner - ribs were not great, wings were not great, rice bowl was not great, fries were not great, get the picture?  I guess it's better for breakfast in the AM but there isn't much else open either at that time of day.  Bar looked well stocked, I will give them that.  Pricey for what it was, I think the hotel should tear this out and make a bigger Starbucks, they would have happier customers.  Sorry, go in for a drink or coffee and you'll be fine - avoid the food.
Great place for lunch, yummy food and yummy drinks! I definitely recommend the mahi mahi tacos, the fish was cooked to perfection!

Please do not go here. Worst food ever, and worse yet it is way overpriced. Paid 7.50 for frozen fries and another 11 for a soggy kale salad. Everything else on our table was horrible. Just do yourself a favor and go elsewhere or just go to sleep.

Good and filling food at a reasonable Las Vegas price. Service was friendly and delivered food in a reasonable amount of time. Sufficient enough choices to meet almost any taste buds. 

I recommend you sit outside and eat as that will allow you the entertainment of people watching as you enjoy your food.

Stayed at the Mandalay and ate here for most meals. The food is delicious and most of the staff pleasant but I have to agree with another reviewer that the bartender was unpleasant, if the same one? I think she had a nose ring or some other facial piercing. Asked for a Diet Coke and she asked if Pepsi was ok and I said no thank you and she gave me a sour look. I don't like Pepsi, ok!? At any rate, the food is delicious, juices are also great (9 bucks a pop though, no surprise there for LV).

I hate overly priced restaurants. But when you are hankerin for something to eat and you are 25 stories up, overly priced doesn't seem so bad. This is a decent place to get a late nite bite or treat at Mandalay Bay. And for that only I give it 3 stars. 

I certainly would't come here otherwise. But if I'm at Mandalay Bay I would.
The food was good, the service was good, but it is grossly overpriced. $40 for one order of French toast and one order of eggs and bacon is a bit silly.
Great grilled mahi mahi tacos.   Available to sit at bar even at busy time    Bartender was very helpful and informative.  Nice atmosphere in Mandalay Bay very relaxed vibe
Food was disgusting and way overpriced. And the interior is very bland and ugly. Very uncomfortable seating. Diner style feel with shitty food. $40 for unflavored chicken. Blahh!!'

The food is very bland. Very very bland. It's all fresh, but not a whole lot of flavor. I added some salt and thought that is maybe what was missing. Then it was just salty and bland.
Sat at the bar this most recent time. A friend joined me about halfway through. I finished eating and was given my check so I paid it. That must have meant "beat it" because then I was ignored when I asked for a refill on my coffee and a refill on my water. Given the breakfast options that were available, this seemed like a good idea, and it still may be the only decent option.

Great breakfast place, although awfully pricey. They make a solid California omelette that'll keep you feeling well fed for hours, which is great because if you're traveling for work it'll also eat up a good chunk of your per diem. I ordered juice and coffee also and believe I was at $25 before tip.

Fish and chips were plain and  fries were soggy. BBQ ribs were more flavorful than the fish and chips but doesn't compare to other places. Ordered a lemonade and the cups were beyond dirty and when I asked for another cup because of how dirty it was, he came back with another cup but it was just as dirty as if he took a washcloth and rubbed off the dirt. Beyond disgusted. Wouldn't come back. The bill was a whopping $65 for some plain food.

This was just so so for me.  I would have expected it to be better since the look and feel of it is really nice.  The girl at the counter that helped us seemed to hate her job though.  She wasn't at all polite or interested, as if we were bother her.  

I ordered soup and a sandwich to go.  As soon as I left I realized there wasn't a spoon for the soup in the bag so I went back.  When I asked for a spoon she told me I'd have to wait for her to get more from the box.  She then spent the next 10 minutes messing around with making someone else food.  

In the end the "box" she needed was right next to her.  I waited until my soup was almost cold to get a spoon.  Seriously ?  This was by far the worst experience of my trip.

The food was good

Over all good.

Pro:
We took 2 Ultimate Breakfast which comes with, 3 pancakes, 2eggs, sausage and potato, and 3 lemonade.  Slightly Pricy for Breakfast $70, but does have a Good Portion, Tasty and Filling.  


Con:
I also took One Single Order - Over Easy Egg, and was charged $4 for 1 egg.  What???
Do not order additional items, go with an extra regular breakfast item on the menu.

Good food and good service...
The only restaurant open when your arrived after midnight.

Have to say Raquel was awesome, was helpful courtesy and definitely fun to be around. We really appreciate the time and service not to mention the foid was outstanding .Will definitely be coming back!

Decor: Loved the inside Decor, it had a clean slick modern feel. With a twist of sweet home Alabama meets Downtown Boston feel to it. (I've been feeling a little theatrically lately #SorryNotSorry) 

Beer: It was a hot day so I decided to have the All American comfort meal & what better way than to top it off with a nice summer Ale. Since I was in Nevada I thought the Sierra Nevada Kellerweis was my best bet. This was the best part of my meal. Served bottled with an empty tall glass that tasted like Beer on tap. Super crisp and refreshing exactly what I wanted. It tasted like a cool summer day.

Lunch:
My All American comfort meal the Blue Beat, included Blue Cheese, Red Wine Mushrooms & Cherry Peppers. Although the burger was cooked to perfect (medium rare). I felt this burger lacked sauce, it was very dry and hard to eat. The mushrooms were barely sauteed almost raw. I felt like something was missing. The fries were delicious, fluffy almost like truffle fries. They were served in this cute basket. 

Overall I'd come back for the beer & fries. It's not at the top of my list but if I was starving I wouldn't mind coming back.

I always come here when I am loaded since anything taste good when you are loaded. I order the same damn item, the Chicken Club Sandwich and Seasoned Fries. It's on point. If you are staying at Mandalay Bay or Delano, this would be your only late night spot to grub at. Unless you want diarehea cause you can run your fat ass across the street for Panda Express or Mc Donald's.

Room service always takes over an hour and it's overpriced. Believe it or not, the food from here and room service is the SAME S%$#. Service is pretty awsome considering the waiters always deal with annoying people that can't even sit up. 

They have what most American type eaterys offer, you know....Burger and Sandwiches. You can also pick up something togo quicly since there are pre made sandwiches located at the togo counter, duh. You will also fine a varity of random sweets and yogurts. 

You have the option of sitting outdoor or indoor. I prefer outdoor cause I like to make fun of others while eating. It is very entertaining actually, it's similar to that of a zoo.
Slow as molasses in an igloo. A line of ten deep took 25 minutes to go through. Also severely overpriced. $25 for a pre-made panini, two croissants and a bottle of water ($5!) yikes.
This was a very inefficient operation that doesn't represent the Mandalay Bay brand well. There were many people working, a lot of activity, many customers waiting and not a lot of results.

My review is not really for Dinner at Citizens, we sat on the 'patio' with a bunch of friends and had coffee and dessert....which was delicious! 

The staff was really fun and friendly. Service was fast, and we all enjoyed our choices!

What more can you ask for while sitting in a casino with friends?

Conveniently located in Mandalay Bay, always a warm welcome from the staff. Raika was the hostess at the front as I observed the menu from outside, she sold me with a simple welcome and smile. When I'm hungry I don't like the process of going somewhere and sitting down for an hour before I get my food. Citizens is an excellent "fast food" choice with quality food and several healthy options. Open 24 hours have a seat or grab a sandwich to go. Competitive prices and outstanding good an staff. I just may take a ride down there now.

YUM! my first time trying this place out! my colleague and i had a long day of working at the trade show and didn't have anything to eat except for mini appetizers and lots of drinks. we ended up eating here at 9:30/10PM. 

we were seated right away even though they were really busy. we sat on the outside of the restaurant. I kind of wish we sat somewhere quiet because we were shouting at each other when were were talking. 

i got the mahi mahi fish tacos. and i highly recommend that! it comes with 3 crunchy tacos. sauce was good. 

service was great. our water and wine glass was always filled. 

i like how we can charge the bill to our rooms!
What a great place to eat and its 24 hours Ever wanna check out Light Nightclub first nightclub inspired by cirque du SOLEI Let me know and I will take care of you 702.809.9045

We ate here a few times during our last visit to the Mandalay property and as always the food was great. Most of the portions are large enough to split, so keep that in mind and ask your server if you are unsure. The sandwiches are tasty, we usually stop in and grab something to go to take to the pool but Thursday after we checked in we decided to eat at the restaurant. Honestly we've had way better service and the waitress had a bit of an attitude but I think she may have been a little overwhelmed with the amount of tables she was waiting on. Plus she had to deal with a few people who purchased food at the take out counter then decided it was ok to sit in the restaurant - I blame the hostess for this, neither seemed to know what they were doing. I can't remember what sandwich we ordered but we asked to split it and we each got our own fries - no split there! We also ordered the mixed green salad and the white balsamic dressing was fantastic. With the sandwich, salad and two drinks I think our bill was a little over $20. We also stopped in for breakfast one morning, the omelet was a disappointment so just skip that all together. No flavor, weird texture, not worth the $$$. My husband ordered the French Toast and that was amazing, it came with an orange flavored whip cream that was light, citrusy and paired well with the French Toast and berries. 

To sum this up:
1. make the walk back from the pool and get take out. trust me you'll be happier with this then ordering food from the pool. 
2. Most items can be split
3. Skip the omelet, order the French Toast

What a great place for breakfast! I had the egg & potato skillet, which was tasty & nicely presented (in a skillet of course). There was no wait & the food came out in a reasonable time. The cappuccino was good, but had a burnt chocolate taste towards the end. The to-go line was long, but looks like it's a popular place among visitors.

Stopped by at 7:38am asking for a travel for three at a restaurant that seats about 250. There are 37 total people here and the won't seat me even through my colleagues will arrive at 8:00. After reasonable requests to two indifferent hostesses, Shawn the manager was asked to stop by. After explaining a late arrival and the desire to start on a report, and asking Shawn to use his discretion and he was really offended when I asked him to use his judgement. No idea about the food, but considering the initial impression if service I'll make sure I repeat this interaction at least 10 times today.

We stopped in for a quick dessert and cup of coffee and it was anything but quick. The staff was not very friendly and the wait was simply unacceptable. 20 minutes for a piece of mediocre chocolate cake. I am willing to wait in a long line and pay extra for good service and great food, but not this. Don't waste your time and money!

We just had a very nice dinner with two salads and one dessert at citizens! Although all food was good, I have to highlight the Quinoa salad- it was THE BEST!  The service also was excellent. Kevin knows how to make guests feel welcome!! Thank you :)

This is basically a counter style food place.  Everything is fairly fresh but all pre-packaged. The coffee selections are oddly named but the coffee is decent.  My son did not like the tuna salad at all but scarfed down an apple cinnamon muffin easily enough. My Cobb salad was chintzy with the good stuff and used iceberg lettuce, ack. 

It filled the need but barely.

Food was good. My wife ordered potato salad with her sandwich and got French fries ... We ordered the potato skin appetizer which came out well after we already received our main dishes. They were over cooked and dry. The chicken club sandwich was good... When we were ready, the waiter took forever to bring us our check... About 20 minutes we waited just to get out of there. Not bad food but not the best service.

Me:" do you serve breakfast food?"
Rude hostesses:"no it's brunch, look at this menu"
** hands me a menu of ONLY breakfast food items**
I know that brunch is a combination of lunch and breakfast but if I'm asking if you serve breakfast food just say "yes" and don't make me feel like an idiot for your lack of social skills and common sense to understand what I'm literally asking. I had a party of 4 and we all were confused and put off by this weird altercation that it actually made us laugh for 15 minutes. Oh and my eggs Benedict was $18 which I thought was also hilarious.

Really overpriced food! I really wouldn't mind the prices if the food was worth it, but my Brick Chicken was too dry and seriously wasn't worth 24 dollars. The portion for that thing was too small. 

Go somewhere else to get better food in Vegas. Even when the place was empty the food took forever to come out!

This real estate used to be the Burger Bar...

But 10am hungers could be just for breakfast foods now. Vegas is known for its edgy entertainment, gaudy bling, and top notch reviewed eaterys. Despite that flashy sign, this one is average, and I will only wonder what that Burger at 10am would have tasted like.

Lox and cream cheese, side of hashbrowns: Nice platter, medium smoked salmon, nice smooth shreddable texture, just enough to cover that not so thick plain bagel. Need more cream cheese - the design squares are nice, but not functional. Easy on the red onions was good, and a nice pile of capers is always good too. Maybe it was the not typical squirt of lemon from me, but the usual salty flavors weren't there in harmony as usual.

SIde of hashbrowns was nice. Perfect portion sized tater tot crumbled hash nicely mixed with peppers.

Nice but not glamorous or creative, and the taste is what you'd expect, but my novice could do this at home, and have, which is why I shouldn't pay to eat this out.
Overpriced,  mediocre food. Should have walked over to Luxor's 24 hr. cafe instead.

Visited both in the evening and in the morning. I love that they make fresh juices here. Well that is where the love ends. Slower than molasses running up hill and would it kill the staff to smile? I did not see one person working there who appeared to be happy they where employed. Such a promising place but dreadful.

Once you get past the cold, unfriendly hostesses (and sole reason for the 2 stars) the food is delicious and the wait staff is fantastic. If you hate your job, especially if you are the first person a potential client interacts with at an establishment, pretend to love it. We went there twice and after dealing with those girls, we avoided it the rest of our stay, and cant say we would ever go back because we aren't into feeling like we are a bother when we pay a good amount of money to eat somewhere.

Normally I receive great service here. But not today. Ingrid is too young (or acts too immature) for the position behind the register. I walked up, no one else in line and Ingrid and her co-worker didn't say one word at first. Not a "hello" or "welcome", just glared at me. Then after she finally decided to ask if I needed anything, I said "I just have a question, do you have chicken fingers?"  She seemed so bothered that she had to help me. This girl had no personality whatsoever. So I ordered two more things, and I was done with my order. I explained that I worked at Mandalay, to get my discount and she seemed even more annoyed about that. My tab was super cheap, and I asked if she got my order right, as I always spend at least $20 or more, because it was only $10. I was happy about the price, but wanted to make sure it was correct, because I had no faith in this person because of the lack of service to begin with. 
So I had her repeat what I ordered, she seemed annoyed.  Wow, I can't believe that it's so inexpensive, I told her. I also told I always spend a lot more. She just didn't get it, didn't get that I was being friendly and making small talk. She said "I gave you your discount, it's $2". I got that I explained and was just surprised it was so cheap. She said "I'm sorry ..."   Why is she sorry?  No idea. It was a weird experience. I was excited about the price and that it was much lower. "Well, it is from the kids menu". Oh okay, got it. 

Lmao. Get a personality Ingrid. And then don't continue to stair at people as they wait for their food. Then a manager with blonde hair came out and he stared at me. Did they think I was a celebrity or were they really just assholes?  Lol. Bad customer service no matter how you slice it  

The food here is good, but the chicken fingers tasted either like dish soap or freezer burn. Don't get them, even for your kids. The chicken noodle is amazing.

$42 for a small take out lunch for two of two caprese sandwiches, a kale salad, and a water. They were out of the ingredients for the PB&j for the entire week of our stay, and the caprese took 10+ min to make because they had to "go downstairs to get the mozzarella." What? Why do you not have the ingredients on hand to make take out items? Food was mediocre too. Huge disappointment after getting excited about the menu. :(
Mind-bendingly slow service without a smile. Definitely not coming back here in a hurry

We wound up eating here more than we meant to because of its location in Mandalay Bay and because it is open all night long. During our trip we ate here three times, once for breakfast, once for lunch and once at 4am..don't even know what you call that meal-- drunkfest? 

For lunch I had the turkey burger which was about $20. It was nothing special but not terrible either. The cocktails we had at lunch were pretty decent. 

Breakfast we had waffles and eggs... its hard to screw those up. 

At 4am I don't recall exactly what we were eating.. I think it was probably waffles and french fries. The point is, they were open at 4 am and serving the entire menu! We couldn't get room service at the Delano at that time so Citizens saved us. 

In sum, this place isn't fancy or all that great food-wise. It's basically like a diner (just more expensive than your average diner). I wouldn't eat dinner here but for a casual breakfast or lunch its just dandy.
Love Citizens. It's a reasonably priced place to eat at Mandalay Bay if you just want food and aren't looking for a particular vibe. Good food and decent service. Worth checking out.
This was the perfect venue for my meetings during the Black Hat conference.  I received outstanding service from my waitress, Chelsea, and I will definitely keep this place in mind next year.

We stopped in after seeing the Michael Jackson ONE show and everything was fantastic. The server was very attentive and the food off the charts good. I had a chicken Caesar salad and it was the best I've ever eaten. With a slight citrus spin, the salad was amazing.

Oh my gosh is all I can say about the grilled cheese patty melt that we got.I was only able to eat half of it. It was too full grilled cheese sandwiches with a great beef patty and caramelized grilled onions in it. Oh the grilled cheese sandwiches also had great slices of tomato inside of them and a patty melt itself had lettuce shreds inside of it. My wife had the same thing and we both knew this flavor from something else. Then all of a sudden it hit us - - please anybody doublecheck this going forward, but this grilled cheese patty melt taste almost exactly like an In-and-Out Burger Double Double. The service was good and attentive. Oh, I almost forgot we had the fried calamari as an appetizer and it was ok. The only real complaint was that the sandwich was extremely messy to eat and hard to control. With the size this thing there's no way around it. My wife's pickle spear was huge compared to the anorexic pickle spear that I got, just sayin'.
Delicious sandwiches! Great fresh juice selections. Convenient location for a quick bite.
$25.00 for a stale tiny chicken pot pie! Stay away from this place its a sucky rip off!!!
Quick service and the food was delicious. Had a huge breakfast and didn't have to break the bank to pay for it!

My favorite thing about this place?  It's open 24 hours!!  It's pretty awesome when your in Vegas knowing you'll be up all night and hungry at any time.  

It's basic comfort food so nothing to adventurous.  I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad and dang it was a freaking huge portion!  There were 5 different portions to it and was separated by avocado slices.  The waiter was very helpful to the table and it was excellent service.

Great breakfast fresh smoothie! Ordered a fruit bowl. At these prices I'd expect organic produce - no such luck. Also there was such a huge line of convention attendees (myself included) trying to get to our booths on time and only one staff member taking orders in their take away line and only one person actually fulfilling the orders. A needlessly long wait ensued!!! Smoothie was great though.

A nice late night alternative in Las Vegas. Delicious healthy kale salad and a nice selection of home town deliciacies. Open 24 hrs     A enormous brownie sundae seals the deal. Ask for Chris for real good service.very good pricing and value for Vegas standards
Can't give it a zero damn got seated with 2 other tables full and could not get service after 15 minutes and there were plenty of employees and servers working really wanted to try the food.

We come from Philadelphia for Thanksgiving every year.  We always make a stop at this restaurant for some healthy and delicious food!  It is a little pricey but worth the price for the delicious breakfast!

I was staying at the Mandalay Bay for a conference so I came here quite a few times during the week. It was one of the closest food spots next to the conference rooms. It also was one of the few full menu places in Mandalay that stayed open late. Surprisingly most of the food spots shut down at around midnight. 

Citizens was a bit of a hit and miss. Two of the four times I came it was great. The other two were just ok. I liked that they had 3 sections (bar, restaurant and counter). The counter was a quick line that basically had sandwich, salad, coffee and other quick items available for immediate purchase. This was convenient for conference breaks as I was able to just run over, grab some pre-made foods and coffee before heading back. The restaurant and bar were nice for late night dinners. We came here twice to eat at the restaurant portion. The food was ok. The only thing I ordered here that I hated was the mixed green salad. The leaves were very bitter and the dressing was sub-par. Most of the other dishes we ordered were good, but nothing stood out as extraordinary. 

Everything here was overpriced. As I mentioned it's a convenient spot and it's open late so they're able to get away with the prices... But don't expect the quality to match the price.

The service was on and off. We had one server who was great. The barista and employees behind the counter were also good. But we also had a server who was terrible. But overall it had decent service.  

The number one thing this place has going for them is the convenience of location and hours.

Great play to stop by and eat. We went around lunch time. We ordered the artichoke spinach dip which was amazing! Definitely recommend trying! Also tried the balboa steak sandwich , fancy for a French dip. Very good! Service was great too.  Overall an enjoyable place to sit and eat good food.

I really like Citizens at Mandalay Bay Hotel!  

We ordered the following for a light lunch:

- Grilled Vege Sandwich - Really delicious - lots of thinly sliced grilled vege with intermittent mozarella cheese (boconcini) and a wonderful extra virgin oilve oil based dressing - I loved it and will come back for more!
- Chicken Noodle Soup - very tasty chicken noodle soup for a light lunch - comes with  crackers with a wad of butter between the 2 crackers - neat!
- Ruben Sandwich - very scrumptious with lots of meat and sauerkraut
- Spring Mix Salad - fresh greens salad

Restaurant is open 24/7.

Wait service was prompt and quick and served with a smile.  :o)

Best place to eat at Mandalay! Split a meal with someone. Served in two separate plates and plenty of food! Fresh and delicious! We always eat here when in Vegas. Chicken club sandwich is a favorite for lunch or dinner. Ultimate breakfast was great too! Both were plenty share with my husband! Try it. You won't be disappointed!
Great decor. Chunky monkey drink was great!  Food was better than average. Service has been below average - poor the last two times we visited.

I wasnt that impressed with Citizens. The service was really slow and the food was eh. The restaurant is located in the Mandalay Bay right across from Light. The decor is nice and casual with a pretty open floor plan. There are big windows that allow you to people watch while you eat. We went there twice because they are the only place open 24 hrs. Before the club I had the chicken penne. The penne was cooked perfectly but the sauce to pasta ratio was way off, the penne was swimming. After the club I had the fish and chips. The cod is nice and large but its the breading that killed the dish for me. The cod was beer battered but there was so much beer in the batter, it made my fish taste like fried bud light. Way too over powering to finish not even hot sauce could save it. Id go back if in Vegas again but I would just try my luck with other items.

Went from a good place to eat and relax to a garbage of a place! Management here sucks! worthless, and have no respect for their customers or basic knowledge of their own menu. Never eating here again! SAVE MONEY, TIME, AND A HEADACHE BY JUST GOING TO THE 7-Eleven ACROSS THE STREET!

Another example of subpar service at a Mandalay Bay restaurant. 

I stopped by for lunch with a friend, and we found seats at the bar. The bartender barely even tried to fake friendliness, and proceeded to mess up an order that consisted of 2 salads. Luckily, the server who actually brought food to us was accommodating and fixed the order.

The salad was on par with what you would get at a Chili's, but cost twice as much. Nothing special to see here, folks.

Not sure what all the other hater comments are about but I liked this place so much I went twice during my stay at Mandalay Bay. The first time I was looking for some breakfast food in the hotel to bring back to the wife who was still sleeping in the room. This place was perfect!  They had a great breakfast menu that you can get to-go to include espresso drinks. The wait for the food isn't too bad. The price is reasonable considering you are at a Vegas resort. They have several smoothie options and their sandwiches are stuffed with lots of meat. Check this place out if you are staying at Mandalay Bay and don't feel like going to one of the pricier restaurants.

I have been here multiples times and I've become more and more disappointed every time I decide to come here.  I always order over the phone so that the food would be ready. Over the phone would be great if they answered their phones.  I've tried three times to place phone orders, the first time after 43 min of calling and getting the hotel involved they would not answer their phone, I ended up driving down there to place my order.  Second time I came here I decided to try calling again. Yayyyy they picked up the phone...then put me on hold... an hour and 38 min later I drove down still being on hold to show them that no one is answering and that I was on hold for an hour and 38 min.  I spoke with the manager (Shawn) and  he apologized and said there must be something wrong with the phones.  I called as he was standing there and voila they worked fine.  Weird.  Today a month later, I decided to try my luck one more time.  Driving past state line I called and someone answered the phone yayyyyy... NOPE. Again placed on hold and drove all the way to the Mandalay again to show the same manager that I've been on hold 38 min.    He apologized and again gave me there must be something wrong with the phone schpeal.  Tried calling while standing there and holy cow the phones worked.   When I was on hold all of these times I tried calling on three way to see if they would pick up and the phone just rang and rang. 

Back to today, I placed my order to be told they are all out of the bread that my 5 sandwiches come on..  I asked for a croissant instead and a girl named  Heather said you need to pay extra for that.  Super condescending and rude.  The only one that handled this professionally was Sarah.  Jessica decided to come to me and directly  say you need to move your bags(the food) they just brought out to me off the counter.  She argued in front of the customers and two other customers stated that the customer service is horrible.  Was this girl for real??? After everything I've been put through she is raising her voice in front of other guest and telling me to move my food bags in a condescending voice.  Ughhh.  So sad the food is really good here but they need to clean house and hire staff that knows how to work with guests.  Thanks Sarah for your help!   Shawn the manager just kind of looked at me glossy eyed  both times I spoke to him so I'm not sure he's going to address the issues at hand.  Some how the staff acted as if I was in the wrong here.  Please citizens get it together. Mandala is an amazing place this restaurant should be ran with the same customer service as the place it's in.   So sad

i made the mistake of ordering the pasta prosuttio. took 3 bites the( pasta over cooked the meat undercooked and the sauce watery thin not thick like is should be) and asked for the check . asked for the mgr on duty  waitrer says he isn't in right now he is out of the restaurant. the waiter never even offered a replacement.
0 for 3 come on- its sad when the highlight is I got the faster drink refill ever

We ordered food from their cafe's counter. When we sat down at one of their tables, a server came to tell us that, because we didn't order directly from a server, we couldn't sit at a table. 95% of their tables were completely free. The server then reiterated "you have to leave"

Save your money for somewhere that doesn't kick out its customers.

Server was horrible!! My friend ordered waffle fries with his Classic Burger and received regular fries. When questioned where his waffle fries were, the server explained that they were out. Would have been nice to learn that earlier!

I ordered potato salad with my Baconator Burger. I requested the burger to be cooked medium. The server explained that the Baconator was just like the Classic Burger except with "bacon, bacon, and more bacon." That sounded great to me, which is why I ordered it.

The burger was not at all what I expected. First, the server simply dropped our food off and scurried away quickly. He didn't check in on us until half of our food was gone.

Next, I never received my potato salad. Instead, I received plain fries like my friend did.

Third, the bacon was not thick or piled on like I expected. I received 4 thin slices, that's it!!

Last, my burger was overcooked! I ordered medium and was given a chewy charred burger.

This place has some major improvements to make before I ever go back!

It's nice that it is open late and that things are premade so it can be a quick grab and go, but it also is annoying that things are premade because you cannot customize anything. I don't like mayo and unfortunately every premade sandwich has mayo. I got the cous cous salad (twice). It was pretty good, although probably not worth the $12. Just veggies and cous cous, no meat at all. Something you could get at a deli or supermarket for like $4. 
 
They have breakfast sandwiches too. I didn't have them, but I get the feeling they'd be descent.

Ate at bar. Bartender / server Raquel could care less.  No sense of hospitality. No greeting. No eye contact. Not that busy. Not even basic Waffle House service. As a local our visitors deserve much better and there are people here who need jobs and could easily make a better impression. Who trained and supervises the staff here?
** UPDATE 2/10/14 **
Within a few days both the bartender and GM wrote to me directly with their sincere apologies and regrets for this lapse in service. While you would expect this of the GM, for the bartender to do this independently is a very stand up thing to do.  Both showed integrity and pride in their work in doing so.  I'm a local and will go back on my own (no comps) in the near future and see if this was an isolated incident or not.

This place is overpriced and has meh service.   I ordered the croissant BLT and Turkey.  It was dry and just tasted boring compared to to others. It was expensive $17 for a sandwich.  The burger was also dry. Service was slow and not very enthusiastic.
The two hosteses in the front were not friendly at all.

Now what is it about Vegas that makes you feel like you're constantly looking at a rear-view mirror? "Objects in the mirror appear closer than they are." Everything's bigger when I'm there, including my appetite once Jamie W. and I settled into a comfortable junior suite at Mandalay Bay. After a long drive and just before Jamie arrived, I was feeling mighty peckish but recognized dining options at a pricey resort are not so inclusive of solitary cheapskates like me. As I strolled among the restaurants and the hostesses in their strapless gowns, I came upon Citizens which turned out to be a slightly upscale 24-hour diner and bar. It's about three years old, so I wasn't familiar with the place.

I took a look at the menu and noticed it was all-American comfort food with Vegas prices. I have to say I was starving since I had not eaten since an early morning breakfast at SFO airport. The $15 Caesar sounded good to me, but I didn't want to use up room in my belly reserved for meat. The server offered a small version for $5, which was frankly quite abundant by itself with plenty of romaine drenched in a lemon garlic dressing topped with a Parmesan crisp (photo: http://bit.ly/21GGabO). It wasn't an artful plate but it certainly hit the spot. Now back to the size thing I was alluding to before. I decided to throw caution to the wind and ordered the $36 Citizens Prime Rib Dinner, oh yes, by far the most expensive thing on the menu.

What came out was a sizable cut of beef on the rare side but slow roasted apparently for 18 hours. It was satisfying enough with a nice crust though not as juicy or laden with au jus as I was hoping. There was a bit of sour cream on the side though surprisingly no horseradish. I should have asked for it, but the place was starting to hop at that hour. It came with a loaded baked potato heavy with a molten cheddar though the spud itself was a tad on the lukewarm side, while the steamed broccoli turned out to be one chewy stalk that required a sawing motion to get it into digestible portions (photo: http://bit.ly/1pnnNuG). I couldn't finish the meat, so I took the rest back to the room where there was serious gnawing throughout the weekend.

FOOD - 3 stars...hits the spot when you're hungry and portions are abundant (consider the prices) but nothing really transcended
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...spacious enough for a resort restaurant
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...servers buzz around a lot but pay attention when it matters
TOTAL - 3 stars...definitely a more reasonably priced option anytime you want it at Mandalay Bay

I was staying at Mandalay Bay for a work conference and this spot was one of restaurants downstairs among the many others.  Walked around checking all the restaurants out and this one seemed totally casual and a good place to grab a beer, plus it had the shortest wait time.  
They don't do reservations, so it's first come, first eat.  

Nice décor inside, relaxing, place felt comfy and welcoming for all. Menu looked pretty good with burgers, sandwiches, salads, some signature entrees and a bonus that they serve breakfast all day. My coworkers and I ordered a round of drinks first, they too have a nice beer list, cocktails and wine list to get you going.  

We decided to get some potato skins as an appetizer and it was pretty good, thick cut potato wedge with some bacon sprinkled on top and of course melty cheese on top with green onions. 
You get 4 per order with guac, sour cream and pico.  We were quite hungry so we devoured it in minutes.  

As for my main, I got the Mahi Tacos, 3 grilled Mahi pieces with all the normal fixin's such as pico de gallo, cabbage and avocado slices. Served with their usual friends of guac, sour cream and more pico. Fish was nicely cooked and good sized pieces and flavorful.  Anything with avocado or guacamole makes it that much better.  

Forgot what my coworkers ordered but they enjoyed their first Vegas meal very much. Stayed a bit longer to have a few more drinks so no room for dessert.  

Staff was fine, quite friendly, attentive and quick and helpful with making suggestions. No issues with our dining experience. If you don't want to sit in the dining room, there is a counter/walk up area where you can order to go. They are open 24/7 so this may be a good late night option before going back to your room to pass out.

I was just in Vegas for a convention and after a long day on my feet I decided to grab a quick bite and head back to rest my body. On the way to my room at Luxor I stopped by at Citizens. 

We sat down right away and the waiter greeted us and got us drinks. He came back a few times but we weren't ready yet, but I appreciate that kind of service. When we did order I got the half chicken over mashed potatoes. The chicken was pretty good and moist and it came with a generous helping of potatoes and also a ginormous head of broccoli which was good. On top of that I ordered a side of brown rice to fill me up because eat larabars all day couldn't fill me up. The food itself was a 3.5-4 not knock your socks off but not terrible. What pulled this down to a 3 was the amount of time the food took to come out considering the place was relatively empty when we were there. I think the chef forgot our order. They actually sent out a Caesar salad to apologize so that was a nice gesture, would rather have had them discount the meal given I'm not eating the creamy dressings on salads anymore. 

Hey if you need a quicker meal, you don't want to pay $80 for a salad and Le Fluer then give Citizens a shot, I'm sure the food order being overlooked isn't common and I'd change he review in the future if so.

Great food, huge portions, weird servers. 
The disco fries are worth trying. The nachos, fish and chips and sandwiches are all enormous but actually very good. Love the steak fries with the fish and chips. 
Our server was a little strange and touchy...made some people feel uncomfortable.

Got appetizers here with my girlfriend at 1 in the morning after failing to find a 24 hour pizza joint. The kobe chili was excellent, and the calamari was good as well. The chorizo queso was too salty and had a weird texture.

Ive been here before, days when i wasnt yelping, and i remember food was good.  Family and I needed to come down this way to check into Cisco Live and decided to stop by and eat lunch.  This place also has a nice bakery and a full bar.  So you can have a nice dinner with cocktails or beer, then head up to the bakery for dessert!
I was really disappointed this time.  I ordered the tuna melt and wife ordered the chili.  The tuna melt was dry and the rye bread didnt mix well with the tuna.  The chili had no sauce.  It looked and tasted like a chunk of meat.
I dont know....maybe ill try breakfast here and see how it compares with lunch, but do i want to spend another 100 bucks to get a bleh meal???  I guess you will have to follow me to find out!  Im here in vegas till July 15, so we'll see.

Came in for appetizers in the afternoon. We ordered the calamari and meatball appetizers and they were so good it was totally worth it! Both dishes were big enough for three of us to share. Would definitely come back for these!!

Citizens is very convenient if you are staying at The Mandalay Bay.  Two of the best dishes are the 
Chicken Noodle Soup and the Fish Tacos.
Open 24 hours, perfect for late night munchies. I've tried most items on the menu and so far I've been pretty happy with them. Will keep on coming for sure!

What a treat this place was!  HIdden in the pancreas of the Mandalay Bay.  A great place for breakfast, lunch or a snack between drinks at 5 AM and dinner at 6 PM.  The chili was to DIE for.  Very mild with chunks of premium beef.  Tasted devine with sour cream.  The waffle cut fries were delicious and arrived in this cute little basket thing.  Which actually seem to be like the thing to do in Vegas now.  Must be a hipster chef thing.

The chicken wings were WAY spicy but my husband enjoyed them.

I really like this place for a quick treat.  Staff was great.

Be sure to take home a candy apple to eat while you watch a movie.
Lovely place..Came here 3 days in a row and never disappointed..Loved the way Glen and Chris served..Amazing food..Good quantity..do recommend
I was in love with this place. We ate here 3 times in our Vegas weekend and loved everything we tried. The bacon burger was my favorite. I will go back when I go back to Vegas.

Great service! Great food! The servers are very nice. 
They have many good juices to try. 
The tots were out of this world. Worth a try. I loved them. Coming back soon!
The food was amazing and the server was so helpful and promp...had an awesome experience...will recommend to all my friends and I will be a returnng costumer.....

Ate at this place a couple of times during our stay in Vegas.  Food at the sit down restaurant was good but it took forever to come out.  The Bar was ok.  The bakery items did not taste too fresh.  The good thing about the Bar is it is open 24 hours so it is nice to be able to eat at any time.

I'm only giving this place an extra star for the spinach dip because it was reeeally good. I got the pasta and didn't even take a bite of it because it smelled so bad. The other people in my party tasted it and said it was gross. The chicken quesadilla was bland, the fish tacos were SUUUUPER fishy and the tortillas were mushy. The burger was dry and came out twenty minutes after another person in our party's chicken sandwich. And to top it off, the waiter was rude. The manager was kind enough to take off a whopping twenty percent of our bill for food most of us didn't even eat. Won't be going back.

I normally don't review many things but I have to say the food was great!  However, the bartender was extremely unpleasant and even expressed her "unpleasantness" to her fellow co-workers in front of her guests. 

What should have been a great meal and experience was ruined by a sour attitude. Maybe she was having a bad day???
Our rodeo girls group and me sitting here now having breakfast of variety. All excellent and same service. Did not take long to get either, with the busy crowd.

Never would have thought you could get such amazing customer service at 130am this Resturant has the looks and taste that we all deserve. The food was amazing and beer selection was just what I like the scenery of lovely ladies all around you that are just leaving club Light was a plus but not at good as my food lol Definitely coming back I recommend trying any of there burgers or steak or really anything on the menu. Awesome
The hostess seated us fairly quickly, and I like the outside tables. Our waiter was rude, and didn't really take care of us, but it's open 24-7. Important in VEGAS.

Food is decent. Visited this restaurant on two separate occasions and the management should fire them selves. There's absolutely no leadership. All of the waitstaff run around like chickens with their heads chopped off. There's Apsley no organization whatsoever. Fail!!!

The food was ok.  Well maybe.  After taking my $35 they told me I could not eat in the place.  They had me leave.  I promptly returned the viscous salad to the unapologetic which manning the payment station.  Tell people they can't find there before taking their money.  Also hire a few people that handle this crap better than a 24/7 McD.

I went here for lunch and it was very good. I ordered a cheese burger and their fries with some green tea. their fries were the best fries I've ever tasted, the burger was a bit dry but it was still very good. My mom got the lamb burger with the mashed potatoes and she absolutely loved it. She went back a 2nd time to get the lamb burger because it was so good! The only thing that I can't even call in issue it was just something that was a bit annoying was our waiter talked very quiet and seemed kinda out of it, like he had a hangover or something so we had to keep repeating or selves when we ordered and he asked the same questions a few times after we already answered him.

I've decided to hold off this review because I wanted to come here a couple of times to make sure it was just because I was starving. The food is decent, but massively over-priced, but it is open 24hrs. Large portions, make it easy to do a tapas style meal. Order a couple of appetizers and get a salad and you get a pretty decent meal without having to gorge yourself on one entree.

OK service, decent menu selection, and they have pastries, and smoothies. Try it out.

Mediocre food at best. My friends and I were desperately trying to find a restaurant in Mandalay Bay to eat at before we headed to Daylight. So we just settled for this place.
 
Food: I asked the server for recommendations and he recommended the corn beef hash skillet. Since he said it was one of the popular dishes, I took his word for it and I was so disappointed when I got it. It was lukewarm and just not good, wasted my $16 on a dish I didn't even finish. 

Service: Our server was nice and came promptly to take our orders and refill our waters throughout the time we were there. However, there was a situation that happened when we were paying. We asked for the server to split our bill by entrees and when he return with our change. My friend didn't her change back. We are generous but we weren't going to tip you $10 alright.

Definitely not a memorable dining experience for me in Vegas!

Lotus was a super waitress!  She didn't even write the order down and got our order perfect-- with six of us.

My mahi mahi tacos were excellent but I had to eat them with a fork because they were so stuffed full of food!

My husband had the meatloaf and it was the best I ever tasted.

Five stars!

Like much in Vegas, pretty on the outside, but no substance.

Ate here twice on a recent business trip. The space, redecorated from its previous goofy pseudo-diner style, is quite nice, masculine and casual yet well-appointed, with a classy bar and the now-ubiquitious but still pretty old style light bulbs. Sat at the bar and had friendly and attentive service. 

The breakfast was standard - eggs/toast/sausage/potatoes were like "diner plus" with a flavorful pepper mixed in with the potatoes and thick texas style toast. Fine. The major disappointment was dinner. I went in craving something just barely healthy (after a few days in Vegas I was desperate for a vegetable) and the main recommended entree at Citizens is a chicken/brocolli/potato plate that looked great. Unfortunately the execution was inexcusably poor, especially for a "signature" dish. The chicken was flavorless and dry, even with the skin left on. Broccoli rabe was undercooked and also flavorless, and the potato quarters were the least cooked of all, with a full half of them too hard to even cut with a fork, and inedible. Everything sat in a plate full of broth, perhaps that's in an attempt to disguize the dryness and blandless of the food, but even the broth doesn't help. Chow in San Francisco does this chicken/brussel sprouts/mashed potato dish that's just bursting with flavor and juiciness, and it's like 12 bucks. This $25 plate was just sad and pointless. Again, like so much in Vegas in general, it's an opportunity to spend twice as much on something half as good.

Probably the best value for the price of the places I ate in Las Vegas. Huge portions for comfort food in a clean and friendly atmosphere. I ended up eating here twice. The first time, got the French Onion Soup which literally was in a "cup" the size of my head. Really great flavors and hit the spot for something light, yet filling for lunch. The second time, I had the potato skins. The pico de gallo as a topping choice was great. You are still paying the Vegas premium prices, but not to the extent of other places when it comes to a hearty and filling lunch, particularly when you don't want to go to a food court.

Overpriced and mediocre- only went because I was staying at Mandalay Bay. 
3 stars for the amazing drink I had!! On the Beach 
I had fish and chips the batter was so thick that it was still raw under the top fried layer. It was huge though! 
I was pleasantly surprised by the free cheesecake with my yelp check in! It was delicious and covered with warm cherries!!!

Had the Creme Brûlée French Toast.  It was ok but not the best I've ever had.  It was tough and dry like it had been sitting for a while.  We had a table on the patio outside so the people watching was great!! The wait staff was a little slow, had to wait on refills for our coffee, which was annoying since they weren't very busy.  Convenient location when staying at Mandalay Bay but not a place I would go out of my way to visit again.

This place was just want I needed. Has a bit of everything to make everyone and any one happy.

Huge portions of food! Very good as we'll worth the price!

This place is awesome! The juice bar is my favorite thing. I had the South Beach. I also had the turkey burger which was very yummy. My friend had the fish tacos. 
Went back for the Cobb salad for dinner. This is a must try.

I'm quickly learning just how overpriced Vegas is. 

Typical hotel overpriced X 2= Vegas prices

Anyway, hungry. Want salad. So hungry regular sentences not used and speaking in passive.

Greek salad. Perfect.

$18. At this point don't care.

Take-out was super speedy,

Actually the salad was great and the ingredients were super fresh. Two varieties of tomatoes, tons of lettuce, onions, feta, red peppers, great pita chips. Literally my perfect version of greek salad.

$18...not the perfect price

Went here to meet some friends for a quick snack. Food was good. I had a marble cake and my boyfriend got a sandwich (forgot what it's called) but it's like a double cheeseburger sandwich which was so good. If it wasn't for the hostess/greeter, I would've given this place 5 stars. We were ignored when we arrived. Seems like she was busy working on some papers when she should be greeting customers. She just looked at us and continued to work on her papers. We sat down, waited for about 10 mins, nobody came to get our orders. We decided to walk up to the cashier and just ordered for to go.

I love the style of this restaurant, especially when you're in the mood for something quick and a little less expensive than some restaurants in Vegas without compromising the quality of the food. I got a fresh juice that had blueberries, kale, beet, grape, cucumber & apple in it. Juice balances me and makes me feel great. My sister got the PB&J. It was the best PB&J sandwich I've tried. The bread was sweet & soft with raisins. They definitely did not skimp on the peanut butter & jelly. Yum. I got couscous with olives & feta to get that healthy nutrition. They also have coffee and just about anything you could want, such as pasta. They are open 24 hours.

Enjoyed this place for dinner. For what we ordered, the serving was huge. Got the nachos and filled us up (2.5 people because one person only had a few bites) We didn't even need anything else really! Drinks were strong. Waitress was nice!

Elevated comfort food like a rueben, grilled cheese, burger, etc. Great service. Had the Cesar salad and chicken noodle soup. The salad was a great size and the small soup went perfectly together. All of the soup ingredients were the exactly same size so you got all the groceries in each bite.  Felt great to eat after a long weekend of indulgence. Fantastic people watching if you sit on the patio. Will return with friends.

The food was very good during dinner service in the main restaurant, and the service attendant was very prompt. The Deli area of Citizens was also very nice and convenient. During a few trips to Mandalay Bay at different hours, I would grab a quick sandwich and drink at the Citizens Deli. The deli food quality was high, and the girls working the deli counter were helpful and pleasant. I would recommend giving both the deli and the main restaurant a try.

$22 mediocre roastbeef sandwich
$18 slightly above average burger
$4 gatorade!!!
$4 mountain dew!!!
21 minute wait for to-go order

Shoulda gone with the Johnny rockets down the corridor.  A perfect storm of hunger, procrastination  and indecisiveness led us to settle for this 3 star joint on our way back through the hotel after visiting the shark reef.  Yelp don't lie.  Trust what you read and dine elsewhere.

Writing for take-out only.

The staff was friendly and remembered me after I came back the next day to order again.  

The first night we ordered the BBQ Ribs, the Truffle Cream Prosciutto Penne Pasta w/ Chicken, and Mac N Cheese.   

The BBQ ribs came at a full rack, there was so much food that it's hard to complain about but the BBQ sauce was just overwhelming with hotness and spice that I had to take some of it off the meat.  

The truffle pasta was REALLY good.  The really strong truffle scent could be smelled through the carryout tray and bag.  Each bite was so delicious.  This was really good that I had to get it again the next day.  What I found though was the consistency of the ingredients was off.  The second time I ordered this, there was far less prosciutto in the dish.  The chicken was  fine though and there were also peas which gave the pasta some color.  

The Mac N Cheese was pretty good too.  Mixed w/ ham and peas and crunchy bread crumbs on top, it was a good side dish.

While the food was not bad, the price was astronomical.  The pasta, for example, was $30 w/ chicken.   While it was enough pasta to probably feed two people, I can't help but feel bad afterwards for spending that much on one pasta in a place that's not really 'fancy'.  Of course, this is the Strip we're talking about.  So while staying at the Mandalay Bay, I suppose I'd go here again.  Otherwise, not making my way through the parking lot and crowd for this.

I don't know why this place only has 3 stars but it's been a lifesaver for me! If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay and Looking to eat semi-healthy, not spend too much money and not looking to travel far, this place is perfect. The café is open 24 hours and they offer salads, sandwiches, wraps and smoothies. A much better alternative to late night French fries or the $19 room service Cobb salad before service charge and gratuity. The staff was friendly except when I asked for some hot sauce to go, one chick said not a word to me and slammed a bottle of Tabasco sauce on the counter in front of me without giving me a Togo Ramekin. I was tempted to walk away with the bottle. But I didn't. My tuna salad wrap was $11 and some change and pretty hearty. I saved the other half for later.

Me and my friend came here because Delano would not let us check in due to some issue on their end so we had time to kill and plus we were pretty much starving. This was a good choice and their food is very generously portioned. 

We started with a couple of their signature cocktails. Those were pretty weak and pricey for what you get, not really worth the price and not as delicious as the name and description made them out to be.

For food got the tots and mac n cheese and the french dip. The tots is a huge portion covered in cheese sauce. It was good but I think it could use a little more seasoning. The mac n cheese was flavorful but the crispy topping was bland and didn't add anything to the dish. My french dip was just OK, the saving grace was the dip which was super flavorful and delicious. I was dipping everything from the tots to the sandwich into it. 

We came at off hour so it was not busy and service was quick and prompt. Would come back for a quick bite next time we are at Mandalay.

Super nice waiter, who actually cared and was not rushy like most people are in Vegas. He was really sweet and kept checking on us to see how we were doing. I had the meatball which was to die for, topped off with rich ricotta and hit the spot at 3am ! Delish ! I also had a few bites of the french dip and it was a tad soggy but packed with flavor. Again, I don't understand why these resorts only stock Pepsi so that would have definitley put the icing on the cake!

Citizens' menu features mostly comfort foods and is open 24 hours.  I ordered the French Dip with french fries and a side of macaroni and cheese, and it was extremely delicious!
