However, there really isn't much else I would have ordered from this restaurant.  Our server was friendly, but nothing too spectacular.

THE FRENCH DIP WAS THE BEST FRENCH DIP I HAVE EVER HAD!  The meat was of high quality, the au jus was tasty, and the bread was delicious as well.  It all went together so perfectly, although a tad bit salty (which was to be expected).  The french fries were sliced thinly and crispy, with some kind of seasoning that was perfect!  The macaroni and cheese was extremely tasty with peas and ham inside.  The cheese was so creamy and flavorful and the breadcrumbs that topped the dish was perfectly sprinkled with herbs.  

Citizens is a very casual barstaurant with an interesting atmosphere.  My meal was served on a silver tray that was reminiscent of a elementary school cafeteria tray.  My friend's sandwich was served on a cutting board.  The "kitchen" theme here is very prevalent and unique in Las Vegas.

I would definitely go back to Citizens again.  I went for lunch, so I would be interesting in checking out their drinks one night as well.  Or perhaps to try their 24 sliders in 24 minutes challenge!

Great place to get a good burger. Chicken sandwich or Wings.  The mashed potatoes are great.  I have ate here a few times and have never been disappointed.  Everything that comes out of the kitchen has been delicious!!   Highly recommend it to everyone!!

The food is good for the most part.  It falls short in speed and value.  The to-go option is convenient but takes way too long.  They offer good portions and solid food, but it is priced like it is a higher level locations.

The kobe beef chili cheese fries were quite tasty.  The chili and the fries both had good flavor.

The queso cheese dip is ok.  The flavor is ok, but I expected more bold flavor from the Chorizo.

It is not a bad option, but you will have to be patient and be willing to pay a little more than it is worth.

I ate at Citizens almost every day for breakfast during a work event. This place is fantastic and quick in the morning!

Their green tea is easily one of the best I ever had! Coffee is great too but I suggested buying it in the to go line as it is a few dollars less than the sit down menu. My favorite meal was the standard 2 egg, meat, toast and breakfast potatoes. PLENTY of food! All portions are pretty large. One day I had the pancakes with chocolate chips- 3 enormous pancakes!! I couldn't eat more than 1/4 of them. Their berry bowl is large and comes with raspberries and strawberries!

Their to go line moves pretty quickly- I usually would pick up a croissant and some fruit. 

The interior is quaint and beautiful! Very attractive from the outside looking in, the patio was fun to sit on and watch all the patrons go by.

O.M.G. Everything was well seasoned, fresh and high quality! Pastrami sandwich on rye dayum! Fries delicious and Cesar salad was so fresh! I want to come back here so I can try everything on the menu. Menu is not large, which is smart of them because the food they offer is on point! Hands down best pastrami I've ever had, bread was perfect, no fat on the meat, even their spicy brown mustard was bomb. This place is a must try!

Stopped by the cafe part of Citizens to get sandwiches for lunch after DAYLIGHT and could not have been more grateful! The sandwiches were absolutely delicious and pretty inexpensive for how large they are! Definitely a clutch spot to hit after the pool or for a quick lunch!
Great food and service. A wee bit expensive. I had spinach and artichoke dip and lobster roll and it was great!

Stopped by citizens for a quick lunch. My waiters name was Kevin and he was fantastic. He recommended the French dip, promising I wouldn't be disappointed! Kevin was right! Food was great, service was even better! Thanks Kevin!

The food was great I had meatloaf it was some of the best meatloaf I've had in years. The portions are huge the service was terrific our server, lotus, took our orders without writing them down and made no mistakes. We would come back here in a heart beat

A quick, friendly, breakfast at the bar before our conference was almost everything I expected. My breakfast potatoes and English muffin under my eggs Benedict were both extremely dry, but the flavor was good. 

Bartender was excellent and the service was relatively fast for the area and time. I'd recommend it!

Food is extremely mediocre. The service was ok nothing great. We came in around 4am and they only had a late night menu available. It was overpriced for what we got. My friend ordered a tuna sandwich it was very dry, canned tuna taste better in my opinion. All of the sandwiches come ale cart. The fries were disgusting and costed 7 bucks. We also has breakfast burritos which were ok nothing amazing. I would never come back here and don't recommend anyone else either.

Located in the Mandalay Ba, my and my 6 friends walked around to find something substantial to eat. After looking at the outrageous prices at some of the other restaurants we decided on eating here as it wasn't crowded at 1pm on Saturday afternoon. Average price of a meal was somewhere between $10-16 and they had a very quick moving to go line. 
Came here on a sat around 1:30 with 6 people, 5 min wait to be seated. The food was a different story. Ray was our server. He was so sweet but we waited over 30min for our food even though the restaurant was less than 1/2 full. 
As my friend said: "this is the quintessential restaurant that needs to serve bread or chips." The waiting time was horrible as everyone in the restaurant can see the kitchen and see the food being lined up and just waiting to come to the table. 
We ordered fish tacos, loco moco and frisco melt.
1)Fish tacos came with 3 tacos and all the fixings: gauc, salsa and sour cream
2)Locomoco was a substantial size but pretty pricey for 17$ and IT IS NOT A BURGER. it is literally rice served with a hamburger patty and gravy and an egg overeasy. Really not sure why it is listed under the burger section
3) 2 of us order the FRISCO MELT: totally bomb and the price of 16$ on the strip was great. Melty melty cheese with sourdough bread and fried onions served with mayo and ketchup and French fries on the side. 
Mouth already watering even just thinking about it. Great meal for a pre-drinking night on the strip.
Would come here again. Price was reasonably and food was good. Service a totally different story. 

The funniest part of this place is that the atmosphere music was that CD "That what I call music" circa 1999

Excellent brunch option in the Mandalay Bay, however, the service is hit or miss.  On one weekend we had fantastic service followed by invisible service the next day.   The food was great on our first visit and the server accommodating to dietary needs and requests making us fall in love with the place.   The second visit, our server was totally slammed and he was very much absent minded, leaving us to wait over 20 minutes for a Mimosa from the clearly empty bar next to us.   He also wasn't really down with the hospitality and wouldn't let my guest order the exact same thing she enjoyed the day before which struck me as a little odd.   Had we not been in a hurry, we would have probably asked to see a Manager but it was so busy we just sucked up and left.   What a difference a day makes......
We had to wait 30 min before the food came out, and the waitress was a stoic bitch. The food was just mediocre and over priced.

Mediocre at best.  The salad was generously sized but boring. My friend had a decent burger with OK fries. Two of us got a $15 glass of wine that was minuscule. They should cut back on the portions of their bland food and pour an average glass of wine.

Meh. Service is decent. Food selection is mediocre. Food is okay. This place is pricey, hence the two star rating. Actually, this place is not worth the money in all honesty. That being said, it's open late, choices are rather limited
Their plain cheeseburger was delicious soda was flat are here two time got same thing never waited food was quickly served and in my and girlfriends opinion awesome time is limited in Vegas

I definitely would recommend this place. We went to this place right before the MJ One show.  We didn't make reservations and was seated within 5 minutes. We were pressed for time and I swear I've never had faster service. I had the grilled hockey sandwich and it was delicious. They give you a lot of food! I couldn't finish my fries. Definitely trendy and nice atmosphere.

A good place for breakfast. I came here a few times during my stay at the Luxor and the food here is pretty good for a reasonable price. They have a decent selection of breakfast items if you dine in such as omelets, oatmeal, pancakes, and waffles. Or if you choose to take out they have quick sandwiches/ wraps. 

My first day here I got a kale salad to go. For $10 I got a huge salad that was enough for two meals. The kale was fresh and the pecans/ cranberries were good as well. The sweet citrus dressing a bit heavy.

The next day we dined in and I ordered the bodybuilder omelet (grilled chicken/veggie) made with egg whites. The omelet was a decent size and it came with a small serving of home fries. I also ordered the steel cut oats served with fresh fruit and brown sugar. Overall the meal was average and it's what you expect for breakfast.

My sister and I ate there on Saturday Feb 13 2016.
Food is overpriced for the quality.

About twenty minutes after eating there  - had to pull over in a parking lot - and we both vomited.

The coffee is here is terrible. They don't know how to make it. I asked for a macchiato with soy milk and they told me "There's no milk, it's just foam." Um, so what is the foam made out of? And then I got a mocha the next day and there was no coffee in it. So I paid $7 for a hot chocolate.
Had a nice time being served in the bar by Steven S.  Great food and drink on 6/4/16 before the Heart concert!
average at best. breakfast was bland. service a bit sloppy.not a good breakfast place.

Our server Art was attentive, helpful, and funny. The portion sizes are bigger than expected and completely welcome. We ordered the Brick Chicken and the Meatloaf, both were delicious. We skipped dessert but only because we were so full and on our way to another location. Definitely will return the next time we visit Las Vegas. Thank you, Art!

Didn't liked my experience. 
Waiting time was to long- we got our appetizer about 30 min after we order it. Chicken strips was moist on inside but really hard on the outside. My husband liked his lasagna it was big and testy. I order meatloaf, it Didn't say anywhere in a menu how spicy it's going to be. When I mentioned it to waiter his response was its probably that green peppers chopped inside. I couldn't eat it I got a few bites of it and ate mushed potato. They didn't offer to change my order or to take it off the bill or even give us a discount. Not even sorry u go home hungry.

The set up of this restaurant is pretty cool. It's very casual with like sandwiches, salads and things as their food. My cousin and I just really wanted some fries, and we were really disappointed. We ordered just a side of fries, and when it came out we could tell that the fries were old and re-fried. We wanted to make a comment but we were in too much of a rush to tell the cashier. I will come back again and give this restaurant another shot. However, I may not order their fries this time. ENJOY!

Ate here every am for breakfast for 5 days- awesome breakfast.  After first meal my hubby and I shared all others cause much food- hot- Delish and great service most days.  Bar is best!  Decent drinks but save $ for pool drinks.  Can't wait to come back!

It's 2 am after standing around in the club for hours you're telling me I have to wait 15 mins to be seated for a restaurant that is empty ??? Someone please explain to me why. Food took forever. The waiter spilled water on me and didn't even know it. Was he high or something cause he was messing up all night from spilling beers and I overheard him apologizing to another table. Luckily the chicken club was good or maybe I was just hungry.
Stopped in for some hot chocolate, it came out warm not hot and our server was very apathetic. We were there for maybe 30 minutes and he never checked on us once. No plans to ever return.

Horrible experience.  Took 25 minutes from order to get my cold (expected) sandwich, an Italian Muffeleta, when the place was maybe 1/3 full.  Got the sandwich, and the bun was so stale I could have built a house with them.

I would have stayed and complained, but was already late for a conference by then.

They were out of Swiss cheese the entire first round of the 2016 NCAA tournament, when every grocery store in Las Vegas could instantly replenish them.  If you want Mayonnaise, salt or pepper on a sandwich they will not apply it themselves and will instead give you the bread, cheese and meat and force you to make your own sandwich... That said, it wasn't bad or over priced and I ate there a few times.

I had a late night snack with some friends here. The chili cheese fries were good. It's not put together. They have the chili cheese in a bowl and you dip your fries in. Yummy! I had their turkey burger and it was pretty decent. The fries are a must.

3 stars for the food and fast service. But I'm pretty sure my friends and I got the Norwalk virus here. Minus at least one star for that! So that kinda was not fun for the rest of the weekend. The tot mash was great. But then we had lunch there and I watched a buser pick something out of our calamari bowl. Anyhow... Wish I could have given this more stars! But 3/4 of our group left with acute gastroenteritis. At least we didn't gain weight in Vegas!

Every time I come to Vegas, I look forward to eating here! I absolutely love their juices and salads!! I used to always order the Greek salad, but they don't offer it anymore :( disappointed about that. But, they do have other yummy options to choose from... Been coming Here for 3 yrs and will continue.
Went there late night and they have a very limited after hours menu. Food was just ok. Little pricey for what we got but the service was great.

Chicken soup comes in a square bowl, large portion, 3.5 stars for the taste.  French dip was also 3.5 stars, an additional pickle spear would be nice... Fish and chips is served with tartar and cocktail sauce, 4 stars.

The decor and signage is quite inviting.  I was about exhausted when we stumbled in around 11p and didn't really care where we ate, I had a $40 per diem to use and hadn't eaten since lunch.  The menu looked good enough, there was immediate seating and it was easy access to the elevators....Sold!

I ordered the Lobster roll with potato salad and if I could go back in time I might choose differently.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't what I expected either.  The roll is more like a piece of bread with a slit in the middle to stuff the lobster mix into.  Good flavor on the bread and plenty of lobster but that is no roll.  Now the potato salad must not be their claim to fame, it was boring and limited in quantity.  I mean, I get it, it's potato salad but come on let's make it taste good.  This was chunks of potato with mayo, and if it wasn't that is what it tasted like.  Good thing is there is a ton of stuff on the menu, they are open 24 hours, (I think) and it's super convenient if you're staying at the bay.

I give kudos to this place because it's the only eatery (besides Subway) that's open 24 hours in Mandalay Bay or The Delano. Note: the evening menu does change and doesn't provide a lot of options. I ordered a cheese quesadilla which was yummy and fresh, but something I could make at home. 

We ate there for dinner and the crispy shrimp
On the appetizer menu was so delicious! I'd go back just to order that. We also had the Mac and cheese, which was tasty, but comparable to other places. We also had the spinach dip and mashed potatoes which I wouldn't order again. Tasteless and the spinach dip said it had artichoke, but the pieces were so small and infrequent I can't even consider it to have artichoke. 

Service both times was mediocre. My opinion: go there when all other options are exhausted. And thanks Citizens for staying open for the drunk people!

World famous bacon egg on a kaiser roll. Add .50 for a donut. Mistake. . 50 more drops the kaiser roll entirely and they serve the eggs and bacon between 2 donuts . True gastrononsense. Dirty tables no attention to detail in cleaning. Why no spoons on their tables. Tragic won't come here again.
Love this place! Staff are super friendly and hospitable! Wells and Heather were awesome! Great food! Great staff ! Great service!!!!

I gave Citizens two tries while in Vegas, mostly at the urging of a coworker who wanted to return to try breakfast, but I wouldn't have been back after my first meal, which was a lunch.

The first time we went, we stopped for lunch and sat on the patio. My coworker ordered a burger and asked for no onions on it. I ordered the fish tacos. We waited a good 25 minutes for our food, which is an eternity in lunch hour time, and the restaurant wasn't even close to full. When our food arrived, my coworkers burger had onions on it. He stated this to the waitress and she just gave him a dead stare and then walked off. He picked them off, and said the rest of the burger was ok. 

The fish tacos were itty bitty. I was confused and wondered if I had accidentally ordered off the appetizer menu, but nope....they were listed as one of the lunch specialities of the place. The three tiniest fish tacos of my life were not worth the $24 price tag attached to them, especially since my only "sides" were tiny cups of pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole to put on the tiny tacos. If, after spending $24 on three tacos I have to stop somewhere else to get something to eat so I don't pass out from hunger by 2:00, we have a problem. Our waitress ignored us, and we had to ask for every single drink refill we got. 

I was ready to boycott the place for life, but my coworker is a more kind and forgiving soul than I am (or a glutton for punishment), so we went back for breakfast a couple of days later. We each ordered an omelet. My coworker asked for no guacamole on his....and they messed up his order.....again. I ordered a denver omelet and washed it down with some of the worst coffee of my life (which was $4...yes, for a cup of black coffee.....yes, you read that right). 

My coworker bought both of these meals, and I can't say I would ever come back, even if the food was being paid for by someone else. I am giving the place two stars because the decor inside is nice and the fish tacos (all six bites of 'em) were tasty. Otherwise, this place would be a solid one star.
Absolutely the worst & slowest service in Vegas! 50 minutes to get our food, an hour & a half total. There were only 4 tables with people at them. Ridiculous!

We stayed in the Mandalay Bay and ate breakfast here every morning.  The food is reasonably priced for Vegas and they offer a large variety of choices.

The servers can sometimes be a little slow to get to your table (happened two out of the three times we ate there) but they are all friendly.  I did like the atmosphere, it was simplistic upper-scale decor.  

We didn't eat breakfast here but it looked like they had a lot of tasty sandwiches.  If you do not feel like sitting there and eating they do have a display case with pre-made food.

Just a tip if you are doing Paleo or low carb they do offer a protein box!

My wife and I come to vegas each year for a conference, and have eaten here often, this last time though, the service was extremely sub par.  Our server 'Danny' made zero effort to check and see if the kitchen could make my wife two eggs for her special food allergies, and brought us the wrong sides.  My wife couldn't eat, and I got the wrong thing. I think we'll keep walking next time and eat at the border grill.

5/8/16: Just don't.  Yeah, it's the only restaurant in Mandalay Bay open late (past 10pm ?).  And no, nothing wrong with the service or the environment.  But really.... better to walk out onto the strip and take a short stroll to try your luck with fast food than to empty your wallet here.

Yeah, the food was that bad and that expensive...

1. Chicken Soup $10.00:  Ever had a $10 soup?  I have.  I believe one was a farm-to-table asparagus wonderland of flavors.  And I've had some others at various ultra-high-end restaurants, most of which very special and very delicious.  But... diluted canned chicken soup with some extra vegetables and spaghetti thrown in?  Seriously?--ten bucks!?  1/10

2. Frisco Melt $16.00 "sourdough, grilled onions, swiss, thousand island dressing":  And if the chicken soup didn't blow your brains, well, here we have a burger for $16... how do they top the ten dolla' canned soup with spaghetti?--with multi-day-old leftover over-cooked cardboard cheap frozen patties.  I couldn't eat it.  Took 3 bites and threw the rest away.  1/10

I dunno, maybe if you're high and couldn't make it to White Castle?...

Otherwise, just turn around.  Just don't.

1/5

PS--It appears the manager left a comment to this review with her email.  I want to note that I did in fact write her an email, but am still waiting on a response.  If there is a status update, I will update you here.

#american #vegas

Basic bacon, egg, and cheese on a kaiser used to be simple and delish now it's served in a plastic container with very crispy potato hash and much more expensive. Fruit bowl is huge. Wish things at this great grab and go would go back to paring it down. They do have lemon for tea unlike Starbucks around the corner.

It's pretty expensive, but then again it's Vegas. It's nice how they have a selection of to-go items as well as a sit down restaurant. I ordered my food from the cafe section. I had a panini and one of their juices. The panini was okay. Just okay. The juice was pretty good. 

It did take them a while to make our food.  

The seating was also unclear. There was a section of the restaurant blocked off, which I could only assume was for the sit down restaurant part. There was also another area which wasn't labeled and kinda separated from the rest of the place. The only obvious seating for the cafe was outside the restaurant on the "patio" (and b "patio," I mean the air conditioned hallway of Mandalay Bay) and even half of that was blocked off presumably for the sit down restaurant. Some signs so customers don't get confused would be nice.

Service was good, but the food was not (at least for me it wasn't).  Tried the meatloaf and the macaroni and cheese... *sigh*.  My friend had the double patty melt and he liked it.

Maybe next time we go back to Mandalay Bay, I'll give them another try (but a different menu item for sure).

I had the best time coming to this place. I am so glad that I was able to find it in Mandalay Bay. So I just came here with a friend just to watch a show and we had plenty of time to kill. The bottomless mimosas were absolutely amazing. The bartender Lizzy was so nice and genuine and had the most funniest conversations with us ever. Also Glen who is a waiter there is great as well. These people have amazing customer service and made me and my friend have nothing but an amazing experience full of laughter and fun with these people. They are so wonderful at customer interaction and multitasking. If you are going to go to the bar, I would put in a request for Lizzy. If you are looking for a sit down, Glen is great too. In my personal opinion, this place is the best for a breakfast, brunch, and lunch. I would definitely come back here again. Atmospheres great and so are the employees. Thank you Lizzy and Glen for an amazing experience, I will see you guys soon!

I had breakfast 2 days in a row here at Citizens during my work trade show at Mandalay Bay. My food was good, and I was able to order a special omelette with spinach. Our waitress was super nice and we even saw her the next day. They also have a nice outdoor dining as well as pastries and coffee to go. 

Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

The French Onion soup is deep with tasty cheese.  The lasagna is huge. But the main reason for the review is the bartender, Steven (dude with the handlebar mustache).  He's friendly, and had a lot of knowledge about the food.  He convinced me to have the pup and lasagna,  and both were great.  Props to the gent for helping making this a great dining experience.
Waited 20 mins for a microwaved burrito we had to ask the manager to check on...yes I said microwaved. Awful....don't eat here, go somewhere else. $9 for a microwaved breakfast burro is shameful.

24/7! One of the better 24/7 restaurants on the strip that's reasonable priced!

My group and I visited Citizens one late night after a night of drinking in the Foundation Room. Our server was so excited at first to greet us because we had a party of 6. He thought we were going to be a high value table, but his demeanor all changed when we told him we were only ordering a couple orders of those crispy piping hot waffle fries and the wonderful delectable sliders along with only waters. We only saw him once more after he brought us our food. I thought it was rude of our waiter to treat us differently only because we weren't spending as much $$$ as most tables would. It was am, we just wanted some snacks!

Despite the service snafu, the appetizers (sliders and waffle fries) were quite good. Even though we didn't order any main entrees, everything was reasonable priced. I will definitely come back to Citizens Kitchen & Bar to give their entrees a try!

Staying at the Mandalay Bay for the weekend and have already been here twice! A lot to choose from for breakfast as well as lunch/ dinner. We did not have the chance to dine in but still received great service from the to go side. For breakfast we tried the steak and eggs as well as the creme brûlée French toast. Also tried the green and mean juice- kale, spinach, avocado, banana, and apple. For dinner we tried the bacon burger and cheese quesadilla, both were great! Wouldn't mind eating here again
Like almost every restaurant in Vegas the food is good. Price wise they are fairly reasonable for the location. The sandwiches are always a good choice.

I love this place! Stopped by in here today looking for breakfast and the decor caught my attention right away. My server Chris was very attentive and made great reccomendations. The food was really good. I recommend the ultimate breakfast cause the pancakes were delicious. I also got a iced coffee to go. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

Ate at the bar side on the 26th and had the best service out of any restaurant we ate at all week. Are server Joyce was awesome. Are drinks always full, never sat with dirty dishes, even brought us new napkins after we had the wings. Was recommended by my cousin to have the hot wings, I wasn't disappointed. They were the best wings i have had in a long time. Also had the stir fry and it was pretty good. Cant wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas.

We stayed at MB recently and tried this out for lunch...some healthier menu options than other places at MB.  I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and loved it...very filling.  My wife ordered the turkey burger...she liked it, but felt it may have been a bit undercooked.  Not a cheap place, but this is Vegas.

Service is poor. Very slow. I sat for 10 minutes and restaurant was empty. Other people that were seated after me were waited on before me. I asked hostess if they had gluten free options and they told me my server would be educated. Not the case. He had no clue and he couldn't even lie well. His explanation was its got cheese. They don't make anything there home made. Management needs to give a PK on good service.

Went for a late night dinner after checking in at Mandalay Bay. Had one of the best fish and chips ever. The fish was nice and thick also huge. The batter was thin and crispy exactly what you would expect. My party also ordered the fish tacos and brick chicken both were recommended as well. Only thing was there was music playing really loud just outside the restaurant made it difficult to talk but the food made up for that.
If a $20 plus tip martini is your idea of a good time, this is your place. The food is like a medium burger place with premium prices. Decent for breakfast to go though.

Waiter was really nice, it is convenient because it is opened 24 hours. Ordered fish and chips, it was a HUGE portion the fries were good and the fish was decent. The prices are a little on the pricey side but that is expected.

Food (Breakfast) was wonderful.  Waffles, steak, and Juice smoothies were great actually.  The price is a different story - yes it is expensive.

We had lunch here as well - their Steak chili frieds are fabulous.  Sandwiches are ok.  Cobb salad was no bueno, but bbq chicken salad is good.

Their servers are decent.  They screwed up our togo order (horribly) - that is why the 3 stars instead of 4 stars.
The ultimate Bloody Mary could easily be a meal in itself ! The chicken noodle soup and buttered crackers hit the spot . The service was a tad bit slow.
Average food at best, slow service and overpriced. Ate there twice due to the location and an invite from a friend..........if not for the location, this place would be out of business.

Citizens Kitchen & Bar has been probably one of the WORST Vegas dine-in experiences that I have ever had off the strip. Not only was the food sub par, but the service was god awful atrocious. It took me 20 minutes to get a refill of water, and 30 minutes to put in a drink order. To make matters even worse, my credit card was charged 4 times the value of the food, and wasn't even voided. When I've tried to get a call back from the staff to rectify the situation, they just tell me they'd call me back but never do. Horrible restaurant, horrible service, horrible rating. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT from the Light Group.
This Gets 4 stars, for 1 reason, OPEN 24 HRS. And its really good food. (Recommend the Bacon Burger and NY style pastrami)

Two regrettable experiences at this restaurant earns them one star in my book. The food was average and the service was spectacularly surly, and sour. The staff acted like they were doing us a favor by even addressing us. With all of the fine dining options and high caliber service in Vegas, this seems to me like a very poor choice. New management, please!
Omelet and egg burrito were good.  But service was poor.    Found server not to happy to be working.   Simple request became issue.   Ashamed since food was good

Good munchy late nite? Yes please!

The only 24hr eatery in Mandalay Bay and it's a life saver.  After long night of dancing at Light nightclub, Citizens was a few steps away.  Got seated relatively fast and we quickly ordered off the one page menu.  Our party of four ordered quite a few items to share and all was quite good.  
The Prime rib was AWESOME!  Highly recommended.  
The Mahi mahi fish taco was ok and had a spicy kick in it. 
The Cheese dip chips was amazing!  The dipping of cheese and chili was perfect filling for the late night cravings.
The Buffalo wings were ok.  It was a bit acidic for a late night food but the taste was still good.

Server was really busy and the whole place was understaffed.  On a Saturday night, one large section was held down by only one server.  He seemed very collected but I can tell, he was a little overwhelmed with the requests from each table.  We didn't bother him much but there was a tables that had many requests every time he walks by- not sure if the server forgot and had to be reminded or it was simply the patrons asking for different stuff each time.

I wouldn't mind coming back again especially for the prime rib and the cheese dip chips.

On a whim my wife and I visited Citizens.  It was.. well... just okay.

It was also vastly overpriced.

My wife very much enjoyed her turkey avocado sandwich.  She said it was quite tasty and really loved the bread, sprouts, and muenster cheese.  She's not normally a potato salad person, but she even liked that.  The only thing she didn't like was the price.  It was $17.  Were it $11-14, that would have been better.

As for me... I wasn't much of a fan of my moco loco.  In fact, it might be the worst I've ever had.  The burger patty had no personality to it.  The rice was undercooked.  The gravy wasn't plentiful enough.  Also, it was $17.  Should have been closer to $11.  At least the over-easy egg was nice.

Overall, wouldn't go back unless it were in a pinch.

Only ordered at this place from the walk up counter for breakfast and lunches. In a sea of super expensive mediocre spots, I found Citizens to be a good place for a sammy and salad. Was the the food pricey for what it was? This is The Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas, so yes and yes.


I gave it 5 stars though because of all of the restaurants in the hotel, this seems to be the only one that deserves to have a line.

Just stopped here for banana, coffee and a donut.  Banana was good, as was donut.  Coffee tasted a little burnt.

At least it wasn't too expensive.

Citizen in Mandalay bay is my favorite lunch spot. So many options. You can grab a bite from the counter and take it to go in under minutes or you can choose to sit down at the bar/dinning room. Super friendly staff. I had a shaved steak sand which  served with fries on the side. Very delicious and the fries come in a super cute mini fryer basket. So much food to try here that I will def be back. This is my favorite lunch spot on the strip.
Breakfast was great! Reasonably priced...good service. The manager, JR was very friendly and made us feel at home!

Over-priced for what it is, but I have to give props to any place which has Hot Browns on their menu.  That alone is worth the price of admission as getting that dish made decently outside of Louisville is a dicey proposition at best.  But, true to its reputation, the Hot Brown at Citizens more than lived up to expectations.  And that's coming from an honest-to-gods native of the 'Ville.  Just like you wouldn't question the judgment of a true-to-life Quebecois when it comes to poutine, when somebody's from that region known as Kentuckiana their word is law when it comes to hot browns.

Frankly, you can skip everything else since it's what you can find in any half-decent all-night coffee shot/diner.

Attracted by the idea of comfort food done upscale brought us to Citizens hoping to find food akin to some of the similar concepts around town.  Although the decor is actually quite nice and the pastries do look tasty (we didn't sample them) we were utterly underwhelmed by the delivery.  

Our server was friendly and honest( very much appreciated) and responded to our requests for suggestions very well but we got the impression our server had sampled all the offerings and was having a real struggle recommending anything to us.  

I started off with a drink called American Pie (you guessed it, apple flavored) which was the best thing I had all night, right down to the ring of cinnamon around the martini glass.

We shared a spinach artichoke dip which had a sprinkle of parmesan on top.  The chips were a mixed bag of tortilla chips and pita chips.  The problem were some chips were soggy and stale tasting and some were crisp and fresh. The pita was mostly hard with a few soft bites.  The dip itself was lacking in flavor but tasted ok.  

For our meal, at the server's suggestion we split an entree due to large portion size.   To our delight, the split entree was brought on two separate plates.  Some establishments do not separate it for you and I thought that was a nice touch.

However the blue cheese burger was quite disappointing.  The bun was boring, the burger dry and over cooked, and the blue cheese had no distinguishable flavor from a goat cheese.   The mac and cheese with hamhock also lacked any identifiable cheese flavor with only a light hint of a mild cheddar.  The side of fries were soggy matchstick size fries.

I expected more from an establishment in the Mandalay Bay.

There are a few interesting menu items but when we asked about them, the server hesitated to recommend them.

They do have a hangover brunch with $25 bottomless mimosas.
They also have a 24 burgers in 24 minutes challenge for $40.00 unless you eat them all and then it is free.  

I can't imagine I will be back unless it is just to sample a dessert.

This place is right smackdab in the middle of Mandalay Bay and it has tremendous comfort food for you to enjoy.  The portions are really formidable and the food is quite satisfying.  The staff is pretty funny and they really do take their time to make sure you are having a great meal.  Sometimes the place can get a little noisy from when the crowds come through, but if you can catch it during a lull, its a real nice place to grab some top-notch food that won't break your bank while in Vegas.

AWESOME chips and fish! You get two HUGE pieces of fish and a good size portion of fries! The Mahi Mahi fish tacos are really good too! I was pleasantly surprised with the overall atmosphere and the service. Our server was super friendly and the prices were reasonable. Would recommend for a quick bite at Mandalay Bay!

They don't even deserve one star.  By far the worst experience ever!  After spending some serious money gambling my friend and I decided to have a very late dinner, we were seated promptly ... other than that we waited 30 minutes for water and still patiently waited another 30 minutes to see if we were going to be served.... wishful thinking.... A table of 6 who arrived after us were served... We got up and left..... Poor poor poor service!!!  Never again...  We went to RePete's  Bar and Grill .... Immediate service and awesome waiter!

Not impressed, not a lot of options, food was bland and over priced

Food - 1 star
Service - 4 stars
The eggs Benedict are very good.  Neat atmosphere sitting on the "patio" inside the hotel/casino.  Service is good and staff is polite.  Great breakfast joint to get you going in the morning.

Love this restaurant located in Mandalay bay casino next to light night club
They are open until late food is great and fresh like there chicken Cobb salad
And wing  and service you get I will recommend to everyone.

Yes, I know this is a restaurant within the hotel,
Yes, I am prepared for the overpriced menu,
Alas, I'm still disappointed with flavor and the portion size.

We ordered quinoa salad, burgers, pasta, and some kids menu items. Surprisingly the best value items were kids menu with an entrée, side, and drink, which could have easily fed an adult.  The regular adult menu items are hit and miss. After finishing their plates, most of the adults in our party ended up finishing my nephews' tater tots since we're still hungry.  Surprisingly those tots are quite good.

TIP: You could ask to substitute fresh cut fruit, tater tots, fries, or pasta salad as side without additional charge.

Food was expensive, and extremely mediocre.

It was a convenient spot for dinner, considering I was staying at the Mandalay Bay and it's pretty much at the end of the strip.

I could tell that the waiter was trying really hard to provide good service, but overall, I wasn't too happy. The restaurant was relatively empty, but we still had to ask for simple things like water refills, bread, and condiments. (Bread was stale and toasted to warm, just sad.)

The food didn't make up for it either. If I am ever in the area again, I won't be back.

Citizens is a fairly new restaurant on the Strip, located at the Mandalay.  I believe it opened earlier this year...

Like many new restaurants at the higher end casinos, the interior is re-done and has an upscale feel.  Service here was fantastic--our server was very accomodating to our unusual requests, and he was speedy.

How was the food?  Hmmm... I ordered one of their signature items: the meatball grinder (meatball, gravy, and provolone sandwich).  It was missing something... I would start with a thicker gravy with some added punch.  In any case, I got the feeling their recipe was missing a key ingredient(s) and was real close to being perfect--meatballs had decent flavor, lots of provolone, and good, soft bread...  Pic is posted here http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/citizens-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?select=iw_BaDqhZdKca8szDQyqhw#4dzx70lU6_dOxSRCHlBerg

Another member of our party had ordered the Muffaletta.  I think I'm just not a muffaletta person as the sandwich didn't connect with me.  Visually, it did look good though...

With both sandwiches failing to wow me, great service and good decor isn't enough to woo a return visit from me... =(

I ended up here after the Mandalay's unknowledgeable staff said this was the only cafe in the hotel and I was deeply disappointed.  We ordered the prime rib and meatloaf and a couple of crappy signature drinks that escape me right now. The red flag should have been when the food arrived in less than 10 minutes, but I was hoping they were just ridiculously efficient. I tasted the meatloaf and that was OK, good even, but worth $25+? Absolutely not. The prime rib was $31 and served with 3 onion rings. It was cold, chewy, and tasteless. On a positive, service was attentive so no issues there. I, for sure won't be planning to come back, its WAAAYYYY overpriced and just not that great.

We went there for breakfast when we were at the Mandalay Bay on March 1st.  Tim was our waiter.  We were seated fairly quickly by a nice hostess.  The waiter was not the most friendly person, but was polite.  We placed our order, pancakes and eggs for my hubby and I got a Denver Omlette both with hash-browns and we split a side of bacon.  Tim comes by twice in the next 30 minutes to apologize for the order taking so long.  When it finally comes out, everything is cold. I'm diabetic and my blood sugar is so low that I HAVE to eat.  So, we ate it.  I don't mean it wasn't hot.  I mean the little balls of butter wouldn't melt on anything.  Not my hubby's pancakes, not my toast, not the hash-browns!  Also, know how I am when I was hungry so I didn't say anything, not that I was even asked how things were. Tim ignored us until he brought the check.  So, I waited two weeks to post this, cuz when I think about it I'm still mad.  Go ANYWHERE else!!

What a great find. We went for lunch last Saturday after arriving in Vegas and glad we picked this place. We ordered the French Dip and it was delicious. My only complaint would be a lighter side like fruit as an option. But the sandwich was flavorful, the au jus delicious and really a great meal. I'd recommend asking for horseradish on the side for an extra kick but either way it's good.

Tony our waiter was quick friendly and his knowledge of the food was superb.  He took a great photo of the group next to us without hesitation!  
The French Onion Soup we split was excellent, very cheesy, and large portions...even split between the two of us.  I had a Tommykbocker Butthead Boch, and my GF had the Midori sour, both excellent even if the sour is a bit overpriced.  We then split the NY steak and it was very juicy, and well cooked to our medium order.  Came with fries on the plate, and if it wasn't juicy enough, the A-1 butter was really good.  A really good meal on the Strip for a high-priced seventy bucks, given the atmosphere, but not as pricy as other places in the Mandalay Bay.
Well recommended, and we split on whether we would come back again.  We like variety, after all....

5 stars on the food, 3 stars on service leads to an outcome of 4 stars. I can't say enough about the food here. We come here often because we can't get enough of the calamari and bloody Mary's. 
My girl sticks to the fish tacos, (mahi or Ono) can't remember. But they were delicious. I'm not crazy about fish tacos but they're fantastic here. For me, the calamari really hits the spot. The breading isn't too much and the calamari inside is perfectly chewy and firm. For dinner, I got the burger. Which was solid, classic American. 

Don't miss this spot, drinks/calamari appetizer/Tacos/burger, won't disappoint!!
Loved their brunch! Crab cake Benedict was awesome. Tried the Lox and Bagels and really enjoyed it! Always have fabulous customer service as well!

Vegetarian and gluten-free with a penchant for light, fresh, healthy fare makes for tough dining in Vegas. 
The to-go counter saved me with their kale salad, it was fresh and delicious. Too much dressing - really wish they could have the salads w/dressing on the side or ease up! But yummy anyway. Also nabbed the crudite veggies and tossed the ranch dressing. Pricey, but I was happy for some fresh veggies!
The sit-down side got me through breakfast with a tasty CA omelette. I got the eggs fried (and requested them cooked in butter not oil) with avocado, sour cream and pico de gallo on top. A little pile of tatertot hash came with. Was it mind blowing? No. Was it tasty, fresh and satisfying? You bet. The hash was "meh" but I could see folks liking it for that salty kick back to grade school. 
Coffee (iced americano w/soy) was quite good. 
Service was attentive and friendly, no complaints. 
All in all I am grateful this place is here and will gladly come back knowing I can get a fresh tasty meal. Expensive? No more so than the rest of Vegas.
Thanks, Citizens! (I'd actually give them 3.5 stars, 4 if the menu were a little more inspired, but all in all the food is reliable, good, and fresh.)

I've been here before on another trip to Vegas, and enjoyed the food, this trip I have mixed reviews....The first day we stopped in for lunch, I ordered a chicken Caesar a box of cut fruit, and a sandwich to share - the fruit came to me molded, and when I asked for a new one, she gladly gave it to me, but put the old one back in the case!  A bottle of water was $5 - bringing our small-ish lunch to share to $40.  We thought we'd give it another try the following day, it was better - the food may have been restocked overnight, not sure, but sandwich was great, fruit was fresher, water was still $5 - and total was $43 again, but better experience over all.  Ate out on the patio outside, not served, may be a different experience - overall great when on the go in Vegas, just a little pricey for a sandwich and salad.

The food here is great! Ordered on several occasions and happy with every meal! Love the atmosphere, it's not a high end restaurant but more of an eccentric, rugged, everyone fits in type of place - modern American - and I loved it! The waiters are awesome, very attentive. Bonus: open 24/7 and it's perfect for those after the bar/club munchies.

Items here are actually quite expensive, especially for what they are.  Cost aside though, the food here is purely average.  If you decide to order something here, it is likely pre made.  All of the sandwiches were pre assembled and sitting together in a large container with the same sandwiches.

The smoothies were pretty good. We tried the green machine smoothie and I thought it was enjoyable.

The cashiers here both times I visited were pretty nice and service was not an issue, although I did order something that they didn't already have pre made, so I did have to wait a little bit longer than everyone else, including a few people who ordered after me.

The staff at the front counter seem disinterested in their jobs.  We had a fruit smoothie this morning with our coffee.  It came out of a carton-no fresh fruit! They were out of strawberry and one other "fruit".  It was like drinking sugar.  we went there yesterday to get a salad and the straw dispenser didn't work (looked left over from Red /white/blue) so they just took the top off and had us grab one.  Doesn't seem too sanitary.  They need to do a gut check on the operations/staff.  They shouldn't be out of stuff and they need to act like they want to work there.

Great place to grab a drink or a bite to eat before you hit the casino. Raquel the bartender is one of the best in the business. She always remember your drink orders from previous visits and really makes you feel at home!!

First time here. As a Vegas local, I usually try to avoid the Strip places, as from what I've seen they're usually overpriced tourist traps. I'm glad to say I was pleasantly surprised by Citizens. I had been considering Citizens as an after-concert choice (Neil Diamond!), since it's open 24 hours. We arrived at Mandalay Bay early and had an hour and a half to kill, so we decided to eat before the show instead.

After checking out the menu board outside and getting on the list, we waited about 3 minutes and we were seated in the outer "patio" area. Our server, Nick, greeted us very shortly thereafter and brought us our drinks, offering to answer any questions we had about the menu sections. I decided against spending $40 on a 14 oz NY sirloin steak and went with the bacon burger (medium done, add cheese, hold the onions) & fries. My wife chose the NY-style pastrami sandwich. Being that it was 5:45 pm, I expected to wait a bit for my order to come out. After 15 minutes or so Nick came back to the table and apologized for the wait, explaining that they were very busy and that he would see to our orders ASAP. I thought that was really cool of him, because I cannot tell how many times I have been sitting in a restaurant, getting aggravated looking at my watch over and over, while the wait staff hangs around chatting or walks by us over and over like we haven't been sitting there sipping our drinks for over a half hour. The food arrived a few minutes later and it was time to dig in.

My burger platter, served on what looked like a cookie sheet, was the perfect size for the $20 price tag: a good-size, nicely stacked burger with tomato and shredded lettuce, cooked and prepared exactly as I had requested and skewered through the top bun with a large pepperoncini that would make Papa John cry, a decently-sized "bucket" of shoestring fries and a half pickle slice. My wife's equally-priced sandwich was huge (the half she couldn't finish wound up in the car in a to-go box before we went to the show), stuffed with perfectly lean pastrami, along with a side bowl of potato salad (or fries or cole slaw) and also sporting that pepperoncini and pickle slice. Both orders were delicious and appropriately priced for the portions we received. When it came time to settle the bill, I jokingly asked if they do employee discounts for fellow MGM employees, to which Nick said he would go check. He returned a couple of minutes later with, to my surprise, a new bill reflecting a 20% discount (which I kicked back to Nick on top of the original tip for his great service) - a definite high-five to Citizens for that!

All in all, I still generally think Strip dining establishments are tourist traps, but I also think they have not yet seen the last of me at Citizens - it seemed to be, at least to me, one of the few exceptions to the rule.

Stopped here for dinner one night while walking the strip. Totally overpriced for the quality and atmosphere, in my opinion, but that's the strip. This is in Mandalay Bay, near all the nicer restaurants, so it's cheaper than everything around it.

The portions here are enormous, which helps make up for the prices. My husband ordered the fish and chips and they brought him an entire fish, battered and fried. Come hungry! I had a pasta dish which wasn't terrible, but definitely not worth the price. They also charged us both different prices than what was listed on the menu.

The dining room is kind of cramped and really dark. Our waiter was friendly.

Overall, it was a decent meal, but I wouldn't go back here.

I was attracted by the idea of comfort food in a casino 24 hrs a day. The staff were very friendly and greeted me upon walking in. The atmosphere was nice and the decor was just right. Portion size was large enough to eat family style following the spinach artichoke app which was very good. The Mac and cheese was solid and the skinny fries had great flavor. I also added a grilled cheese just to try it which was solid. I didn't try the pastries but they looked very tasty. The hangover brunch with bottomless mimosas for $25 was a nice touch. Def check it out if you're in Mandalay Bay.

Great. Tried fish tacos, their specialty, and they were awesome. Since I'm new to fish tacos I have no baseline but I do know a new fave. Others in my party ordered anything from fish and chips to quinoa salad. All were equally fantastic.  Service friendly and a nice touch is the manager comes around to ask how everything was.

Great place to grab breakfast and possibly lunch.  It is very casual so if you are rolling out of bed after a night of partying hard in Vegas this is your place.

I have to say if you like dark coffee you will love Citizens.  I do not like a dark brew but when you need coffee anything will do.

I like their yogurt parfaits and their bacon (maple) for a quick breakfast.  Hubby devoured their pancakes so they must have been yummy.  

The decor kind of reminds me of a diner with a more upscale feel (subway tile and wine bottles).  There is a dinner menu but to me there are so many other places in Mandalay to eat that this is not where I would choose to go.

Do your self a favor and skip the patty melt, perhaps the worst burger I have ever had in my life. The patty had no seasoning what so ever, the fries were not even warm. The bread was thick but hard on edges. Waiter never checked back u tip the end, only reason i gave it 2 stars is because it was open 24 hours and  my fiancé liked her rueben.

Staff members are unprofessional and lazy. I waited 15 minutes longer for hot tea water and asked for ice (ahead of time) and overheard an employee say "we are out of ice and I'm not going to the bar to get it!" If you are too lazy to help a customer, I suggest a new line of work.

Pricey but convenient, and a good business tactic for them being the closest to Light Nightclub.  Grubbers appear to veer toward this eatery after clubbing, as I observed.  The workers look tired but seem to maintain their patience.

Loco Moco for $17 is expensive and should be served without gravy spilled on the side of the bowl if I'm gonna be giving you my money for this high priced dish.  Quality issue guys.

I'll give them raves for their Reuben sandwich with crispy seasoned fries though.  Really delish!  Reminds me of Junior's in New York!  But not the cost; even in the east coast it's less and you get more meat.

I like them enough.

This was bad. 

We had a dining credit due to our room at The Hotel being booked up so we tried it and it did not work out. 

This is the Mandalay Bay's answer to a 24/7 restaurant. 

We tried to go here twice. The first time was around midnight. The place was empty and I asked for another table so my sweetheart and I could sit side by side. There were probably 40 tables available. The hostess told me in an extra snotty manner that they are a 24 hour restaurant so they will need the four top table for another party. My sweetheart was offended by how she addressed me and suggested we leave immediately which we did. I should not have returned. 

The second time we returned I tried a side of mac and cheese and the French onion soup. The soup was meh. The mac and cheese was cold as if they didn't microwave it long enough. It was definitely microwaved. They were out of carrot cake. It was super super expensive- around $30 for one person. It was really really loud and hard to talk. Don't go here at all. There is no reason to. There are other places to eat like Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian which are open 24/7 who won't be rude while overcharging you for bad food.

Great for breafast, always a seat open at the bar with sports on for a quick bite. Its not too pricey and is easy to get in and out with some food and drinks. 

Service: Our bartender/waitress was awesome, the food took awhile though...

The cafe has the worst customer service ever including a not so friendly staff. We ordered a grilled cheese and a shake. After waiting for 15 minutes (mind you the place was dead), the girl brings our shake to us stating that she forgot about it. No mention of the grilled cheese, we walked up to the counter and asked the status on that order. The girl look puzzled and stated that she burned our sandwich and would make a new one. The panini press is in plain site, and no sandwich was ever made to be "burned". The manager was on the side of the cafe making a drink, then brought it out to a girl outside of the establishment. We highly don't recommend this place, unless you like waiting for your food that will never come, and like to experience some of the worst customer service.

Here's the thing: if the menu says the quesadilla has a three-cheese blend, salsa, sour cream and guacamole, then please ONLY have it come with the three cheese blend, salsa, sour cream and guacamole.  It's frustrating to be served a $16 quesadilla (over $20 with tax and tip) that comes with chipotle aioli slathered inside when it isn't listed.  I ate a whole slice hating it before I realized what it was.  Yuck!  (I guess if you like chipotle aioli, great, but if you don't, please list it on the menu. Chipotle aioli is kind of a big deal to people that don't like it.)  Not worth the money, but the service was sweet and understanding.  They credited me, but it's noted for next time.

Excellent food, great atmosphere. Emily the hostess was very sweet - not stuffy.  She was accommodating to me with my electric wheelchair and made sure i felt comfortable - Which is a big deal to hubby and I. Waiter Chris H. was outstanding - very attentive & made us feel like we were his only customers - my drink never ran low and he told us what to expect with our choices. Think french brasserie. No idea why this place is rated 3. Hubby and I enjoyed our food. I had a huge plate of fish and chips (best I've had) white fish was not fishy and breading was super light, flaky and out of this world. Hubby had prime rib special. Very large piece of meat and was tender - delicious. We will be back for sure. Pleasantly surprised. Eat here!

Nothing here stands out and makes me want to go again. 

It wasn't that far out of what Red, White, and Blue had to offer. 

This place is NOT vegetarian friendly. The chef was nice enough to make our party specialty items (off menu) to satisfy. 

I ordered a flat iron steak. It wasn't bad, but this also isn't a steak house - it's like an upscale cafe....maybe. 

I did really like the beer selection! Although no beers are on tap, all bottled.

I stopped in one morning during my conference and ordered the Bellylicious juice.  It was fresh, tasty and filling enough to carry me through my morning.  The grab and go counter is pretty busy, but the line moves fast.  The pastry case wasn't overly appealing, but honestly I really only needed/wanted the juice.

I give it a poor two due to the expense. There are tons of other options nearby so I will explore to try and find a more reasonable place. 

I had a ham and egg croissant and a small coffee and a yogurt and the cost was 29.59. And you wonder why I could not afford a tip (it was a to go order at the cashier).

The croissant was terrific. The "hash browns" came right out of the ore Ida bag in the freezer and were undercooked. Coffee was fine. 

Vegas is weird and the Madalay Bay is like having a captive audience for which you can be charged three times what you should be charged. I am the dummy that did it.

The quinoa vegetable salad ($15) was tiny! There was a tiny scoop of quinoa, which was actually cooked and seasoned well. Then there were a few green leaves. That's about it. I expected much more greens, or vegetables, when the name of the dish is something vegetable.

This was a convenient location to dine at since it's inside the Mandalay Bay hotel and we stayed there. One morning I came by around 8 am and wanted to get a quick breakfast. With all the convention going people everywhere, that was not going to happen so I went elsewhere (to a "dessert" place on the other side of the casino inside the hotel)....

My wife, kids and I, all locals, ate here before the shark encounter last Saturday.  My wife had the quinoa salad with a Firestone beer, I had the lobster roll with Lagunitas ale.  The kids had a cheese quesadilla and grilled cheese.  Our sides were the coleslaw.

Every thing was really good; not a morsel left.  The service was really good too; the waitress recommended the beers and did a good job with her recommendations.  I would make a point to have lunch here again.

I would recommend reconsidering all the tile though; it is loud in this restaurant.

Oh Citizen's, how you never failed us. During my 5 day stint in Vegas, I probably dined at Citizens no less than 4 times. Maybe, because the restaurant was in our Hotel's Lobby or maybe I was too lazy to search for other food options. Either way Citizens was good. The first day in Vegas I ate lunch there and they were cranking out some good late 90's and early 00's R&B tunes. My guests and I were really enjoying the music, so much that the young lady at the next table over started dancing with us. I ordered the Chicken Sandwich that day and it was good along with their fries. Others in my entourage had chicken wings (good) and their mac n cheese (which was the bomb!). The rest of our visits to Citizen's were for breakfast and let me tell you, their breakfast is bomb. Their potatoes are too die for. I'm glad I stumbled across this gym.

visited citizen this morning, what a difference from last review I wrote. we were taken care of by Rachel. she is just ray sunshine what a sweet smile. And another thing "the food". absolutely loved my breakfast. Got the eggs Benedict. I will recommend this restaurant to everyone.

1 = never go here; 5 = you must go here; that is what the stars mean to me. This is exactly why this place got 3 stars. I wouldn't put it in the never go here camp or the must visit. It's food is decent, ambiance is decent (loud at times) and service was nothing to rave about. I got the au jus sandwich which was not bad. If you can't make a decision on where to eat and your strolling through the Mandalay this place will work as it won't excite or disappoint you (at least too much).
Awesome food! Try the fish and chips. We took Naomi's suggestions for meal and drinks and she was spot on! Great service and fun atmosphere. We will definitely visit again and request Naomi.

Good food at a decent price for a big Vegas hotel. I had a turkey and avocado sandwich which was stuffed full of fresh sliced turkey. It came with crisp french fries. It was a nice presentation. The sandwich was easy to eat too, it didn't fall apart when I picked it up. It came on sliced cranberry walnut bread that had a good texture and flavor. I could only finish half of it. The other half was my breakfast the next day. I also got a good bloody mary, nicely spiced. Service was good. The interior was too noisy for my taste, between the high ceilings and tiled floors, so we ate in the sidewalk café section. That's a better place to watch people anyway, and half the fun of coming to Las Vegas. Good bargain for the money. I recommend it!

This was the recommended restaurant for breakfast business meeting among the restaurant row in the MGM hotel.   I was told that we should get there before 7 am to ensure that we get a table - and we did.   It was not crowded at 6:45 am.   

I was there for 2 consecutive mornings for my breakfast business meetings and my server remembered me on the 2nd day.   Perhaps my tipping made an impression?  (Not sure if that was good or bad).   The service was okay but my second serving of cappuccino took over 10 mins to get to me.

I had my custom omelette both mornings but due my focus on the business interactions, I actually didn't remember if the food were good or bad!   :-).   

I like the casual setting and the atmosphere that could facilitate a discussion.

Went in around 2 am, to just the cafe part of citzens...not the sit down restaurant part. & IT.WAS.AWFUL, terrible, quite shitty in fact.

Ordered a small size of the kale salad which was inedible and pretty sure against FDA regulations as it seemed it was kept unrefrigerated. Then I ordered a $10 "juice" that  was actually a smoothie. I'll give them points for using actual free fruits, but being from LA, I am very particular on my freshly PRESSED juice. 

NEVER AGAIN. Go to the little mini mart near the elevator and buy some cup of noodles there to satisfy your late night drunk munchies. Although there's no coffeemaker in the rooms at Mandalay, so ask for a cup of hot water from starbucks or citizens (they'll charge you $1)
Food was pretty good, but nothing special. I think it's a bit overpriced, but it's Vegas. Great place for a late night snack or meal. Only restaurant in Mandalay Bay that's open late.

Ugh! I only went here a second time (on a separate Vegas trip) because my group was starved and drunk... and couldn't walk another hundred feet to another restaurant or something ridiculous....  I can't remember.

BUT I CAN REMEMBER HOW SHITTY BOTH MY VISITS HERE WERE!
The first time, I ordered a pretty basic burger that ended up coming to the table late and undercooked.  While I would typically eat it if it was anything else (my standards of food are pretty low), I would probably have yakked it out if I decided to eat it.  I asked for it to be recooked, but the waiter was pretty unresponsive about me getting a new one, so I didn't even end up eating it as my group was in a rush.  I gave up and decided to never come back again....

But I did, several months later.  This time, our group was much bigger (about 10) so understandably, it would take a while to get our food.  However, we were there for maybe a half hour-45 AFTER ordering and our waitress passed by our table once, only after we all spent time staring at her from across the room.  Finally got the food and it was cold as Antarctica.  Wow! It's like they cooked it on time but left it on the counter to hang out or something.  Some people at my table refused to eat most of their food so I asked (shamelessly) if they "were gonna eat that" so I could doggy bag it.  Even the boxes took some effort to acquire.  I was determined to salvage as much as I could from this experience and never return again!  

Oh, 24 hr Vegas McDonald's.  I will never forsake you again.

Went there this morning for breakfast, and in the past was very pleased with the service and quality of good.  However, Sat morning 3/5/16 my fiance and I went to Citizen for breakfast after grabbing a cup of Java at Starbucks.  As we approached the young blonde woman who was the hostess, I immediately saw the sour look on her face.  She was leaning on her elbow and was either in a bad mood or had a terrible hangover. I stood by and waited for her to look my way so I could make my request.  Mind you there was only one other guy waiting to get in. After waiting a minute with no acknowledgement,  I walked all the way up to her, and said excuse me, but we'd like to have breakfast.  She looked at me like I kicked her buns, then said just two of you?.  I said yes, and thank you. She said sternly, stand close!  I shrugged her attitude off and we checked out the posted breakfast menu.  Then she smugly told us," I'm sorry, but no outside drinks are allowed you'll have to throw it away". That was before she even planned on seating us. At that point I told her to forget it, and we would go elsewhere.
Round 2... We returned for dinner, and it was like night n day.  The young brunette woman greeted us warmly, and sat us within 10 mins.  The waitress was excellent as was the food. 
I'm giving this a 3 star but would give it 5 had that first employee not ruined my morning .. Management should do random attitude checks to improve their customer's experience. Their Mac n cheese and mahi tacos were outstanding.

BRUNCH TIME! Love the French Toast and Turkey Club! So chill, music playing, love the rustic old school style and service!

Thanks Tony!

Came here after a night out with the boys.

I don't recall much but I did order a reuben sandwich.  Let's just say she would be disappointed if she saw it!  Yep the sandwich itself was massive and for sure I wasn't able to finish it....or was it!?  Needless to say, I ended up downing the whole thing while chatting away about the night.  The toast was crunchy from the outside and soft towards the middle, giving it a nice crunch while you sink your teeth into the warm cornbeef.  Add a little zing and sting from the sauce and we're all good.  

The place itself was packing quick from the late-nighters.  Loud as it should be while some of the unlucky one continue to work their magic for one last hurrah at a one-nighter! - Enjoy!

Stopped in after a concert. It was pretty late so it is all that was open. 

Now that I have been there, I would for sure go back. 
Got on the wait list and waited about 15 minutes. We sat on the patio, if it's a patio, since it's inside the building, but outside the restaurant. Got it? It was good because we could people watch. 

I ordered the Loco Moco. Great choice to absorb any alcohol. lol

The meat was cooked just right and had quality taste to it. I liked the stickiness to the rice. I think the gravy could have had a little more flavor to it, but it wasn't bad at all. 
Give it a try.

This restaurant is so Vegas. What do I mean by that? I mean this place embodies the whole high/low theme that is Vegas. This place is set up like a diner but the menu items have high-end prices. Any entrée cost anywhere from between $40-$60. It's located conveniently next to the club Light so you go at 4AM you will see a lot of drunk, post-clubbers (like me). 

I ordered a filet mignon and fries which was around $58 (another high/low thing). The steak fries were delicious! Nothing better than some comfort food after drinking! The filet mignon was very tender and juicy too, but for some reason I filled up on the fries. I found it a bit hilarious that the filet mignon came with fries instead of mashed potatoes or creamed corn like traditional steakhouses, but, hey, that's Vegas for ya. 

Overall the environment of the restaurant was not that memorable, but the food was pretty decent. I did find it rather funny that this place looked so casual but the menu items would be something that an upscale (okay, at least business casual) restaurant would serve. I would probably end up here again if I went to Light, but not something I would go out of my way for. Plus, it's also rather pricey considering what you get, but that's Vegas *shrugs*.

The service was pretty good too. I don't have any memorable stories, but my other friends actually came here as well and saw me eating with someone and told the waitress that they were going to leave because they saw someone they knew. The waitress replied, "Don't worry, I'll hide you."  That's top notch service right there!

Yelp should really do half stars. I would give this place 3.5 stars but I rounded down to 3 because I was less than impressed with the decor.

I went to see For the Record: Baz before it leaves Mandalay Bay and I decided to try Citizens for something different.  I was rather pleased with my meal and service there.

My server, Tony, answered some questions I had about the menu and he told me about some specials.  I ordered a small Caesar salad for a starter.  For the main, he recommended the fish tacos and I went with that.  For dessert, I again took his recommendation and ordered the carrot cake.  It was good following his advice!

The Cesar salad was a normal one, nothing special.  They could have left the hard piece of bread with baked cheese on it.  The bread was indeed hard and there was no cheese flavor.  It looked better than it tasted.

I have only gotten fish tacos once before so this was almost a new entrée for me.  The tacos were filled to the brim.  The mahi mahi was tasty, there was some slaw, and each taco had a slice of avocado along with some chipotle aioli.  There were three side containers of sour cream, guacamole, and pico.  The tacos were juicy and messy eating, but worth it.  

The carrot cake was a gigantic slice of goodness.  It was rich cake with a good cream cheese icing and nuts sprinkled liberally on the icing.

You are paying Strip prices for tacos you could get from a street vendor for much less.  The restaurant was almost empty and the quiet was enjoyable.  Tony was a great server and I'm glad I gave Citizens a try.

Food was good and the service was even better on the night shift with Steven.  He makes the experience  worth the visit and the blonde handlebar mustache is a must see.   He is amazing, accommodating, personable, and charismatic.  Truly a pleasure spending your evening dining with Steven.

Nichelle and Monica, New Jersey and Maryland

I can't even BEGIN to write a review that expresses how tickled I am to have found Citizen's Kitchen! It all started with coffee...good coffee that's reasonably priced (in Vegas!) and with free refills! As I was at the Mandalay for business, refills are a wonderful thing. Next, I tried a salad-- it was HUGE and FRESH and delicious! The following day I had a sandwich which, again, was HUGE and freshly made and delicious! The sandwiches actually lasted me for 2 meals...two delicious, hearty meals! I wish there was a clone of Citizen's Kitchen where I'm from...but if ever I cam back, I'll come back!

http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d3863532-r314000113-Citizens_Kitchen_Bar-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

If not for the friendliness of the help, I'd give one star. The line was long and moved terribly slow. Seemed sufficiently staffed, although staff wasn't very organized or efficient. Food represented at the counter isn't necessarily available. Food is also pretty over-priced for what you're getting. Seems like a lot of it is pre-fab, like employees are opening a plastic case and serving to you. My daughter's $6 cupcake was gross, tons of preservatives. 

The only positive is that the staff was nice. We won't be back though. For over-priced, pre-fab food, even Starbucks is a better option.

Saturday night when i left LIGHT nightclub it was about 4am and i was starving! i walked out about 2 steps and walked directly into what looked like heaven... it wasn't but it was citizens. 24/7 whatever you can think of. i love these types of places because you can always get what your craving at the right hour. i got a burger and fries that hit the spot. i will be back again for sure maybe for a normal time dinner!!

Good, large portions of food. Ate here twice, since it's the only 24 hour restaurant open in the Mandalay. Service is a bit slow, not enough servers both times we ate here, and had to send back our food twice. Hamburgers were extremely undercooked, RAW, not medium well, and fries were just overly salted. My turkey Reuben and slaw were pretty good, as were the Mahi Mahi fish tacos.

Citizens is located within Mandalay Bay and is a great place for a low key lunch or laid back dinner. The concept is open with indoor and "outdoor" (walking area of hotel)seating as well as to-go options. Aesthetics could be described as a classy American diner.

When my coworker and I landed at night, we were starving and quickly decided on Citizens. I went for the French Onion Soup and a side of the Mac and Cheese. Be warned! The French Onion Soup is not meant to be an appetizer. It comes in a very large bowl and was a meal in and of itself-I'm sad to say much of it was wasted, as delicious as it was. The mac and cheese was also quite good. I also had a glass of red wine-which also came in a huge glass. Ok wine, but not worth the price tag. 

Days later, when my husband and I were enjoying the pool, we were looking for food options and decided on Citizens for take out by the pool. We opted for the chicken and cheese quesadillas which came with sides of guacamole, sour cream, and pico de gallo. The portions were large once again and the quesadillas were excellent! 

If you're staying within Mandalay or an MGM resort, you may charge it to your room, along with any other restaurants.

Lovvvvvvve citizens!!! The sweet chili Thai wings, smothered tots, and their specialty cocktails are to die for! The atmosphere is amazing with a contemporary spin on American food.  Most importantly, the customer service is above par! Joe, my waiter provided a very awesome experience for me! He persistently checked in on my table and his personality was the icing on the cake! Definitely coming back again very soon

Great for lunch. My husband and I shared the chili and mahi-mahi tacos. The waiter said the fish tacos are what "made the restaurant famous" and the did not disappoint. They were tasty and of good quality.   The chili was spicy and yummy. 

The atmosphere was that if an English dinner and the service was friendly and top notch. A great place for lunch.
Probably the best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had.  And the Cole slaw was great also.  Definitely recommend

What do you do when you're jet-lagged to within an inch of your life and know that if you don't eat soon you're going to Hulk out and make the news?

The Hublet and I checked into Mandalay Bay for the 2013 IT Expo, threw our suitcases on the bed and dragged ourselves downstairs to try to bolt down some food before falling into an exhaustion coma.

We chose Citizens as it was the first non-formal place to eat that our tired feet brought us to.

The staff are polite and efficient, but the restaurant has a quick turnover feel to it and you do feel a scoosh rushed, however looking at the sea of people passing by you understand their desire to capitalize on the moneymaking potential.

We ended up visiting Citizens twice during our stay in Vegas and tried the following:

* Calamari appetizer: excellent.  I usually hate Marinara sauce with my calamari, preferred the gentle kiss of lemon juice, but their spicy sauce was a nice accompaniment.
* BBQ Chicken Salad: basic but well done, although the chicken had a dry 'cooked earlier in the day & added at the last minute' feel.  Pretty to look at, well sized and filling.
* Mushroom Blue Burger: this was a messy, messy meal that I enjoyed every second of.  Towering high, barely held together by a skewer, this rapidly fell apart and more napkins gave their lives here than for any other meal in Vegas.  Their sacrifice was not in vain.
* Chicken Club Sandwich: the sourdough bread was the champion here, besides that it was a Club that wasn't any more or less tasty than any other Club sandwich, and the accompanying side of fries were delicious.

Prices are higher than you'd expect for somewhere that feels like a lunch place, however I rapidly learned that everything is a little pricier in Vegas, so this is a good average priced choice by Vegas standards.  

The food is tasty but not life changing, however by Vegas standards this is a great low-key place for grabbing a quick bite to eat.

I made a bad choice coming here for breakfast/brunch.  My husband and I didn't want to drive out and we should have!  I ordered the biscuit with sausage gravy-- eggs where rubbery when they were supposed to be poached! Waffle was bland and the breakfast burrito was okay.  Even my son's kid's meal did not taste good.  We could went to Hash House or somewhere else for almost $90 bucks!!!! Lesson learned

Talk about a disappointment!
