I want to first say that our server was amazing and tried his best to give us the best service ever. Thank you!! 

My friend and I were hungry after a late night on the town, we were staying at MB and were craving burgers. We got there and were seated right away. My friend ordered the French Dip Steak and it was horrible! The meat was dryer than the Las Vegas heat, no taste! The soup that came with it was bland and the pasta was disgusting. Meanwhile I had the hamburger that had no taste to it. 

Now usually if we were paying a cheap price, you get what you pay for. But these orders were $20 bucks a piece. And I understand that it's late at night, but either lower the price or give us fresh food. We let our server know that we didn't like our food (we couldn't even finish it) and didn't want anything else. Then the manager came and basically told us that they did ask us if we wanted anything else and "apologized". Yeah, whatever dude. At the end of it all we did get a cut off our total, but the whole experience was a total let down. If you're going to be serving food, all I ask is for it to be GOOD. Avoiding this place from now on.

Such a great dinning experience here! Food and service was a 9 out of 10. We were greeted by the hostess as soon as we arrived. We decided to sit at the bar. The Bloody Mary had the perfect amount of spice for someone who doesn't like to burn their pallet while they sip. We had to ask the bartender if we could order, but she was very friendly and efficient. We split the meal very easily; the bartender took the extra step to have it served on two separate plates. When our plates reached us the food was still hot and flavorful.We had to ask for our bill. This restaurant is very clean and organized; everything always comes out correctly and tasty.

With so many Las Vegas strip hotels and even (many) more eating establishments to choose from, how did I find myself eating at the counter of this casino deli on a Sunday afternoon watching a women's college softball game?
Don't ask!
But it did have one of the best BLT's I've ever had. Go figure? The service was slow, the place was noisy, my bar stool got bumped twenty times by patrons, buses and waiters but damn what a sandwich. Everything about it was so damn good! Portions, plating, sides (mine was slaw), pickles and peppers - wow everything - great!

If I found myself in that same predicament again I would definitely go back again minus the woman's college softball game.
Nos sirivieron porciones muy grandes y la comida estaba sabroza, aunque el precio me parecio algo exagerado.

The "Ulitmate Mary" was unbelievable! Wow - what a cocktail. We had the organic granola & fruit parfait and the citizens famous bacon egg & cheese. The potatoes we dry and odd flavoring though.  Other than that good experience.

Great food at a great price. Atmosphere is excellent with a great vibe. I'm at Mandalay Bay weekly and I get my latte here every time. Beer selection is great, and juice menu impressive. I'd give it 5 stars if the lady working at the register didn't have a melt down over a receipt not printing and swear up a storm in front of my toddler. Was pretty unbelievable.

Taking over the giant old space that was once Red, White and Blue, Citizens was designed by a 'famous' design firm for the Light group. The space is huge, and comprised of all hard surfaces; hard floors, hard ceilings, and hard walls. What this equates to is an extremely loud dining experience, even if it's not that full. The vaulted ceilings, light fixtures and finishes are all cool, but this place is just huge. I would also point out that if you want comfort, do not sit on the incorrectly proportioned backless bar chairs at the bar, and instead get yourself a table.  More importantly this place is overpriced; you'll notice that just about everything on the menu is about $2-3 more than you'd be willing to spend. I had this gripe when I ate at Mandalay's noodle shop a few weeks ago when my lunch special was an astonishing $18 for a soup and lunch-portioned dish. Apparently the property really likes to take advantage of their massive convention crowds. With everything from breakfasts, salads, burgers, entrees and desserts you can certainly find something you'd like, just expect to pay handsomely for it. Also, they use the words 'specialty' and 'signature' quite a bit on their menu, but looking around at other people's dishes and based on my meal this definition seems to be based around providing mediocre, high priced sandwiches.

My classic hamburger was placed in front of me and looked as mediocre as it tasted. The bun was dry and a bit too big, but well-proportioned to the patty. Not sure if you have a choice of cheeses, but when I asked for a cheeseburger I wasn't offered any options and was given American cheese. The presumably frozen patty had ok char flavor, but was of your extremely generic back yard BBQ variety, and very overcooked at that. But I guess one of this quality shouldn't be ordered any other way. One small slice of not too fresh tomato didn't provide much coverage, but I had plenty of pickles, lettuce and red onion at my disposal. Overall this had nothing great going on. 

My waffle fries sucked as they always do, and considering the menu gives you the option of skinny fries, potato salad or coleslaw I'm not quite sure why I got these stupid fries. They're clearly never fresh due to how they're made, so why bother? Plus, $21 for a burger and iced tea is about $9 more than you should pay for this, even in a casino setting capitalizing on desperate conventioneers. After this awful experience, combined with Burger Bar's drop off, I can probably now claim that there are no decent burger options south of Tropicana along the Strip until you get much more south away from the casinos. If you're at Mandalay I would still recommend Burger Bar over this as you get far better quality for the money, but I can't promise anything there anymore.
Went here late night a few times (after 1pm) service was good food was good. Nachos are so good!  restaurant is clean and usually does not have a wait.

Went for breakfast.   Had the eggs/potatoes and Bacon.   Bacon was super greasy and the whole meal was over $100 for 4 people and not that good.......
House of blues has a $9.99 breakfast special so you can avoid this place
My boyfriend and I went for a late night drink and snack. We ordered nachos and they're so good. Big enough to share among 3 people! The Cadillac Margaritas were good too. Their service is amazing!
Had a great meal.  Lotus was a wonderful  waitress. There were 6 of us and she got our order right without writing it down.  Everyone loved their food.  Highly recommend this place.

Went to Citizens in July. Juice bar has good flavors, chunky monkey in particular! We started w/ calamari (yum) and buffalo wings (way to spicy for my taste) I ordered the steak quesadillas for my main entree and lets just say I wouldn't order them again. 

Service is great though

The food was great, the service was great, and the prices were not bad. The place can get a little noisy and the tables are close together. 
So we choose to sit at the bar. Great idea...Loved our bartender. She made us really yummy Bloody mary's with infused in house Jalapeño vodka and she was very attentive even though she was super busy making drinks for the tables. 

I did realized menu is more comfort food than anything but we were craving salads so we both opted for two of the salads and we both shared. 

1. Kale and brown rice salad with grilled chicken
2. Quinoa vegetable Salad with grilled Salmon

Yummy....Huge portion, tasty and fresh. I was fully satisfied with our selections. 

It's open 24 hours!! It's pretty awesome when your in Vegas knowing you'll be up all night and hungry at any time.
You can either sit and be served or order and pick up...but if you order and pick up, you must eat out on the patio of the restaurant.

Good and bad...this would be a 4/5 star because the quality of the food and flavor was really good......but my experience was annoying. I called them at 5 AM asking about the menu options at that hour and they said that the to go part was open and what I wanted to order was available when I told her. Once I got there and made my order(Turkey avocado sandwich), they said they were out of the cranberry walnut bread it's normally served on, which is part of why I wanted to go there to try it and they should've told me that on the phone. Whatever, I got it on sourdough instead. Then I ordered a chicken Caesar salad, the chicken soup and the green mean juice shake. They said that they wouldn't serve me the soup because it had been sitting there all day..... Ok then why have it on a late night menu if you're not going to serve it? 

Once I got home I realize there was no avocado in my turkey avocado sandwich...again annoying...to pay for something I didn't get and not wanting to drive all the way back for it. Anyways, the food still tasted good and I could tell was fresh. 

My bill was $35 for a salad, sandwich and drink.....pretty pricy but I don't mind paying to bad because the quality was good. I will definitely come back here to try it again. Hopefully this next time I'll have a better experience and can give it more stars.
Didn't get greeted on our way in. When she led us to our table, pulled the chair out in front of me. Left for another spot.

Wow! You can start with the bright eyed waitress Rachel and stop there!! She really made my experience!! I wandered in here by accident and was greeted with such smiles I said I MUST dine in! I asked Rachel about flavored coffee and she suggested caramel!! It was simply amazing!! Then I ordered the smoked salmon Benedict!! Wowsies!! It was simply amazing!! I guess I know where I am having breakfast every day while I am In town!! Their lunch looks great too!!! If you stay at Mandalay Bay you must try this place!!!

I could see this place being like a regular breakfast place, the food is good, the portions are okay, and the prices are a little high but nothing more than you would expect in a tourist area. Not the greatest breakfast place I've even been to but about 5th or 6th on the list.

If you are walking through Mandalay Bay and decide you are hungry, do not choose to stop here.  We were hungry and we saw this place. It didn't look like there was a long wait, so we put our name in. She said 10 minutes. After 25 mins I asked what's up. She said "That time was an estimation and as soon as the "right" table opens we will be sat". I said ok.. 5 mins later we had a table. Now mind you the surrounding 4 tables were empty too. We sat there for at least 10 minutes  before anyone even came over. We ordered drinks, I a soda, my nephews soda and the last a water no lemon. When guy finally brought the drinks he brought water with lemon. My mom is allergic so we asked if he would just change it out. He had the worst attitude and when he came back
he tossed the water on the table.This was completely offensive. I located the manager and asked or another server. The new server was nice but extremely slow. The surrounding tables all got their food long before we did. It was just not a fun experience. We will never, ever be back!

Yes, we went on their opening day but still, 2 hours for a lunch that consisted of a couple of sandwiches and a salad is completely unacceptable.  Since this place was Red, White and Blue like 5 minutes ago, I'm 99% sure they just re-branded the place and didn't replace their entire staff.  Of course, I could be completely wrong about that.  Even so, for a restaurant that was less than half full, they should have it together enough to throw some sandwiches on a plate.

On the bright side, our server was nice and always had our drinks refilled.  The food, once we got it, was decent.  My Greek salad was huge, although, I'm not sure it was Greek so much as an Italian chopped salad like the kind you'd get at your favorite pizza joint.  The salmon that I ordered with it was, despite being heavily over seasoned, cooked very well and pretty good.  The portions are huge but for the $32 I spent on a salad and an iced tea, I still think it's pretty steep, although probably on par with the rest of the hotel outlets.

It does look like they've put some thought and effort into their beverage program, which I appreciate.  I've been dying to try the new Bombay Sapphire East, which they have here and nowhere else that I've seen in the hotel.  They've also come up with a cocktail menu that looks like they've tried to put twists on some of what seem to be Vegas' most popular drinks.  If I hadn't been working, I would have given them a go.

Honestly, I probably won't ever come back for lunch because I will most likely be fired for being gone so long again.  Since I basically live at the Mandalay Bay for work, I'm sure I'll be back at some point.  Hopefully with a lot of time on my hands.

Although Mandalay Bay already has a cafe(Raffles), the food here is very similar to Vegas cafes with exception of some specialty entrees. A little bit pricey for cafe food but pretty good quality. 

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night, not too busy and were immediately seated. The server was very friendly, took our order right away and frequently came back to check on our table. There wasn't a long wait for the food to come out as compared to the irritatingly slow food at Raffles.

The Tuna Melt I ordered was superb! I know it's a simple dish, but you can tell a huge difference between the sandwich here and a $5.99 melt somewhere else. The tuna had great quality while the bread and cheese were grilled to perfection. I love the crunchy softness.
My friend ordered the French Dip Steak which was very good as well.

This place is well-worth coming back to if it was comp'd again! haha
But I'd probably just stick to a cheaper cafe or grill if I were craving a sandwich.
Food was ok.  Just your generic restaurant.  Feels like an upscale version of Applebee's. Save your money.  Service was friendly

This is one of the more affordable places to eat at in Mandalay Bay.  I think the food here is really better than 3, more 3.5, but I rounded down because while our server was friendly and French (which for some reason always makes it feel more special), we had to flag him down a few times to get something and even to get our check.  
We went in during an odd time and ordered calamari, wings, and meatball appetizers.  The first two was good, but not very memorable except for how big the servings were.  The meatball however, was gigantic and quite tasty!  I wanted to just have that the entire time I was in Vegas.

My entree was great! I ordered the brick chicken which came with mashed potatoes, gravy and broccoli. YUM. My boyfriend ordered the teriyaki bowl which wasn't very tasty compared to mine-pretty bland. 

It is a bit expensive here, however, they have a prix fixe for $29 that includes a three course meal before 7:00pm. We did not do this because adding a salad and dessert isn't our thing but if you like a multi course meal this would be great for you.

The overall ambiance of this restaurant is very "kitchenette modern" looking. A lot of old school black and white decor and vintage addings. The dress code is business casual, however, in Vegas anything goes. 

Out of all the restaurants in Mandalay bay this one has the most to offer.

Please don't eat here!! I love to eat, trust this is true! For the price and the sake of being surrounded by highly renowned chefs/ restaurants this place was a letdown. My husband, friends and I came here for breakfast and the food was cold. (How do you mess up breakfast?!) My eggs Benedict was overly poached and hash browns were cold. I asked if they could just bring out another side of hot hash browns and that's exactly what I got. My second plate of hash browns tasted like rubbery overheated hash. What do you expect if it came out a few mid later. Despite the reviews we gave it shot and the reviews were right, sadly. I mentioned to the waitress that my eggs were suppose to be runny and dripping yolk over my toast and all she could do was apologize. The manager on shift was snooty when she came over to our table. She asked why we didn't enjoy our food and asked if we would like another dish but had an unfriendly demeanor. We felt really awkward and just wanted to leave. Denny's would have been a better choice.

I am writing this review factoring cost out; food in Vegas is really expensive if you are in or near the strip. Expect to pay $17 for an omelette consisting of chicken and egg whites. With that being said, the service and food here is pretty good and is one of the better places to dine if you are in Mandalay Bay attending a conference, a conference where apples were sold for $5 each. The seating inside is ample and service here is friendly. They have a variety of options and their coffee is pretty good. You can check in to get a free cheesecake. We checked in one day, and redeemed our cheesecake to go as a side along with our breakfast (we are savages). I recommend the omelettes here or the skillets.

I don't know how I should feel about this place.

Citizens Kitchen & Bar is located in the center of the restaurant row in Mandalay Bay, and as such, it ain't cheap. We had Kale Salad and Chicken Sandwich, while both were pretty good, they charged $5 each for the water bottle. We just asked for water and they charged $10 automatically without asking. It might work for one-off tourists, but I don't think that's a sustainable business practice for locals.

The food quality was not bad, thus three stars.

We stopped in for snacks at this casual Mandalay Bay restaurant since we weren't in the mood for another casino buffet just yet, and the wait time for a table here was zero. 

The "Ultimate Sliders Challenge" (24 Sliders in 24 Minutes) looked interesting. Seems like a whole lotta mini-burgers to choke down in not a lotta time. Impossible for many and conquered by few. $40 Challenge declined.

Hearty plates. We tried a couple dishes which were decent to share or sample. Rather pricey, though, for mostly standard fare IMO. Relatively spendy menu prices aren't exactly budget friendly because Vegas, but the food should fill nicely whether before or after your bender. There are bargains to be found if you're motivated to pinch pennies elsewhere.

-$21 Fish tacos. Nicely battered fish and not oily/greasy. Fresh veggie mix and soft tortillas. Good, but not so much 21 dollars great. Southern California is still tops for best fish tacos and value priced to match.
-$18 Corned beef pastrami sandwich. A nice stack of toasty, melty, meaty, deli goodness that even a New Yorker might appreciate. The consensus winner from our table. The cole slaw side was ok, but probably should've gone with the fries.
-$18 Bacon cheeseburger. Three slices of fine bacon makes for a tasty cheeseburger and the fries were served hot and crispy. Now we need some luck at the tables to recoup the steeply marked up lunch tab.

Service was friendly and efficient. Drinks were refilled regularly. All good there.

There are several restaurant options conveniently located within the Mandalay labyrinth to keep you intrigued, and Citizens Kitchen & Bar is a 24hr accessible spot with familiar fare to satisfy.

I heard they changed up their menu so I had to go back! They still have my favorite queso dip but what I tried and enjoyed was the teriyaki, chicken & veggie bowl. The portions weren't overwhelmingly large but just right. My next trip I'll have to try the brunch. Enjoy?

I'm sorry but the cashier had a very bad attitude and literally made us stand aside and wait thru 20+ more customers when finally another gal who had originally taken our order realized we were STILL waiting! She gave the girl at the register a look as to WHY didn't you call out their order?? She ran and got the cake. In all we waited almost 30 minutes for 2 pieces of ALREADY made cake while people after us actually were getting HOT food!!!

This place is one of the best dining options at Mandalay. I had a half portion of the french onion soup and it was magnificent - loaded with cheese, enough for every bite. The quesadilla I ordered was pretty plain, I wished I had gotten more of the soup. The next night of our stay we found ourselves coming back here for a quick bite. I couldn't help but order the soup again, along with the buffalo chicken sandwich. I was disappointed that the soup didn't have nearly the same amount of cheese as the night before, though the sandwich was really great. The food is pretty expensive, but that's par for the course for a vegas resort. One strange bit is that the regular portion of soup is $14, yet the half is only $5 and is a good size.

Well.. Vegas came n went.  No response from this management group who "reached out" but didn't follow through.

this management group is horrible and the service reflects poor management.  Lip service is all you really get.

I will NEVER eat at this place again.

Do not make the mistake I did by giving this place a chance.

The food was surprising good.  I ate the reuben sandwich with a side of cole slaw which I thought was so delicious.  Never had I ate a sandwich like this!  The bread was toasted well, light and very crispy.  The corned beef was generous and tasty.  The thousand island dressing, sauerkraut, and Swiss cheese together made the sandwich awesome.  Cole slaw on the side complimented the sandwich.  Excellent!

Loved this place so I came back in the evening and had their popular French onion soup and a side salad.  The soup tasted like heaven and portions were generous.  3 different types of cheeses, thick and gooey, covered slivers of soft sweet onions chunks of bread soaked in the soup...It was the first time that I couldn't finish my soup!
Me and my husband decided to find us a place to eat after our wedding.  And this was perfect.  The drinks were spot on,  the portions wear huge for the price.  Will come back for sure.

Since my mom was still sleeping my dad invite my brother and I to grab some breakfast. And since we didn't want to go far we found this restaurant and decided to give it a try. My brother ordered the ultimate breakfast which included pancakes, two eggs, a slice of ham and potatoes, my dad had the classic eggs ham potatoes and toast. I settled for the body builders omelette which was made with egg whites, veggies and chicken breast with a side of fruits. I really enjoyed the omelette it was perfectly cooked and satisfied my cravings!

$4 for coffee water!  We walked all over the Strip to find a good cup of coffee. McDonald's coffee is far superior. That should give you an idea had bad this coffee tasted.  Sorry McDonald's, I should not have compared you to such horrible coffee.

Side note. The service was really good.

Truly a 3-star restaurant. Citizens has a down to earth vibe that reminds you of a Classic American diner...until you see the $4 price for a cup of coffee. But then again, you're not really in America, you're in Vegas. 

Unlike other Mandalay spots, this is a good spot if you know how to order. The $8 side of eggs during brunch is RIDICULOUS. Don't do it. Interestingly, the $2 side of toast is worth it: two slices so large they are a breakfast in themselves. My regular way to start the day at a Vegas trade show at Mandalay is with the chocolate peanut butter smoothie ($9) and that side of toast ($2). For $11, it's a great starter to an intense day on your feet. 

And speaking of being on your feet, the floors in Mandalay leading into Citizens are crazy slippery. I'm shocked people aren't breaking their hips on a regular basis. I ate at Citizens twice this week while in town for the Project trade show and nearly fell over another guest waiting in line for a table. 

The service at Citizens definitely makes up for the overpriced menu. Servers are cheery but not cheesy and just conversational enough. Not bad, but really overpriced (isn't everything in Vegas), so definitely NOT great.
The French dip was really good. Staff was pretty friendly until we had to ask for something they forgot to bring and then they didn't show up as much.
Great breakfast! Eggs Benedict was awesome! Service was friendly and fast. Coffee tasted great, was really surprised to find this place so good for breakfast

Yesterday stopped by for quick light dinner.  Ordered turkey sandwich with  avocado, tomato, and greens.  Also ordered kale salad that include goat cheese and grains mixed in.  Sandwich was dry hard and salty so it was hard to consume.  The salad was hard and flavorless.  Sad...paid $49 for these food and didn't really the food.

Citizen's Kitchen ( Formely known as Red, White, and Blue) is a little bit better than it's predecessor.  I ate here so much during my week stay that they morning crew almost knew what I was going to order as well as my name. The food was good even though you had to wait a little longer than expected even when it wasn't busy. They now have a juice/smoothie bar that I think everyone is still trying to get use to as it took quite some time to make a juice or a smoothie ( no matter if it was busy or empty).  Prices are a little steep but again luckily for me, I was not paying for it.  The portions are a decent size, even when you are just doing a quick takeout from the front. At least this place is now open 24 hours as it predecessor was not. Will I eat here on my own dime, in a pinch yes I would as the food was good even if it was a little pricey.

Excellent food! Great service! They're very quick with service, and very friendly. You can have a great meal and move along so you can explore the rest of Fabulous Las Vegas! 

Lobster roll, turkey sandwich, anything you get will be amazing! Lizzy is a great bartender also.

Ordered the muffalata, bread was hard as a rock, had no flavor, which is amazing for something literally covered in marinated,chopped up olives. Boyfriend ordered the burger, it was burnt on one side. He ordered it medium rare....This place has got to go. Based on the other reviews, I think it should close down and be replaced.

We met with our out of town friend after her day at a convention yesterday and decided to try out Citizens Kitchen & Bar.  My husband and I split the Fish & Chips and my friend got a cheeseburger with no bun.  We all had fries.  Not the healthiest of meals but we were all hungry and looking forward to a quiet place to sit and catch up.  My husband is a fast eater and got through his food fast and within 1/2 an hour, was in the bathroom.  We left earlier then planned as he was not feeling well.  My friend managed to get back to her room before her stomach started bothering her and I made it home.  All night & morning, we all had diahhrea and stomach issues.  I called them in the morning and asked to speak to a manager to let them know what happened so maybe others wouldn't get sick.  I got a snotty, arogant manager who told me they hadn't had any other complaints and since we didn't all eat the same food, it couldn't possibly be food poisoning.  I told her we all had something fried so maybe there was an issue with their fryers and they should look into it.  She said OK - and hung up on me.  What great customer service!  

We spend $70 on 2 meals & 2 sodas and ended up sick as dogs and we basically got - nope, didn't happen, don't care - see you.  Mind you I know their mentality - these people won't be back and we won't have to worry about it again although I did start the conversation letting her know we were locals but that didn't even seem to matter - and it shouldn't - bad food or service should not be for anyone, local or tourists.  But we will definately not be going there again and I will let everyone know what happened so they don't have to experience it themselves.  All of this could have been resolved with a little bit of compasion - it wasn't like I was asking for a free meal or anything - just for them to acknowledge and do something so no one else would get sick.  It might have been a one off but I won't recommend it to anyone - if management doesn't care, why should their employees?

Skip CITIZENS. It's a Sat morning in Las Vegas. Citizens in Mandalay Bay has nothing available!! No cappuccino no macchiato no caffe latte no cafe au lait and no cafe mocha and no breakfast burritos nor bacon egg and cheese sandwich. Only half of juices available. But you can get a regular coffee fruit croissant. Even the girls at the counter acted snooty and could care less, but they sure expected a tip. Pathetic! 
First gal never poured our regular coffee even though there was only one couple on line behind us. 2nd gal ROXANNE claimed that my MLife card had no points. I explained I wanted bill for MLife discount and gave her my credit card or offered room number and she refused saying my MLife card was incorrect. 
Later, I had to spend time with MLife from my hotel room phone to fix the problem. Well there was no problem! Only problem was ROXANNE at CITZiZENS! 
Thankfully Ashley at MLife applied the discount over the phone so I wouldn't have to stand in line. Thank you Ashley at MLife. 
SKIP CITIZENS!

The only late night option for food in the Mandalay Bay located in the back part of the casino near the nightclub & Mandalay Bay arena. The food is pricey, I think I blew 20 bucks for a sandwich & some chips (and just when I though the blackjack worked me over bad that night.) despite my resentment for the price that food was actually decent, not worth the price but if you're starving it hits the spot.

I had lunch here with my husband during a business trip.  I had the best grilled chicken sandwich of my entire life here.  My husband, however, had a spoiled grilled chicken caesar salad, and subsequently spent the next two days in the bathroom between conferences. :( I hate to give a 2 star review, especially when the service was so good, but spoiled food is not okay with me.  If it were not for that, I would revisit.

Definitely one of the better (and slightly more affordable) restaurants in Mandalay!

I shared the Tarragon Chicken Salad Sandwich (with a side of potato salad) and the Kobe Beef Fries with a friend. The sandwich was really good! It comes on toasted bread which works well with the texture of the chicken salad. It's a good size too. The potato salad was ok, but nothing special. 

The fries were actually really good, but I don't know if they are worth the price. I think you lose some of the kobe flavor when you mix it with chili. Still, really tasty!

Service was really great too. Our waiter was on top of his stuff, and he was straightforward about everything in the menu and his suggestions (which I have grown to appreciate in a waiter).

The food was amazing. It was the best quesadilla I'd ever had. 
The wait staff was good. However it was all together a little slow, maybe the kitchen was slammed or something.

A casual American restaurant located inside Mandalay Bay is a great option for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

There is a to go bar to order off the limited menu, which has sandwiches, salads, juices and coffee. I dined in for lunch on Saturday and the service was horrible. It was not busy at all, yet the waitress was very slow to take our order and to deliver the check.

I ordered the mushroom bleu burger, which is exactly how it sounds, a burger with bleu cheese, mushrooms, jalapeño, lettuce, onion and tomato. It is a bit pricey for a typical burger that did not stand out.

I would try this place again and try another dish with another server, but it didn't give a lasting first impression. I recommend it to hotel guests not wanting to leave the hotel, but there are other restaurants in the Mandalay Bay Shoppes including another burger joint.
Food was excellent, drinks are excellent, Service was excellent. My husband liked the ACME Pale Ale beer. Had the turkey burger and chips and queso. Both were good. :)

I will start off by saying that I am a local. I could have went to any sandwich joint/cafe off the strip and paid a LOT less, HOWEVER, I knew I was on the Strip. If you are on the Strip, you're going to pay twice any amount for that sandwich. Get over it. I ordered the tarragon chicken sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the turkey and avocado on wheat instead of whichever roll they had listed on the menu. The staff was happy to accommodate to our requests and were more than friendly. My sandwich was out of this world delicious. The bread was so surprisingly delightful. Crusty, but with a soft pillowy center. One sandwich was nearly more than enough for me. The boyfriend and I usually order two things and trade halves. His turkey/avocado sandwich was exactly what he was looking for and made to satisfaction. It wasn't anything that lifted my eyebrows but there was absolutely nothing wrong with it. All good here if you're just looking for a quick sandwich.
Wow this place was great , Amazing Rueban and fish Tacos are a must!! Service was also to the "T"

I was in town for a few days for a conference and wandered in to Citizens for lunch on the first day.  The food was pretty good, had the cobb salad, which isn't going to be a mind blowing experience no matter where you go, lol.  But because the bartender - Raquel - was super cool, I actually ended up going back two more times the following days.  I got the mahi tacos - bomb - and the chicken wings - good chicken, but a tad over sauced.  

I give this place a solid 5 just because I like chatting with Raquel.  But the mahi tacos are definitely worth it too.  

if you are looking for some decent food and cool people, definitely give this place try.

Just Tore Up Some FISH (Shark) & Chips.. And A French Dip!! This Place Had Great Service.. Thanks Nick!! Very Cool and Made Great Recommendations!  This Spot Has Music, Full Bar & Even A Deli To the Front For To Go Items.. Will Def Come Back!! Great Decor.. Really Cool Laid Back Spot!!

Bland overpriced breakfast with servers who had no clue what they were doing and were more interested in chatting with their friends instead of serving us.

Coffee cups sat empty for 10 minutes.  Eggs benedict looked pathetic and had no taste.  Eggs were horribly overdone.

Toast... man, what is it with breakfasts in the U.S. and places not able to simply TOAST toast?  We were served cold bread... when we finally were able to ask for 'toast', they gave us cold bread again that was slightly tan on one side.

Stopped in for an early lunch at Mandalay bay. Decided to sit at the bar. Raquel the bartender was amazing! She recommended the fish tacos w a modelo beer. Fish tacos were delicious and went perfect w the ice cold beer. As a local I recommend the place. Price is high but worth the food and friendliness. Great music friendly staff fast service and great food all in one place. Diffidently five stars

This is a review for the cafe part of Citizens, not the actual restaurant.

Hungry after a night of partying and wanting something of sustenance in our systems before hitting Daylight, our group wandered into Citizens to pick up some food.

Between Boyfriend and I, we got a bottle of water, a fresh fruit bowl and a croissant. And it totaled to just over $16. WHAT. WHAAAT. The bottle of water itself was $5. FIVE DOLLARS. Even my croissant was only $3.50 (ONLY, she says). My poor wallet.

At least the food was okay. The croissant was light, flaky and huge, so I suppose it kind of made up for the price. The fruit was pretty good -- but unless it's spoiled, it's kind of hard to mess that up.

The other members of our group got various salads (I distinctly remember seeing the quinoa salad) and a tuna sandwich. Their food looked pretty good, but I didn't try it. Regardless, I didn't hear any complaints, so I suppose it was decent enough to satisfy our appetites.

Next time, I think I'll just go hunt down either a Starbucks or something instead if I'm craving a croissant. That's just ridiculous.

I had a string of business meetings at the Black Hat conference this week, and received outstanding service from the staff, particularly two waiters: Chelsea and Kevin. Management was very understanding of my two days' worth of meetings there, and has been extraordinarily accommodating. I will be sure to come back for next year's conference!

This place is yummy! We decided not to do brunch, but lunch instead. Here's the breakdown:
Signature Bellini: very very yummy. We ordered a second round
Queso and chips: the dip was very tasty and not too spicy. However, the chips were stale. We asked our waiter to bring fresh ones, and the 2nd batch was not much better. 
French dip: overflowing with meat and caramelized onions, used a knife and fork. Very tasty, recommend for sure. 
BBQ salad: typical salad. Didn't have much dressing, but didn't really need it. The toppings were tasty. 

Would we come back again: for sure

This is a place for some comfort food. I had the meatloaf and mashed potatoes which were both on point and my husband had the prime rib with onion rings and a side of mash potatoes. It was all good but DAMN...too expensive. Cost us $85 and change. 

The only thing other than the cost that I didn't like was the waiter picking up our receipt while we were still sitting at the table. All waiters and waitresses know that this is a NO, NO!

The seats were a little uncomfortable too.

I love Citizens. They have a delicious breakfast and great coffee. For dinner, the meatloaf is so, so good! Great beer choices. I eat here multiple times every time I stay or have an event at Mandalay Bay. A+!

I don't normally give 1 star reviews unless the customer service experience was horrible, which was not the case here.  The wait staff was mediocre, nothing special, nothing bad though.  I did however get a bad case of food poisoning though from my meal, which had their salmon in it.  I did not finish the meal entirely, and the food was also mediocre (3 star food at best), but the food poisoning did it for me.  C'mon guys, make sure that kitchen is clean and the food is cooked!

After getting in on a super-delayed flight, standing in line at 2 am for check-in, and making our way to the room, the ONLY place with food that was open was Citizens.

The very comfortable comfort food did the trick, and the price was pretty super.  Also of note was the service.  It was hoping, as you would expect, and the servers were high energy.  Citizens hit the spot!

Cafe says its 24 hours - well not exactly. Waited 5 minutes in one line to be told they weren't seething for breakfast but weren't seating for lunch but I could wait in another line for take out order. It gets better. Waited in other line to be told they weren't serving breakfast or lunch - so no sandwiches etc but I could buy a bag if chips and a drink. Also if I bought them I could not sit in their dining area because they're in - wait for it- transition. At the ripe old age of 52, I have never gone to a place with a big sign that says 24 hour service inside a 24 hour hotel inside a 24 hour inside near 1000 restaurants that serve at least part of all their menu all the time, to wait 15 minutes for the high privilege of buying a bag of chips and some no name coffee.

We stayed at the Mandalay Bay and ate at Citizens twice; one for a rather late dinner on the night of our arrival, and then again for a more reasonably timed dinner.

Yes, the prices are a bit high, but it's Vegas and compared to other places, this really wasn't so bad.  Plus, the portions are large, which always helps with the sticker shock.

In our visits we had the chicken club, turkey burger, tots, onion soup, calamari, and bacon burger.  Everything was good, no complaints.

The onion soup comes in a HUGE mug, so note that it's not really an appetizer type soup.  Thankfully I saw someone eating it otherwise I likely would have ordered way too much food!

The hours were great as it was the only food option that was open when we arrived.

I was looking around for some place to have lunch before going to the Shark reef Aquarium and I just happened to pass this place. They had their menu on the outside and I saw they had a lobster roll. That is all I needed. So I went to the hostess and got seated. I was told a server would be by shortly. Um not what happened. Now the place was virtually empty and I noticed my server had looked over and saw me sitting there waiting but he never came up and offered me a drink or anything. He just kept staring at me and carried on conversations with his co workers. It made me very uncomfortable. Then he finally comes up and asks me if I am ready. He offers no apology for the wait or the fact that he saw me sitting there and did nothing. He did not ask me if I wanted a drink or anything like servers normally ask first he just asked me if I was ready and had a huge attitude when he asked. The annoying tone in his voice was like I had kept him waiting while I stared at the menu forever or something like that. His attitude surprised me considering I knew what I wanted from the second I walked in and I was the one who was kept waiting but ok. I also wanted to get to the Shark Reef aquarium before I started collecting my social security so if anyone should've been annoyed it should have been me. I ordered my food and guess what more waiting. Again he was too busy doing his own thing to go check on my food. It took almost 30 minutes to get my food. I know it was not the kitchen for one thing the lobster is served cold so is not like they have to cook the lobster and heat it up or anything and my side was coleslaw. How long does that take? I had already thought it was a mistake coming there because my server acted like a complete asshole but it was even worse after I tried this pitiful excuse for a lobster roll. It was disgusting. After I picked through my food I waited and waited for the server to bring me my check. I had to flag him down at some point because if not I would have sat there forever. Well wanting my check must have been a problem because Mr. Attitude acted even more stuck up when I flagged him down and asked for my check. Needless to say after $23 for that lunch I felt leaving unsatisfied and downright stupid for wasting my time and money there. The food was shitty and the customer service was even shittier. others many have a better experience but personally for me I will not ever waste my time and energy here again. Mandalay Bay and Vegas itself has WAY too many superior options for dining for me to waste me time where I am clearly not wanted.

Wow terrible food. We were in a rush to grab a bite to eat before a show. So we stopped by to grab a bite.  The food came fast however, the sandwiches we ordered were terrible. I ordered a simple BLT and the bacon was super salty stale and over cooked. It was like chewing glass. Maybe if I was part of circus sideshow then I might have found it enjoyable.  And my friend got a Ruben that made them sick. And it's overpriced as well. You're better off with fast food. Heck White Castle is better than this place.  Should be called Communism instead.

We ordered the calamari, cheese dip and fish and chips. Food was mediocre and pricey. Our bill came out to $80 (inc tip). Servings were generous though. The calamari was mostly fried flour. We were very disappointed by the juice bar. It isn't really juice, but more smoothie. We spent $30 for three drinks and barely made through a quarter of each drink. Gave them an extra star for decor and the servers were polite and friendly.

Ehhh....it was ok.  We had the eggs benedict and bacon and eggs for breakfast.  Service was pretty good.  The only thing was that the caramel macchiato was waaaay too sweet and the tatertot hash was a bit salty.  I would still go back and give it another try.

Update: Came back again...they were much busier and totally unprepared for the rush. It took 10 mins to get my coffee, 20 mins to get the first plate of food, and another 10 to get my breakfast.  I asked to speak to the manager and he took care of us. Our server tried her best as well.  Oh and the tatertot hash was much better today.

Was at Citizens a couple of nights ago and had a fabulous experience. They primarily serve comfort food and do it extremely well. I had a corned beef Reuben with mashed potatoes. The Reuben was well made and the mashed potatoes were perfect. Neither were particularly special but they were executed perfectly which is exactly what you look for in this type of food.  I sat at the bar and was served by Steven, he was truly a pleasure to talk to. He was helpful about the menu and suggestions and I could tell he really enjoys what he does. He made this experience feel like home!

Food is ok, but waaaayyyy overpriced. They stop serving breakfast items at 11 even though they are on the regular menu with no indication you can't order them all day. The entire line was bummed out by that info at 1115 when I tried to order a bacon egg & cheese, because we all wanted the same thing! Service is terribly slow and the girls behind the counter don't have a sense of urgency when the line is out the door. Save yourself the money and aggravation.

Ejay was the definition of welcoming. New exactly how to treat a table with assistance and space. Food was yummy and decent prices for the areas. Got the burrito and satisfied and the perfect poached eggs on the biscuits and gravy.

The food here is delicious, let me start off by saying that. The hubby and I started off our dinner with the artichoke dip at the recommendation of our server, Tony. Hubby had the ribs and I had the prime rib. Both were huge! And soo good. We will definitely be there again soon. Thanks Tony, for the great service.
Line is out the door. One person making sandwiches at the takeout bar. What are they thinking.

It was... Not that great. First off it is very pricey. Two of us our bill was over $50 and that's with no alcohol. Its run by Lightgroup and i have a bad taste in my mouth from them already. Service was sub par for Vegas and sitting where people are constantly walking right next to you is not enjoyable. The hostesses were probably the best part of the whole experience. The food was dennys quality so don't expect something amazing. (the belgian waffle was pretty amazing though!)

Breakfast was a waste.  Pancakes were not fresh.  Tasted like they were out of a warmer. They were stuck together as if they had been sitting and sweating on each other for an hour. Eggs were a 3 on a 1-10 scale. Then the dish came with some unadvertised glop that appeared to be an attempt as a south west style hash brown mixture but all it did was make the rest of my food taste like hot peppers.

Good, but not great. Large portions to make up for overpriced menu, but honestly I don't need extra food that I'm not going to eat anyway. 

Best thing on the menu: Mahi Mahi Fish Tacos! These in themselves deserve 4.5 stars (the -.5 because it was served with large serving of salsa, sour cream, and guac when each taco was already topped with pico, lime creme sauce, and an avocado slice. waste of good guac unless you want to bring me out some chips). So so so good.

Most "meh" thing on the menu: Mac & Cheese. I'm a huge mac and cheese fan, and I didn't have any desire to finish this one. Cheese sauce was lacking a cheese flavor. Ham is a good idea, but lets focus on the fundamentals first. 

Service was slow. Very nice people, but 80 minutes for lunch? I get it's busy but come on guys, get us out of there in a reasonable time.

This place is bomb. I stayed at the Mandalay for 4 nights. I could have hiked it over to the food court for a pleble $5 Nathan's hot dog, but for $15 for a sandwich 24/7 365, why now. The French dip is insane. I had it twice. Also had a cold turkey sandwich. Very legit. Also tons of pastries etc. Prices are not too bad, food is quality.

Roast beef sandwich to go was just what I was looking for after walking all morning and heading back to the room. The sandwich had just the right amount of Horshradish on it and the roast beef was sliced thin and piled up.

A last night minute resort after Kevin Hart show. 
A couple of friends and myself forced ourselves to get over the fact chicken wings were priced at $18 and a small cup of soup $10 the food was horrible. The wings had some sort of sauce sloped over it and the soup was blah! The pastrami sandwich was dry and the bread stale. Eat at your own risk LV.,,
There's a billion people behind the counter and yet they can't seem to get an order correct or out in a timely fashion.

I just left from my table still hungry after waiting for over an hour and watching at least 6 different parties be seated AFTER me enjoying their meal. My waitress only came over twice, once after I'd been sitting 20+ minutes to take my order and once again 40 minutes after that to ask me what I ordered. Bish, BYE! 

Now I'm in bed starving eating a $5 hummus and pretzel chip snack back.

Coming back to the hotel late the only place that was open was Citizens Kitchen and Bar. We were seated quickly and our orders were taken after our drink orders. The ultimate nachos with chicken had our names written all over it. Once the gigantic portion of the nachos arrived we could tell that their name was not a mistaken. There was a giant stack of nachos covered by sour cream, salsa, cheddar cheese, olives, beans, cheese wiz like cheese, jalapeños, and chicken. 4 of us split the order, with it being a meal for 2 of us and a side for the other 2. These nachos definitely hit the late night craving. There is plenty of nachos to share, and we even had some left at the end as they do get heavy with the cheese whiz on it. Most of the nachos retained their crispyness and crunch, except for the bunch on the bottom that were smothered in the cheese whiz. While at Citizens I did see giant and I mean giant pieces of cake that I will want to try on my next trip to Las Vegas.

For a 24 hour restaurant the food, look, and service are very good. The menue is simple but good. The bar offers great drinks. Our service could have been faster and the noise can be an issue but I was very happy with my late night dining.

Items Selected:
Lavazza Coffee
Ultimate Tots Smothered & Covered - Cheddar, Chicken Gravy
The Big Meatball Parm - Beef, Pork, Grandma's Gravy, Ricotta
Kobe Chili Cheese Fries - Kobe Sirloin, Cheese Sauce, Waffle Fries
Chicken & Waffles - Bacon and Cheddar Waffle, Fried Chicken, Jalapeno Maple Syrup
Crème Brulee French Toast - Strawberries, Custard, Whipped Cream
Red Velvet Pancakes - Whipped Cream Cheese
Classic Carrot Cake - Cream Cheese Frosting
Reese's Peanut Butter Cookie
Chocolate Chip Cookie

Perfectly fine with French food and well experienced with 'modernist' cuisine, both at local spots as well as internationally revered recipients of three Michelin Stars, but born in the Midwest and raised on anything but foie gras or liquid nitrogen cocktails suffice it to say that I'm a fan of the whole "upscale American" movement - the sort of food that takes the shake n' bake that mother used to make and turns it into something worth leaving the house for, the sort of food that critics love to critique even though they likely cannot make it as well themselves...the sort of food being served at Citizens Kitchen and Bar in Mandalay Bay.

Open 24/7, and still operated by Light Group despite the recent Hakkasan acquisition, it was just after 11am that a friend and I arrived at the Citizen hostess podium and dining as guests of the manager it was mere moments before we were led to a large four-top at the restaurant's back corner - the low-slung leather banquets of soft leather so comfortable that one might want to take a nap in them, particularly with the sounds of Dylan, Zeppelin, and Pink Floyd playing from the speaker system above.

Obviously a restaurant of dual personalities, the weekend brunch a casual and laid back affair while late nights are said to be a raucous mess of patrons exiting nearby Light Nightclub, it was under the watchful eye of a British gentleman named Tim that our meal took place and whether an effect of being known to the chef or simply the young man's mannerisms the service could not have been better - easily the best I've experienced in Mandalay Bay with plenty of whit and knowledge to compliment an eight plate feast with enough food that it could have fed two-to-three more.

Noting up front that the 'grab n' go' section is mostly devoid of housemade options, instead outsourcing all but the cookies and a few cakes due to kitchen constraints, it was with four savory dishes that the meal began and with plenty of par-for-the-course Lavazza to wash it all down the first round was a bit of a mixed bag - the chicken and waffles excessively priced at $24 with both items less crunchy than would be ideal, though the tots and waffle fries each proved crisp and quite capable of holding up to cheese and meats with substantial depth of flavor, an adult-fist of a meatball also standing out with impressive tenderness beneath a good sear in a bath of bright tomato sauce with grated cheese adding just enough salinity to make it all shine.

Moving next to a duo of sweets, it was somewhat surprising that the Red Velvet Pancakes were not to be found on the weekend menu, but with a simple request a substantial stack of three Frisbee-sized discs was produced with each proving exceptionally fluffy and loaded with cocoa beneath a checkerboard of cream cheese frosting, the neighboring French Toast another hefty option with a crunchy topcoat overlying four supple-centered slices dripping with custard as fresh cream and strawberries completed the picture - both plates on par with the best in the city, and the former amongst the best nationwide.

Unwilling to forgo desserts, and as such requesting the rest of the pancakes be packed up, it was with little hesitation that a slice of carrot cake was ordered and clocking in at probably 12-ounces the four layer slice would prove not only enormous but also outstanding, the moist base bespeckled with carrots, raisins, and nuts amidst a bold spice heavy in cinnamon and nutmeg - a pair of freshly made cookies proving equally delicious and thus leaving one to wonder just how much better Citizens could be if it brought the whole pastry department in house.

O my goodness gratuitous I am and was incredibly disappointed by the way this place is managed and run. Never have I had such terrible service but what makes it worst is that it was from multiple people (including the manager) WOW!! Only reason this place has 2 stars and not 1 is becasue it is located in a cool hotel. No way no how will not ever stop by at this place again. Incredibly rude and unhelpful people. I was appalled at the way the manager or supervisor lady we spoke to runs this place. We walked by on the weekend of my birthday before heading back to LA around 11:30am on a Sunday and was told by the hostess that they were currently not seating anyone and to check back in about 20 minutes. We tried to ask if we can just sit at a table and have a drink but again she was persistant with more or less the same answer but in a much more rude way.  So we took a walk around Mandalay for a bit then upon our return around 12 we were told the same thing. At this point we were a bit frustrated and mad so we asked to speak to their manager. The lady came out and explained to us that they were changing cooks so could not seat anyone. But not only that in a very rude and snarky type of way, almost as if speaking and explainng was painful. We just wanted to sit out by the patio area and have a few drinks and people watch. But apperantly thats way to much to ask for these people. We finally ended up getting a table after somewhat of a heated confrontation from the bitter clueless manager. We had a few drinks and bought a few bread items/pastries from inside but could definitely feel the unpleasent welcome. How difficult is it to say sorry the kitchen is currently closed but if you wish to sit outside and enjoy some drinks go ahead. I mean geez it is freaking VEGAS how can you deny people drinks, she was very clear and did not want to let us sit in the patio table area she said we could sit at the bar but I guess customer service and making money is not exactly their first priority here... If I were the owner or person in charge I would seriously think about training the employees better. I know the hostess was just following directions but one would expect a person such as the female manager/supervisor to be a bit more competent with customer service as apposed to chasing money away. Will definitley tell everyone I know that is going to Vegas (specificly Mandalay Bay) to avoid this place like the plague.

Was wandering around Mandalay Bay with friends after a night out clubbing looking for some late night drunchies and we were directed here by the staff.

Despite it being 3am there was a 10-minute wait, which we spent pondering the menu. We ended up choosing the tater tots, penne prosciutto, and kobe chili cheese fries. Maybe it was the alcohol, but we thought everything was delicious and devoured it all. Service was pretty decent too, and the prices were quite reasonable.

Vegas Strip..... The streets where tourists wander and pay for overpriced EVERYTHING!

At Citizens Kitchen and Bar, you can either order and pick up at the cashier OR sit at a table and get waited on by a server. If you want to order yourself, you can only sit outside at one of the two patio areas (~7-8 small tables / 6-10% of the restaurant). 

I got a tuna melt.... cheese was solid................ BLAH! Saddest looking tuna melt I've ever seen.

Host wasn't friendly either. Oh, and there was only one table getting waited on inside and the other patio for patrons who want servers was empty..... 

#notenoughtables #wedontwantyourservers #saddesttunameltever

We arrived on 8/21 around midnight and found the only 24 hour restaurant in Mandalay Bay (why!?). Waited for 10 minutes to get seated when the left half of the restaurant appeared empty. Hostess acted like she was doing us a favor by speaking to us-- not friendly at all.

We were finally seated in a small deuce crammed next to a party of 4. We felt like we were sitting on top of our neighbors, when there were at least 3 other open tables nearby that weren't jammed top of anyone else. 

We waited for 10 minutes with no greeting by anyone. We finally just cut our losses and walked out, figuring that if our experience was that bad already, it wasn't worth waiting to see how bad it could get.

Being an M Life member, I was looking for a place that I could get a quick snack that would also help me keep my status. I ended up here and to my surprise, I have no regrets. The husband and I ordered a Chunky monkey drink and carrot cake. The carrot cake portion was HUGE!! That was way more than I was expecting to get but for the cost of $9, it def was a humongous heavy piece of late night cake. Was it worth $9 bucks?? Most likely not. It was moist and it was delicious but for a slice of cake, it was a little dent in my pocket for it. That cake served me as a snack and a part of my breakfast in the morning of the next day. As for the drink, it was good but also $9! The serving size for that was actually small, not worth the $9 even though the flavors were great. Peanut butter and dark chocolate flavors blended with bananas, soy and flax seeds. Tasty food but way too over priced. I get that we are in Vegas but for that price and the longggg wait for just my two items,  I am sure I can still find something  with more bang for my buck.

I never received such horrible customer service in my life.

It all started when my friend and I asked for 2 cups of water (tap).  They told us it cost $1.00 each, which really set me back because at least in California, charging for tap water is illegal.  I was raising that concern to my friend until the cashier barked at us "SINCE YOU GUYS ARE MAKING SUCH A BIG DEAL OUT OF THIS, JUST TAKE THE WATER AND DON'T PAY. IT'S FREE".  Incredibly rude.

I tried to not overreact and ignored her flagrant unprofessionalism, and proceeded to sit down to eat my sandwich.  As my friend was about to sit next to me, she yelled at us "YOU CAN'T SIT THERE, YOU HAVE TO SIT OUTSIDE AT THE PATIO".  I looked around to see if the indoor tables were closed or something, but there were a bunch of people sitting around us.  I then realized that this was some sort of punishment for complaining about the water surcharge.

What the hell.  If I wasn't so tired and hungry, I would've raised hell.  I guess that's what Yelp is for.

If you're in Vegas and looking for a healthy non Buffett or crazy fancy this is the place. I'd go here over a lot of places in Vegas. It's fresh and the atmosphere is great. Their fresh juices are AMAZING
This place has the best sandwiches in vegas.  The portions are HUGE!  It's a perfect place to eat after partying at Light.

Service was horrible. Plenty if tables open yet they made us wait to sit down. Right side of restaurant is so loud you can't hsve a conversation. Different menus for self service and the sit down restaurant. Very confusing. Michael seemed to be the only person with any sense of customer service. Sandwich didn't live up to its price.

The food here wasn't bad, but it wasn't particularly good either. Pair that with the relatively high prices ($9 breakfast burrito, $9 smoothies, etc) and it's not a particularly high value proposition. 

The smoothie I got was the "Green..." something? I can't remember. But it had Kale and Avocado in it, and wasn't bad. My stomach wasn't feeling to great from a heavy dinner the night before, and it had a soothing effect. However it wan't the best kale smoothy I've had, and was probably the most expensive I've ever had at $9, so ehhh... 

The breakfast burrito wasn't particularly good, but it was hearty and satisfying. They are pre-made in the morning, so you can't change anything about them. And while they are pre-made they need to be grilled to order, so they take quite some time. The worst of both worlds overall, but still was the best option for a relatively quick and hearty breakfast in the morning. 

Still, we stopped by here almost every morning that we were staying at Mandalay bay for a business conference, as there really wasn't much competition for quick morning eats in the vicinity. 

I would likely stop by and get food here if I was attending morning conference sessions at the Mandalay Bay conference center again, but probably not outside of that circumstance.

I have visited this venue a few times during my stay since the conference that our companies had was held here in mandalay bay. I had excellent fish and chips and wonderful fish tacos as well as very fulfilling french onion soup.

I notice that this place can get super pack in just a minute since the swarm of people that come in during that special lunch hour window rushing to be seated. And thats why i will give a little acknowledgement to the efficient little asian guy who gets our group going in and out, on point with all the drinks and food order as well as willing to deal with 10 different split check. We appreciate your speed and your tenacity to handle our needy group. I think his name is tommy. 

All and all, i am looking forward to dine in this place again soon.
Was looking for a super quick bite. The Mahi Mahi fish tacos blew me away. Some of the best I've had outside of San Diego or Mexico.

Food was OK but service was very, very slow :c
After looking at my food and reading some of the reviews, I hope I don't get food poisoning.

- - FOOD POISON - - BAD SERVICE - - AWFUL MANAGEMENT - - 
We stayed at Mandalay Bay for our Vegas trip and decided to get something to eat late night, unfortunately the only place open was Citizens Kitchen. We walked in and got seated, the server had problems taking our orders and since he thought he could remember everything without writing it down he then brought out some of the food wrong. It took them 30-35minutes to bring out the food. No one wants to wait that long for food at 2am. Five out of  six people ordered the same food and it was the Burger and let me tell you that the vacation ended right there! Every single person had the worst stomach pain and you can imagine the rest!  I asked for a refund  the following day,  the managers told me that I should send an email with my experience so they could look it over, Nick one of the managers actually tried to help and he told us that they were very embarrassed over this and would do anything to fix it so he asked for the receipt and that he would refund the money, until today I only received $45 out of almost $180, they couldn't even track our bill and refund the rest being that they have an advanced POS system. It took them 3 weeks to refund the $45 while I had to text and call everyday.  Two of the five  people that had food poisoning  actually went to the doctors the day after and were told that it was 100% food poisoning.  Save yourself some time  and pain, do not  go to this place. It has awful food and service. I will never go back to this place and will never ever recommended this place to anyone! 
- - - FOOD POISONING IN VEGAS ON YOUR 1st DAY OF VACATION, HOW MUCH FUN IS THAT - - - 
 
Manadalay Bay should seriously think about renting to this place since they are inside of this hotel and getting so many bad reviews...........

Althought the chicken soup wsa seriously amazing...that is all I can really say I liked about this place

Pros:
1) Great Chicken soup
2) Good bread (if you ask for it)

Cons:
1) Right next to a live band that is CRAZY LOUD...you cannot talk with a friend, or hear even your self think. I had to ask for my food to be wrapped up  to go eat in my room, as it gave me a headache
2) Stiff, not terribly friendly and inattentive service.
3) You should not have to ask for bread and butter when sitting down for dinner
4) A spoon and napkin should probably be included when you order your soup to go
5) Did I mention that the service was stiff, unfriendly and attentive? When my bill came, she dropped it ...literally...on my table, without eye contact or even a 'thanks'. There was only one other table with people in the whole restaurant...so it isn't like she was busy, either

For the food, I would've of given them 3 stars. I had the tuna salad sandwich. But the service is horrible. I was sitting inside with my daughter because I had just ordered my sandwich and she was eating her donut. I was drinking my hot chocolate. The gentlemen who called my name to give me my order decided to approach me & tell me to get my daughter and sit outside!! Because I wasn't dining in. Very unprofessional and douche bag! Just because I wasn't dining in, didn't give him a right to treat me that way! Never again am I even stepping into that place!!!!

The food here is awesome!!!! We got the meatball app, the mahi mahi tacos, and the balboa steak sandwich. They were all amazing! I can't rave enough about the fish tacos!!! They were on point! Our waiter, Robert, was very kind and very helpful! He gave us a ton of suggestions, all of which were great! We will go back for sure!
The fish and chips is some of the best I've ever had. The French dip was also super delicious. Our waiter was great!

Horrible food and even worse service. In fact, mandala bay should be ashamed that a restaurant of such scale is inside the hotel. DO NOT COME HERE! Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else. Paid for $20 per person for basic food but was given the worst attitude by the waitresses in my life.

Considering everywhere is disgustingly overpriced for mediocre food, this place was ok. I'm comparing it to a few other places that were very disappointing like cafe bellagio, and some gross cafe at the paris. 
We grabbed a fairly quick bite here before seeing santana down the hall. We were seated quickly but our server was busy and opportunistic thinking her tip from the larger groups was going to be better so we were overlooked often. We had to request multiple times for things like, another plate, silverware,  refills were really hard to come by. Service was a 2-3 star experience. 
I got the fish and chips and compared to my other meals this one was enjoyable and a ridiculously huge portion.

The most memorable thing about my experience here on Saturday night was I thought the light fixtures were cool.  We tried a couple of apps: chicken quesadillas and Kobe beef chili fries and nothing really good or comforting about them.  The server was nice enough but brought  the check without a pen and after seeing us looking for a pen could not find one himself and or ignored that we needed one.  I thought food was slow coming out of the kitchen as well.  It is sad this is only late night option available at Mandalay Bay.

In between several more upscale restaurants lies Citizens, which has a little bit of everything to satisfy the general American palette.

We showed up as they were transitioning from breakfast to lunch, but no worries, they still sat us down and gave us some chips and pico de gallo to munch on while we waited for the kitchen to shift. The pico was basic, but this isn't the type of restaurant to serve something more elaborate. We ate it all up without complaint. 

For lunch, we both ordered a reuben with corned beef and fries.  Service was prompt at this point. Our sandwiches had nicely toasted bread, an inch or so of juicy corned beef, melty cheese, and a nice layer of sauerkraut.  No complaints from other of us.  We both enjoyed our meals and ate up most of the fries.  

My only complaint on this otherwise standard satisfactory establishment is that it is a bit pricy. It's Vegas though, so expect to pay a bit more for everything.

Citizens breakfast was average. The eggs were made over medium as requested, but the bacon was not hot and the Tator tots with bell peppers and onions weren't my favorite. I had sourdough toast and it wasn't sliced or buttered. Could have had better at Denny's for a lot less.
Service was not the worst but definitely not the best.  All the food tasted frozen, the artichoke dip, the calamari, even the beef. Not good. Pricey for frozen food!
All of us enjoyed burgers and fries.  Great food, prepared and delivered as ordered.  Was actually our 2nd time eating there on this trip.  Open 24 hours so we will probably dine there again.

Excellent service at the bar for breakfast. Went there to avoid conference breakfast food and was greeted by friendly staff, smiles, eye contact, and great food. Try the omelets,  granola and yogurt, or oatmeal. Or have all 3 together for a great start.

I visited Citizens for a late dinner after checking in. The restaurant is pretty big so there was no wait to be seated. We sat in the "outdoor" area, which was nice to people watch and at least have the illusion of being outside. 

We had the artichoke dip, which was among the best I've had and was served with both homemade tortilla chips and grilled pita. My friend is a vegetarian and ordered a veggie sandwich off menu. I had the Mahi Mahi fish tacos. The sandwich was huge and loaded with good veggies. I was barely able to finish two of my three tacos, as the portion was also large on my plate.

The service was sort of slow but our server was friendly. The only bummer is that, since the mini frig in the room is pre-stocked and full, we had no way to take our leftovers with us. Overall, the portions were almost too big, but the price was still reasonable, and I enjoyed the view of the restaurant courtyard area. Citzens is a good stop for a quick, simple meal.

Good service and yummy breakfast. 

Had a vanilla latte ($5) and the eggs Benedict ($14) both were good! I loved the smashed Tator tot hash, very good!

WARNING: do not come here!! This place sucks. My bf and I went to the food court and saw that we had just missed the last call for food there. So we were walking back to our room to leave for MGM when we saw Citizens had sandwiches for sell. 

We went to order at the counter. The chick at the register is super rude. I don't know what she was doing, but it didn't look like anything except looking down at something. So we waited there for her to take our order, she didn't say "Please hold on" or anything. She just continued looking down for 5 minutes and then finally came up and said "What do you want?" I asked her what's the difference between their two menus - one is an a la carte sandwich menu, and the other includes a side. I didn't feel too hungry, so I got an a la carte wich, but my bf got a sandwich plate and a side. I don't know if the girl has a hearing problem or what, but she couldn't get my bf's order right even though he didn't get anything super special or altered. Finally the meals come out, we were sitting indoors and they said we can't sit there because it's full service for people who got something with a side. Excuse me!...my bf ordered something with a side so let us sit there already. We were already exhausted from being treated so rudely by the gal taking our order, now they're saying we can't sit where we rightfully have permission to. We then asked for everything to get packaged to go so we could sit outside as they demanded. 

The sandwiches themselves are decently sized but nothing special at all. Does it warrant a $13 price tag? HELL NO! I wish I could ask for our money back because this place left such a sour taste in our mouths. I got the Turkey, avocado, and sprouts sandwich. The ingredients are fresh seeming enough, but seriously nothing to write home about. My bf got the Reuben, which poorly assembled and just messy. This was the worst spent $40 of our lives. I don't know how anyone else gives this place more than 3 stars (and even that is too generous). We are paying customers, we should be treated with respect, not whatever they say is passing for service here.

Me and my family are here in Las Vegas for the SuperZoo convention and decided to stop and grab some lunch here at the Citizens Kitchen & Bar. That was a bad decision. It all started out alright, service was okay, server was nice enough. We came in and we're almost the only ones there.. As we sat they got busier and busier and that's when our service got worse and worse. Our food came and it was very bland, drinks very dry, and the service getting worse and worse. We would get the occasional how is everything, how are you guys doing followed by a dash off, not even to stop and hear the response to his question. My brother ordered a drink, to which he got a response that they don't have that drink, this was not the case. The actual waiter didn't know that they even had this drink on the menu.. Very disappointing service, very bland and tasteless food.. Definitely wouldn't recommend it if your here in Las Vegas..

Went to Citizens for breakfast and had a wonderful waiter at the bar named Steven! He was awesome great customer service and conversation.  Made me the most fabulous Mimosa! Thanks Steven you were awesome!

This places wasn't on our agenda, but my fiance and I were hungry so before we got that cranky feeling, we decided to find food FAST! 

There was no wait so we were immediately seated. The waitress was nice at first. She tended to us, answered all our questions, and took our order. It took a long while to get our food, but we didn't want to make a big deal because the Olympian Soccer player, Mia Hamm was sitting right next to us. 

I ordered the Mac and Cheese which the cheese was so runny, it looked like clam chowder. The cheese wasn't orange, but it was white. I also had the Smothered Tator Tots which was good. My fiance had the Tuna Melt and Corn on the Cob, He enjoyed the corn, but said he had better Tuna Melts. 

After we got our food, we noticed the waitress so involved with Mia Hamm and her guest. We finally made eye contact and asked for our bill. When I gave her my credit card, the waitress came back with my reciepts to be signed. I was writing a tip and calculating my total when the waitress came back. She apologized and said she accidentally put Mia Hamm's table on my credit card. She said, since they didn't close the bill, my credit card will not be charged. WRONG! I went on my bank statement that day and I seen two charges for Citizen's. One charge finally dropped off two days later. 

I wouldn't come back again. There food is ridicously over priced for what it is. There are a ton of other great restaurants in Vegas.

We stopped in here yesterday for a quick smoothie while shopping at LUSH cosmetics. First, it wasn't quick at all ! Second, it was 10 bucks for a tiny cup! That is not OK even if we were in Madalay Bay. Then when my wife had her cup up, I saw a date 4-8 written with a sharpie on the bottom. This smoothie lacked flavor completely and was very chunky. I hope the date on the bottoms doesn't mean it was prepped ahead of time!?!?! 

Needless to say, we ended up throwing the thing away! I literally feel like a threw a ten dollar bill in the trash ! What a waste of time and money !! We will not go back here EVER!

It's funny, you can always identify an ineffective manager when the easiest most simple request is denied for an unknown reason. ...Ate dinner at Citizens the first night of my stay in Las Vegas.
The next morning I went there for coffee and here is where the problem arose. I eat oatmeal as I have a special diet for breakfast. 
I asked for hot water with my coffee and after a discussion with I guess her manager, the waitress came back and said I could have the coffee but would have to eat the oatmeal elsewhere. I mean they are not crowded, I'm at the Bar so I don't take up a precious table. Won't be eating there again this trip just to reward their service. Went down the hallway at Mandolay Bay to the next eatery and they had no problem with the hot water. 
I love yelp as you get to make sure the owners realize how their employees treat their customers.

So this is probably the most affordable place to eat inside Mandalay Bay . This eatery has indoor seating as well as patio seating . They are located next to Lupo restaurant .

I wanted a low carb option for breakfast so I stopped by to take a look at their quick to go offerings . They have pastries , salads , coffees .

I ordered a Cobb salad to go which cost about $11. It had lettuce , cubes of Swiss cheese , bacon , eggs , scallions , tomatoes . It was a decent size and the nice cashier gave me an extra ranch dressing for free . The salad looked a bit messy compared to the other ones I saw in display case but it tasted pretty good nonetheless .

The caffe latte was $5 and made to order . It was a delicious hot coffee that was made well .

I'd stop by again to try out breakfast items if I stay in this hotel again .
Great food and our server Lotus was wonderful.   Would highly recommend this place.  Everyone at our table loved their food

If you happen to be in Mandalay Bay, check out Citizens restaurant. I was showing my "tourist"  friends around this hotel last night when we decided we want to rest our feet a bit. And there in the middle of everything was Citizens. It seemed like a pretty slow night. Few tables in the other side of the restaurant and just us in our side :) exactly what we needed. Lotus ( i will never forget this name. I mean how can you? ) was our server. She was professional and had a great personality and funny at the same time. She made us laugh GOOD at least 3 times. Lol.
