She helped us navigate through the menu and recommended her favorite bottle of of wine. It was spot on!! We then asked her to get us some munchies and said we trusted her. She got us some calamari, artichoke dip and potato skins. AGAIN SPOT ON!! They were all delish. She finished us off with a carrot cake to share ( it's HUGE) and some coffee. After chitchatting and winding down for abt 2 HOURS, we were all refreshed and left to walk some more. Great food and awesome service. Thanks for awesome experience to citizens and Lotus! I will definitely be back :)

I was in Vegas for a short vacation and came across Citizens with my girlfriend, so we decided to stop in. We were greeted promptly at the hostess stand and were offered the choice of inside or patio seating. We love people watching, so we took a seat on the patio. We were quickly greeted by our server, Art, who was kind enough to take our beer and mixed drink order, brought us some waters and recommended a few appetizers.  We decided on the Spinach Dip. It arrived quickly and piping hot.  There were multiple different cheeses, an abundance of fresh tasting spinach and they had enough chips where we didn't have to worry about running out of chips with a lot of dip left (a huge pet peeve of ours). We would go out of our way to order this again.

Our dinner entrees were delicious and promptly served after our appetizer was completed. Everything was hot and tasted fresh. The manager, Andrea, even stopped by and not only asked about how our meal was, but asked us about how we were enjoying our time in Vegas and gave us a couple additional ideas of things to do. That was a nice touch. Great food, great service, we will definitely go there again next time we are in town.

Truly outstanding customer service!  I mean, really impressive.

In the middle of my meal I needed something and turned around to see if our waitress was around.  I thought I spotted her way back in the kitchen and I waved.  Then I realized that wasn't my waitress.  

I turned around and got back to my meal.  But before I could take a bite, the waitress that I had waved to was at my table asking if I needed anything.  Dang, she wasn't even my waitress but she dropped what she was doing and hustled over to see what she could do for me.  

That's just one example.  I could cite more.   All the waitstaff are like that.  Efficient, accommodating and super friendly. 

This wasn't our first visit.  We've been eating here since the restaurant was called Red, White and Blue.  The name changed, but the food is still great, and the service is exemplary.

The food is a little more expensive here than the coffee shop.  Breakfasts are $17-$20.  I always get the Eggs Benedict, which is always prepared perfectly.  The Hollandaise has a subtle herb flavor that sets it apart from the typical version.  The breakfast potatoes are simple, yet delicious.  If you order anything with breakfast potatoes be sure to get a side of their sausage gravy.  It's outstanding and absolutely loaded with sausage.

My wife typically gets some sort of fresh fruit bowl.   I can verify the berries were fresh and delicious.  My nephew had the french toast, which comes topped with those same fresh berries, and it looked really good.  

They serve Lavazza for their house coffee here.  They use it for their espresso beverages, too.  Good stuff!

Mikey C says: Liberte, Egalite, Fraternite yo!

A great find in the Mandalay hotel. Had the chicken club and it was a great hearty sandwich. Our waiter was Robert and was very professional and attentive. The Manager Marjorie came over to introduce herself to make sure everything was fine. It was a nice touch.

Citizens is the best 24 hour restaurant in Las Vegas. It is the perfect place to grab a bite at any time of the day. Try the French onion soup or if your really hungry, get the prime rib. Also If your in a hurry you can always order from the deli counter.

Yelpers have rated Citizens at 3 out of 5 stars.  When that's the aggregate rating out of hundreds of reviews, for me personally I begin to think the establishment might be shitty.   Especially when there is a sprinkling of reviews that are at 1 star with all kinds of jacked up things being written.  "3" may be "A-OK" according to Yelp, to me it means the place is questionable.  

So if you don't want to fuck around with Citizens and risk disappointment, here's my advice:  Go to the the takeout counter and order either the Reuben or else the turkey avocado sandwich.  Simple as that.    

These sandwiches are so good.   The ingredients, the breads, the thinly-sliced soft and moist deli meat... Adds up to an amazing sandwich that I go out of my way for.   Trust me.   

Yes, these sandwiches are expensive.   Around $15 for one sandwich to give you some idea.    But damn worth it, and I keep going back for it.  For the times I drive in to Vegas from So Cal, I typically order extra sandwiches to go as a snack later on.   

But if the price still seems completely outrageous to you, I won't fault you.  Just do it if you're comfortable.   However, to put it in perspective, what did cost you to get a bottle of Grey Goose last night at Hakkasan?   Or even one cocktail at Light... How much did that cost?  How much money did you put out in the casino?   What did you spend on the stripper with your buddies?

Exactly.      So shut the hell up and get one of the best sandwiches you'll ever eat!!!

We came here as the only late night option that was available in the hotel, and we were very happy. The food was good, and we had wonderful service. Our waiter Steven was very attentive and offered honest suggestions about the menu and drinks.  I had the kale and brown rice salad and added salmon and my boyfriend had the rueben. My drink was peach iced tea with whiskey and it was excellent. 

One note we went into the restaurant and not just the counter.

Just flew in from Birmingham, and boy are my arms tired.

I was so hungry it felt like my stomach was eating away at my spine. So I went straight to Citizens before check-in at the hotel. I sat at the bar and enjoyed the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and a cold Bud Light. The sandwich was big, and it hit the spot. The Buffalo sauce was tangy and it was neutralized nicely by the ranch dressing. The chicken breast was thin and fried just right. The side of fries was on point. They were hot and crispy.

Ate here with some friends whilst waiting for a show at the House of Blues; since parking in the Mandalay Bay either involves coming a little early and grabbing a spot next to the escalators in the parking garage or coming on time, driving around for thirty minutes as you scour every level of the monolithic parking structure trying to find a place you can only barely fit your compact car into because the rented Hummers on either side are straddling the lines, we opted to come early and have a bite while we waited.
The service was fairly good, though my iced tea ran out a few times during the meal. It wasn't hugely busy, but our waiter did have several tables concurrently and I can forgive that oversight. He was still friendly and courteous. It's service that sets most any restaurant on the Strip apart, since the food is usually pretty decent but often over-priced.
The food was quite good; I had the double burger that's on two grilled cheese sandwiches, which is to say that my fiance wondered whether we'd make it to the show or not when the ambulance was called. I survived by some miracle, and came out of it with a smile on my face and half the burger in a to-go box so that I could finish killing myself later after NASA got back to me with the calorie count calculation for the thing.
Overall, I'd probably come back here; it was a pretty friendly little place and you got a decent amount of food for the money. Yes, the prices are higher than an off-strip restaurant, but the portions are still good.
Going to citizens for my birthday dinner, not sure if I'm going to get the Frisco or the spaghetti both are delish! GreAt spot to meet and eat.
This place rocks! Awesome staff and totally worth a 10 minute wait to get food at 1:30 in the morning!
RECOMMEND toffee crunch blondie and mocha latte to go!  Sit at Kumi in the morning before it's open in their great lounge area and enjoy!

Staying at Mandalay Bay, we ate breakfast here several times, and the breakfast was always solid. The lattes were good, regular coffee was also tasty, and you get a lot of food for the price. 

The downside was the service - we never really had a good server the whole time we were there. I'm not sure why the middle-of-the-road restaurants in Vegas seem to have such lack-luster staff - you'd think that people would be lining up for those jobs, but we seem to only get good servers in the super-high-end places. 

Anyway, Citizens is worth the money for breakfast - and if you can share a plate, even better.

This place was awesome! 

We happened upon this place while we were knocking out our bucket list item of walking the entire strip. Our waiter Joey was friendly & attentive. The General Manager... I think his name was Nick (?) seated us, and was also extremely personable. 

Will definitely be back when friends and family come into town to visit. 

Try: Mac n' Cheese & Carrot Cake!

Stopped in on a Sunday at 11pm 

Had the spinach artichoke, cheese quesadilla and chili fries.

Nice dime place and reasonable pricing
Thumbs up the food is Delicious I'm here for breakfast I had the Biscuits and Gravy with a side of sasauge and bacon.. Yummy lol

Came here to get brunch with my friends and we had a great time. We had Stephanie helping us out. She was very sweet.  I got the Caesar salad and my friend got the lobster roll.  My salad was okay but the lobster roll was delicious. I took a picture of it.  Definitely will come back for the lobster roll.  I also had coffee which was standard.  This place is nicely decorated and there's seating outside-ish.  It wasn't really outside since you are still inside Mandaly Bay.  When we were leaving, my friend left his credit card and Stephanie ran after us to give it back to him.  4 stars for Stephanie for sure.

We ordered the brick chicken and the steak frites.  The steak was ordered medium and came out very tough and dry, more well done than medium.  The chicken was also very dry and not good.  The food was very poor.  The service was excellent and to be fair, we didn't comment on the food.  We were in a rush and didn't have time to ask for correction.  Overall though, I'd expect food not to be so over done the first time.

I usually eat at other restaurants when I am in town for a convention, but felt like trying something different.  Although the menu was not an exact match to what was on the inter-web (they have submitted the changes and the hotel is following up) what I ate (open faced prime rib sandwich and mashed potatoes) was actually better than what I originally thought that I would get.  The high light of the meal was actually the bar tender RAQUEL,   She was friendly, professional and very polite.  She was quick and efficient with out ever hovering.  She took my order, confirmed it, placed it and checked on it once it quickly arrived.  My ice tea was never empty and always had plenty of ice and lemon.  She made sure that I needed nothing further and got me on my way once I was ready.  I also noticed that every other person at the bar was taken care of in a similar manner.  I was so impressed with her level of service, that I would eat at her bar again just because of her and made sure to express this sentiment to her manager.  Thank you very much.

This place is awesome. I have been here a few times with a group and the food is always wonderful. I have had the doughnut breakfast sandwich twice now and it's so amazing. You must try it!! Tuna sandwich, quesadilla, and BLT was great as well!

You know your in the Mandlay Bay and you want to get something that is not going to totally screw up your expense account.  Overall the standard fare is good and stick to the basics of a bar and grill type of food and you're good for a good meal.  Yes you're still in the hotel so it is going to cost you, I had a nice big meal-size salad and it was enough for a good lunch.

I sat at the bar and a very friendly bar tender kept my ice tea filled up the whole time.

I would have given this place 3 stars but the service was horrible. Anthony, "our server" took our order than never returned to the table to check in on us or refill our drinks. Food was decent and prices were standard for Vegas.

Citizens Kitchen and Bar would have gotten just 2 stars from me, but a couple of items are able to bump it up to 3 stars.  First of all, if you opt to dine in for dinner, at least the couple of times that I've gone (Sunday after 10pm), it gets really LOUD because of the band that plays just across the way.  Sometimes you just want to wind down with some good conversation, but you can't really do that with the extremely loud music playing.  If you have a headache, forget about coming here!  When we went back recently, we opted to just take our food to go.  Anyway, I like a cozy ambiance or a place with a trendy/sexy vibe; Citizens has neither.  So no problem not dining in that time.

On both of my visits, service was meh.  The hostess the time we dined in started to seat us out on their patio area closest to the live band. When we requested a quieter table inside, she sat us at a table right next to the patio making little difference in the noise level :/  There's definitely no service with a smile at Citizens, at least from my experience.

As for the food, I definitely wasn't impressed on my first visit.  I wasn't too hungry, so I opted for their french onion soup and got to taste my dining companion's penne prosciutto.  Again, meh.  Even though we weren't impressed on that visit, we went back to Citizens on a recent trip to Vegas since we were staying at the Four Seasons next door and our options were limited for late night dining.  We ordered at their to-go counter, and I chose their cheese quesadilla this time and their salted caramel parfait.  Their quesadilla I didn't care for but I did like the parfait.  I ended up coming back a few days later to pick up a blondie.  It had some toffee in it and was tasty overall and it did not disappoint!  (I forgot to take pics of the food I picked up to go.)

Overall, I would recommend Citizens for their treats at the to-go counter, or if it's late and you're not in the mood for fast food and there are no other options nearby.  Otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way to have a meal here.

I enjoyed the steak but was overwhelmed by the steak fries they served with my steak. 
Do they need to give me so much fries?

Worst service I've ever had. Inside was completely empty but they wouldn't let me sit inside to watch the games when I ordered food because it's for sit down guests only. Tried asking for a water from the waiter to be redirected 3 times until the manager finally came around. This place sucks.

Maybe being in l Las Vegas a few days spoils you, had an afternoon snack , it was just ok, attentive service, bland fish tacos, horrible Quessadilla!! 

Overall  not a Fan.

This place is charming and has delicious food. 

Love the decor and theme of this restaurant. The customer service was on point and very friendly. 

I had the bacon burger with a side of mac n' cheese. Wow out of this world, the bacon is so delicious you will want more and more. 

I will definitely be coming back to try other menu items that caught my eye. 

Thank you for the great experience and delicious food!
Very casual place very unassuming. The portions are huge but everything is made with lots of flavor and taste. Excellent causal dinning if in vegas. Moderate prices but it's all worth it
We really enjoyed breakfast here. The coffee was good (smooth), hashbrowns were nice and crunchy, corn beef hash was really nice, my omelette was delicious! Will be back tomorrow.

I'll just share my experience. Although service was good, the food was not worth the price. Appetizer (chili fries), 1 salad (Caesar), 1 entree (penne no chicken), soda and tea was $92!!!  I can't give this more than 1 star because I expect the whole package. Especially for $92!!!

I'm very conflicted on this place - my wife and I have been there for breakfast a few times while in Vegas. 

The food itself is decent.  My wife usually goes for the eggs benedict and she enjoys it - she gives them a 4/5 (and she eats them just about everywhere).  I've had a number of different breakfast dishes and find them to be good, but not any better than anywhere else.  

I find the service to be very inconsistent however.  Like others have written when they are busy service can be really slow (I know it's difficult when it is busy - but this is Vegas and you know weekends will be extremely busy - you should plan around that).  So if it looks busy and you're in a rush you might want to avoid this place. 

The weird part is that even when they're not busy service is hit and miss.  Most recently they couldn't get our order straight.  My wife was offered fruit or hash browns with her meal - she ended up being given both (although it looked like a half order of each).  I asked for bacon with mine and ended up with ham.  They fixed it all and no problem but she wrote our order down and it wasn't busy... How do you mess that up?

Excellent!  Love this place, great service as well as food.  I've been here 4 times and love their French dip-get it!  Raquel is an amazing bartender!  You have to sit at her bar, immaculate!  Clean organized and ready to serve you with a smile.  I've tended bar for 10 years myself and she hits the nail right on the head.  Can't wait to go back!!!

We were seated on the "outside" patio. 

Our waitress was friendly but rarely visited our table to check in on us. We didn't get any water or coffee refills, even after asking. 

The food was mediocre and overpriced for the quality. 

A cute and convenient spot but not worth it.

This place is amazing!!! The bartender, Lizzy, is my fav! She had some wonderful menu & drink recommendations. I had the turkey avocado sandwich and the raging bull cocktail...both to die for. 

Also, to my girls and gays--there is a ton of gorgeous eye candy...you won't be disappointed!!!

This is my go to place to eat when at Mandalay Bay.  Unique style, always great service and awesome food 24 hours a day!  Honestly, this place is as good as any of the "high end" restaurants at Mandalay.  The have great ribs, sandwiches, a lobster roll that is amazing.  I give it 4 stars because it is the only place that gets 4 stars at Mandalay and because they do every meal, and do it better than any restaurant on the property.

So we are at a concert inside the Mandalay beach. During intermission my husband went out to get Starbucks; unfortunately they were closed. He came back to our spot and handed me this drink in a cup; I was like this is not Starbucks. He said he did not have any choice but to order from citizens because its the only place open. His bill was like $18 for two medium drink. I took a sip and phew, it tasted like watered down peanut butter and the bitter after taste of not so ripe banana. It made my tummy rumble inside and we ended up not finishing the concert because I don't want to have any accident in there. I don't even know if its a smoothie or a juice because its not thick or icy, it's watery and tasted so bad. Not a very good first impression. Makes me not want to try to eat here because they can't even get their drinks right.

If you go here expect to be overcharged and disappointed. I asked is they had actual corned beef hash or the stuff from a can. The server said they do their own. So I ordered that. The only thing they do is open their own can and fry it up. I had more oil in my dish than a super tanker. I pointed this out to the server who asked if I wanted him to take it back and get something else instead. I sent it back as inedible and I was not happy that they tried passing of the $2 canned stuff as their own. I got the eggs benedict which was mediocre but not terrible. I was then billed for both items when I asked about this they were not willing to correct it and said that they had to make both dishes it is not their fault I am not happy with their food.

If you want actual corned beef go to Ri Ra in the same casino. If you want good food and service try any place but this one.
Been here a couple of times. Strip-pricey, but great food and portions. Burgers/wings/nachos are all very good. Large bloody Mary's look awesome, but didn't have one.

This place would be so much better if they could just fix their ridiculously slow service.

I went to the take out counter twice during my most recent Vegas stay. Both times the food took forever for what was a simple order.

The second visit was ridiculous. There was one person ahead of me who got her parfait and was on her way. We order a parfait, donut, hot tea, and fresh juice. Everything except for the juice was grabbed from the counter. The juice took over 15 minutes. Everything was already pre-cut in a cup, all the person had to do was add orange juice and blend.

They were clearly understaffed, and for the prices they charge there is no excuse.

Also, when I was paying the second day the girl working the register asked if I needed a receipt. When I said yes, she handed me the itemized receipt. I asked her where the credit card receipt was and she said she threw it away. I told her I needed it because this was a work expense. She then proceeded to dig through the garbage until she produced my crumpled receipt. That is not okay, if someone says they want a receipt they should be given both receipts, or at the bare minimum the credit card receipt.

This place would be good if they could just get their ish together!
Had a great breakfast there (order the pancakes). However, service is to be desired.  Had to request an item I ordered multiple times to get it. Would eat there again though.

The absolute worse breakfast I've ever been served. Greasy hash browns, gross pancakes that tasted like they forgot to mix the bisquick batter and the most bitter cup of coffee I've ever had. All for the low price of $25, what a joke. Also I could not get the waitresses attention and she didn't come back to my table for 20 minutes. When I told her I almost did a spit take when I tasted the coffee. She took the cup and came back 10 minutes later with the same bitter brew. If you want bad food and bad service this is the place for you. I can't believe food this awful would be allowed in Mandalay Bay. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!

Service was great. 
Friendly and pretty attentive considering we are sitting outside in the corner.
Food and drink was decent.

Got a snack to go here. The smoothie was just ok and WAY overpriced, even for Vegas. They forgot my pretzel and banana, I didn't get them until I asked 15 minutes later. Barely got an apology. Not a big fan.

The wait was a bit long but it was after a music event so it is to be expected. The staff were super nice and the food was surprisingly delicious for such a late night eat! We got the Mac and cheese which was excellent, the French onion soup w 3 cheeses which is pretty big portions and the chicken quesadilla. All were great! Highly recommend this place! Outside seating is perfect for people watching! :)

I was very pleased with my meal after giving this restaurant a shot. It's conveniently across from The Light Nightclub which is the whole reason why we even ate there in the first place.

For starters, the service is grand! I had a great time cracking jokes with our waiter as well as for some of the other staff. They're extremely helpful and always try to guide you in the right direction. The food was averagely priced and not bad at all. The wait time wasn't that bad either but that was probably because we were there an hr before closing time.

I enjoyed the salad I chose as well as the drinks they stirred up for me. The rest of my group really enjoyed their burgers here too. I think knowing that this restaurant exists will better my future stays at the Mandalay Bay.  I'm looking forward to see what other tasty meals I'll have here.
Awesome place when you don't want to eat a huge expensive buffet! Homemade food with a cool vibe. Love this place and glad it's near the Mandalay Bay casino!

Service was awful, no hostess at the door. We sat ourselves and a rude server told us we needed to be seated, and to wait for this imaginary hostess to appear. We ordered queso, and Kobe fries. Food was over priced, but okay not great.  They didn't ask how anything was! Our server was Robert, I had a beer served in a dirty glass, there was no apology. Then Robert lost our debt card upon trying to pay... We won't be going back. And good luck to anyone who goes there.

Food here was ok. Kinda of on the expensive side even for vegas. Service is where there was lacking. Never received  drink  refills and once we asked for a check it took 45 minutes to get it when there was barely anyone in the resturant. Their walk up  coffee  area was good though and had great cappuccinos.

Fast, friendly service but mediocre breakfast items. I expected the banana nut pancakes to have the latter IN the pancake but no: they were a stack of 3 plain pancakes with a sliced banana and some nuts sprinkles on top. That said, they were fine.  ($14) So was the granola & fruit parfait. ($10) The corned beef hash ($16) was nothing to write home about. And forgo the $14 basket of 4 'fresh' bakery items.  The Krispy Kreme doughnut was scrumptious but the other items (croissant, cheese Danish and apple tart) tasted stale.

Just want to say I had a great experience at this place. Sat at bar and was very busy. Got my drink and food fast. Bartender Raquel was super friendly and very professional. I would recommend this place to my friends and family and will definitely be back.

Came here because it was one of the few restaurants open late at night. Food was excellent,  a little pricey, but it's Vegas, so no big deal. Service was okay. There were 4 waiters, 3 food runners, a bartender,  hostess and manager. We had to wait a bit for our check and they gave me a dirty spoon with food stuck on it yet, but other than that it was good. Nice atmosphere and drunk people are always entertaining.

Very good calamari. The breading and seasoning on it made it awesome. I also had the Mac and cheese with ham. It was a nice blend of cheese but not too heavy on the cheese. I also like that it wasn't oily. Sometimes other places have a pool of oil from the cheese at the bottom of the bowl. Not here. Perfectly cooked. Mmmmm. They have tater tots!

Had dinner here tonight before the Ellie Goulding concert. Ordered the nachos with chicken which were listed as $16 plus $6 for chicken. 

Some how they changed the price to $22 plus $6 for the chicken so I paid $30 for nachos....I understand this is a hotel but $30 for a plate of regular nachos is just ridiculous. 

Luckily we still made it to the concert on time and I could have stayed and complained about the $6 up charge but I just wanted to get to the concert on time. 

So overall I won't be back unless someone talks me into returning. Waste of $30 plus $4 for a soda....
Great breakfast!  The banana pancakes were delicious and the coffee cups are cappuchino sized.  I would definitely return.
the turkey avocado is unreal!!!!! i could eat it everyday... Cranberry walnut bread, lemon aioli(wow), sprouts, tomato, lettuce... Delist I love Mandalay bay!

I dined here three times during my recent stay at Mandalay Bay, twice for breakfast and once for dinner. Breakfast is good, not great. Dinner is much better. Service is okay. Overall a three star experience. Highlights... Breakfast service is very quick and there's a good variety on the menu. The omelette I had was very good. The breakfast potatoes were very bland. The dinner menu accommodates almost anyone - vegetarians, pescetarians, and carnivores alike. I had a fabulous shrimp and pasta dinner while my friend had the prime rib. The portions here are huge and you get a good value for your dollar.

Great flavors, professional and poised service, and yummy dessert. 
I had the BBQ Chicken Salad and it was delicious and a generous portion! It didn't have BBQ or isn't your typical BBQ but the flavors all matched and the toppings gave it variety and texture. 
The waiter was super nice and never rushed us. It was reasonably priced for being on the strip. 
We had the cheesecake and the bread pudding and we all loved the cheesecake. It was huge! 
I would come here again.
Nice lunch here.  Soup and salad were good but way overpriced at $19, had a very good sandwich with chicken, bacon, avocado though.
The bartender Raquel was very personable and was so knowledgeable with the menu. I was here for a convention and she definitely made my experience memorable. I will be back.

This place was conveniently located at Mandalay bay . We ordered the Kobe beef fries which were fine, and the grilled Ruben sandwich: wasn't too impressed . Pretty standard . Nothing bad. But I think I expect a little more out food In Las Vegas ....

I've been to Vegas a plethora of times in my life, and a hand full since turning 21, my goal was to learn how to do Vegas right by 25 and I think I've succeeded. One of the keys is finding solid meals, not meals where you want to stuff yourself but something just right to fill your stomach before an eventful night. Citizens got the job done for me on this visit. Their burgers specifically. 

The meat is quality meat, ordered it medium rare, medium and medium well, all 3 times cooked to my exact demands and each and every time it was mouth watering. 4.5/5

Ingredients were fresh each and every time as well, the one time I ordered the bacon burger, it came through too. No staleness in any part of my burger. 

Bun- Bun was good, maybe a 4/5 which is good for my standards. 

Fries- For being just normal fries they left a great impression on me. Crispy and tasteful, mm mm delicioso.

Customer service was very mediocre though. That's all there is to say about that here.

If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay or any hotel within the block and you're looking for a quick bite, rely on Citizens to get the job done, they are open 24/7 which is reliability at its finest.

Vegas, in many, many ways, has it all wrong. Their motto should not be that it's some sort of city-wide ziplock sealing so tightly that not even vapors can escape, the metaphorically alluded-to "municipality as black hole". No. Their motto should be one more truthful and perhaps more pithy. That new motto of which I speak would go something like this: Nothing exceeds like excess.

And perhaps no place encapsulates that better than this place. Want to know what's in the dessert case? Well you can just walk (or waddle) yourself over there and go look. The dessert menu has five things on it (order any of these and they're huge). The dessert case has probably 5X that, but damn if they will tell you what that is. The menu itself has a number of things on it. Order any of them but appetizers and they come on a cookie sheet. This not only does wonders for the carefully crafted ambiance, but adds a flair of mystery to things. For instance, I can't begin to imagine the food waste this place must go through, but I'm betting they toss a lot more than anyone ever eats. 

Actually, given the flavor, this is almost a guarantee. I can almost hear you smacking your lips right now? You mean to say we can get a bunch of substandard - and here, this word is best - "grub", served by some very smarmy prick who looks vaguely like Fred Arminsen, but is far from funny or even amusing (wait, maybe it is Fred Arminsen!), yet has a full-tilt condescending attitude that all but insists we should be grateful he can be deigned to bother with us mere mortals. Maybe that's it. Maybe the wait staff in this elegantly laid out pristine and serene little oasis from the flood of body odor and stale cigarette smoke isn't here for us, but rather that we're here for them. Now I know why I flew here. I wonder if it would be an insult if I tipped 150%...I'm in but I have to get back out somehow.

Then again, it's a great deal, if you get a lot, right? It may be expensive, but at least it's mediocre! Expensive is the nature of the biz in Vegas and comes with the territory and so, apparently, does throwing any old thing in front of people.  This place clearly doesn't care about patrons coming in and out and is one of the more jaded places I've seen. Maybe they ought to just throw all in and go for "Citizen" by way of the old Soviet Union. I'm thinking a food line with metal bowls and plates. The only thing served will be potato soup with cabbage and garlic, along with a small roll that may or may not be moldy. Drink choices are cheap vodka or brackish water. If nothing else, it would at least accurately mirror the contempt for the customers this place clearly seems to have.

Also, like everything else in Vegas, this place is loud.

Food is Ok. Nice selection of healthier fare. However, the staff needs basic training in customer service. We were given the wrong food item and when it was brought to the attention of the staff, the response was "I know, I know. I'll get the right one."

It took 10 minutes to get a juice with ingredients listed as follows: kale, blueberries, grapes, apple and beets. Unfortunately, the main ingredient was apple juice with honey running a close second. Yuck.

The last straw was when after waiting for 10 minutes at a nearby table (for the juice), we were told we had to move because the table was for non-"to-go" guests. The place was empty and we would have stayed exactly 5 minutes since we were running so late already. Horrible experience.

Want to let you all know what an outstanding sever we had Bailey while we were attending a convention for 8 days - not only courteous, professional, attentive but truly a wonderful worker as she took care of us like she knew us for years!! Thank you Bailey!

This restaurant says it's opened 24x7. We went there after reading good reviews. They would not seat us. Or anyone coming up to each lunch. I asked if they were "closed". She said they were transitioning from brunch to lunch and we'd have to wait about 1 hour. This place advertises 24x7, but it's not 24x7 hours in a row I guess. We Ate somewhere else instead.
Not bad for desperate diners who have been on the road for 10 hours trying to get to Vegas and need something to eat at 2 am.

I stayed at THEhotel with my friends and we ate here because it was the least expensive compared to the other places nearby. I will say that they have tasty sandwiches, salads and burgers. Great for the price! Service was good too, so no complaints here with this place. The decor was pretty cool as well.

Saw a long line at this place and assumed that it would be good. However, we were tricked since those people in line are business people here for conference and they were just grabbing quick lunch.

It's Vegas price, not Vegas quality. I got Chicken Cesar salad, the meat was very plain, and they forgot to give me dressing.

There is a Starbucks next to the corner - even Starbucks would have been a much better choice.

We had breakfast here on Halloween morning. I had the traditional Eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes. BEST EGGS BENEDICT I ever had....Seriously. Best coffee too. They serve Lavazzo Coffee which is amazing and very smooth in taste. Can't wait to go back. Oh and was waitress was super sweet.

Only place to eat after 2am at Mandalay or Luxor except McDonald's. The food is decent. Great Chicken Soup for 2am. Appetizers were fairly good. The chili is too spicy with the cheese fries. Service is very slow so don't be in a hurry.

Got to eat here with my coworkers after we finished walking about MAGIC.

We got seated in about 15mins. Thought that was quite fast. We all ordered appetizers since we werent super hungry. We ordered the waffle fries that came with gravy and bacon bits...yea If you plan to order it, dont... Why? Wholly cow, it is heavy on the sodium. So the ones that got soaked in the gravy is not edible :(. The other items we ordered were pretty generic, chicken fingers (basically just fried chicken strips) and a cup or veggies (you know the ones you get in the frozen aisle in the market?)

If we were crying over the appetizers already, imagine the main course!!

While at CES 2015 stopped by to grab a quick lunch and ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and coleslaw. I will say one thing the amount of food you get for the price is decent as my sandwich was HUGE. The chicken was fried well and the buffalo sauce was pretty good. The Blue Cheese was a little strong personal preference wise (I like bleu cheese but not the amount I had on my sandwich). Even given the portion, taste and ambiance of the restaurant the one thing that stood out for me was the price sadly. Even with the amount of food you get, the taste really didn't wow me at all and I left thinking "I paid quite a bit..." Probably won't come back as this place wasn't that memorable for me.
Excellent service and food! If you're  in Vegas and looking for a great meal that is also a good value (very rare in Vegas), you will find that at Citizens.

On the tab
Shrimp Cocktail
French Onion Soup
Kobe Chilli
Chicken Noodle
Prime Rib
A bunch of Juices

PRO:
Lots of tables
Easy to get a table on a Friday night during MLK weekend
Get the KOBE Chilli

CONS:
The juices.. it was a frothy juice so we couldn't call it a juice or a smoothie. For the price, pass on it.

Overall, typical American food and nothing noteworthy.

Great experience at Citizens today, with I believe the best Bloody Mary I've ever had!

It was bodacious in volume and adorned with many accoutrements including a split crab leg, shrimp, cherry pepper, pearl onion, olive, celery, and a big honkin piece of beef jerky.  Great, great, great.

The pico served with the chips was very fresh and bright, and the kids had the disco fries.  I tried one and they were super 'potatoy' and tasty.

Nice work.
Exceptionally slow service even when half the tables were empty.  28 minutes and counting to get a chicken sandwich.

Always visiting this spot when in Vegas.  Great breakfast, great bloody mary and the best bartender in town, Raquel!  She is the reason why this place is the best way to start the day.  Sit at the bar and Raquel will give you the best recommendations.  Thanks Raquel!
Horrible place, I was waiting in line for 5 minutes and place was empty.  That is unacceptable service and manager should really evaluate their process.  Four people on staff at the time.

We got there right before lunch so we avoided a wait time but on our way out the line looked quite long. Not bad for the price! The food itself was nothing remarkable. The drinks were great! 
I must say, I was a big fan of the decor as well.

Best place to be after an all night drink fest!  My boyfriend & I shared the patty melt. It was by far the best patty melt I have EVER tasted (and I wasn't drunk)!! I'm still thinking about it 2 days later.  
As far as service goes, we didn't have a problem whatsoever.  The hostess and waiter were on it during our late night visit.    
In closing, I say GET THE PATTY MELT!
No bad for breakfast. But like most restaurants at these so called resorts, the prices were marked up at least 50-60% from normal. Food and service were good. Prices keep me from giving 4 stars

Citizens is another solid spot by the Light Group. It's an upscale diner serving comfort food 24 hours a day in Mandalay Bay. Brunch might be the best time to go if you want to pig out on plenty of sweet and savory offerings like I did. The massive stack of red velvet pancakes may be one of the better versions in town. Just bring family or friends to make a dent in it. The creme brulee French toast is another exceptional rendition on a classic with bread dense enough to soak up and retain plenty of custard and a well crusted exterior that provides plenty of crunch. 

For savory options the kobe chili cheese fries were good -- particularly the light, crispy waffle fries that held up well under the meaty chili. They don't skimp with portion sizes on that dish or the big meatball parm, which is a single baseball sized hunk of beef and pork topped with a dollop of ricotta and sitting in a pool of sauce. A less than stellar dish is their ultimate tots -- standard tater tots covered in cheese and gravy. The chicken and waffles also proved to be decent, but far less memorable than the other dishes we tried.

Ending the meal was an excellent house-made carrot cake. It's moist and dense spice cake foundation with subtle hints of carrot were complimented by plenty of sweetness from a smooth and creamy cream cheese icing. 

It's clear that the Light Group knows who their target audience is and how to satisfy them. With Citizens, they deliver comfort food fit for a casual meal any time of day

MB's 24 hour cafe is perfectly positioned across from the nightclub. ha!  We left the club early and beat the crowd. Good thing too! Not many people were seated, therefore our service was excellent. They have the usual selection you would find at any 24 hour Vegas hotel cafe including a fully stocked bar. I ordered a breakfast croissant, nothing special stood out. It was tasty, a little on the oily side, but satisfying nonetheless. Hubs ordered a loco moco. I wasn't a big fan of the long grain rice they use or the gravy. Our server was friendly and prompt. She came by to check in on us and take refills in a timely manner. Decent place to grab a late night bite and clean.

I wish I had lower than a star for this restaurant. First, Price posted on a filet mignon was 37 while when seated, the menu showed it 39. The waiters were fine but the food was not a filet mignon but a steak. I ordered medium to well, which I always order like that but it came so dry. I wasted my money for sure. Juice 5 dollars a glass, refill is the same cost. There's apparently no restaurant manager ensuring that everyone is attended. You are on the mercy of waiters' attention.
The food was horrible! It was so bland I asked for hot sauce and it still didn't help the flavor. Avoid this place if possible!

I'll just share my experience. Although service was good, the food was not worth the price. Appetizer (chili fries), 1 salad (Caesar), 1 entree (penne no chicken), soda and tea was $92!!!  Dakota was attentive and was on his 7th day of training.  I can't give this more than 1 star because I expect the whole package. Especially for $92!!!

Citizens is the only 24 hour joint in MB. So while they may not offer the best service and are overpriced, sometimes you have to bite the bullet.

I visited here twice during my stay, both times only using the counter service. The first time was late night for dessert. It took about 20 minutes for them to box up 2 pieces of cake and deliver them from the kitchen. That seems a little excessive to me. Good thing they quickly made me a tasty decaf mocha to sip on while waiting.

The second time for breakfast. It is nice to have healthy options, so I indulged in a fresh made juice and a breakfast sandwich. Juice was good (I would hope so for $9!) and the sandwich was just ok as it was warmed in the microwave. We waited again about 20 minutes for the juice and the sandwich.

On a previous stay, we have had sit down service. The food was pretty good, nothing stellar. 

I will be back because it is the only place to grab and go with decent food any time of the day you are ready to nosh without wanting to leave the hotel.

Went here last night for dinner and it took almost 45 minutes for us to get our food. There were several tables that came in after us and got their food before we got ours. Maybe it was just a fluke but, not apology or explanation as to why it took so long to get our food. The food was good but, overpriced. The service makes the experience and I will not go back.

Arrived mid-afternoon and not willing to brave the heat of the Strip quite yet. A lot of the restaurants were closed, so we went with this one being open 24 hours. Pricey, but it's Vegas (thus the 4 stars).  Was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was. Sandwiches & fries done perfectly~ hot, crispy, good flavor. Had the Frisco Melt, a Reuben, Open faced roast beef with mashed potatoes. Gravy on the potatoes was a tad too salty, but the bun was garlicky delish, meats were tender & yummy. Went a couple times during our stay, and probably because of the off-hour it wasn't busy, and service was fine and attentive. Not impressed with the spinach dip & (abundance of) chips. I'd stick to the sandwiches.

Ate 2 meals and a late night dessert here during our stay at Mandalay Bay

The service is extremely lacking - inattentive , slow and overall a negative . We  will not be back

Dinner was great. I had the Cobb Salad, wife had the BBQ Chicken Salad. Next morning, breakfast was less thrilling. I had the Ultimate Breakfast, the potatoes looked warmed for too long...like they were from the day prior. I'd eat there again, but iHop does a better, cheaper big breakfast...NOT trying to slam Citizen, but I was hoping for a little more.

7/9: Located inside of Mandalay Bay casino. I'd rate the food a 3; good, but a bit pricey if paying without comps. The awesome service made up for it! 

I had the Baconator Beef Burger and some of the Turkey Burger. 

My beautiful waitress Miranda was top notch, even though the place was a bit busy for a Tuesday evening. Refills kept coming. Management had an issue with my poker room comp (I guess because Citizens is a new addition to the places that allow usage of comps). She kept checking up on the issue. While they couldn't really get it resolved, she kindly offered to take a discount off for the time being, and said that they would entirely fix the issue before closing time. A class act. THIS is customer service at its finest. Thank you Miranda! Just for the amazing service, I would definitely come back!

PRO: open 24/7, cool ambiance

CON: food isn't great, very slow service

if you're looking for a quick late night bite be prepared to sit and wait around for your food. we waited for over an hour and it was pretty tasteless.
Excellent mahi mahi tacos.  Maybe the best that I've had anywhere.  All the food looked really good.  Pricey, but in line with casino/resort pricing.  Good, friendly service.

We spent New Years Eve/20th anniversary at Mandalay this year. We ate 4 out of 6 meals here!! Wonderful food and service, whether it was 10:00 am or 3:00 am we totally enjoyed every bite!

We are both dying for the Crab Benedict and BEST prime rib in Vegas! Hats off to the whole team!

Sat at the bar and truly enjoyed my experience. Bartender is very personable which pays dividends. Good eats and drinks. Killer music soundtrack playing as well. A place I may come back to tomorrow as I am here on a conference.

KEEP YOUR RECEIPT!  I left my receipt and the bartender added a nice $10 bonus tip for herself.  My credit card was charged $10 more than the total I wrote in (with a 20% tip I might add).  Shady stuff...

I have been coming to Vegas for years, particularly for an annual convention at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center. This means that pickup lunch to carry with me is pretty important and having something that doesn't taste extremely processed or like it's been sitting in the glass showcase for days is also important. Here's where Citizens comes in. 

For breakfast, they are ok. The early morning staff doesn't seem to be very helpful, perhaps that's because the coffee is pretty weak. There is a decent amount of confusion when it comes to seating and they are pretty unfriendly. Service was pretty slow - so do I recommend coming here to sit down? Not really. 

BUT!!!! The sandwiches and salads are SO GOOD! I highly recommend the quinoa or the kale salad - both of them top my list as does the turkey sandwich. But if I had to go with one, I would choose one of their amazing salads. 

The staff here is ok and the confusion due to long lines in the restaurant can get annoying but I say that salads are worth it, just take them to go or be prepared to sit there for a very long time. Also, cocktail of choice is the Berry Wise. 

Happy eating! Recommended.
As good as it gets as far as comfort food goes! Love the meatball grinder. Can even grab a coffee here, lattes are great! Def a must!

Went in for dinner. Greg was our waiter. My friend wanted spaghetti and a salad. He told her she didn't want salad the pasta dish was enough. REALLY! We were both drinking alcohol. Was not asked if we wanted another drink. Brought check to table before plates were removed. REACHED OVER ME to grab my wine glass without asking if I was done or wanted another glass. His service and attitude were so bad I can't even remember what the food tasted like.

Meh. Food was okay and this is a convenient location for being near the Mandalay Bay convention center; but, the eggs Benedict was severely lacking hollandaise sauce and the egg was over cooked. Hot cocoa not hot. Wouldn't mind so much if it hadn't been as pricey as it was for what I got.

Went to get a sandwich the one I wanted was already pre made. I don't eat turkey only wanted ham they said make your own. So I did and instead of paying 11-14 dollars I paid 24 because I got extra chesse abd avocado but didn't even get the extra cheese didn't expect it to be that much. I will never go there again

We had an excellent experience at Citizen, and we totally credit our server, Michael for it. 

We were passing time during the college basketball championship game and decided to go to the aquarium and grab a bite to eat. We were seated at a nice table and the kids ordered sandwiches and I had a Maryland Mary (their version of a Bloody Mary) which is made with a homemade Bloody Mary mix. The sandwiches were a full meal, very nicely done. The Bloody Mary was REALLY good: very spicy and very flavorful. Couldn't even taste the vodka, which is how I like it, but it was definitely there. Yum. 

Our server Michael was very attentive, we didn't order a large or fancy meal, but we were treated like we did. Our water glasses were always full. We felt like he genuinely cared about our dining experience. 

We will definitely be back!

The food was okay. The service was slow, definitely do not go if you are in a hurry. For the prices and the lack of speed I was expecting something a little bit better. The food did it's job though. The restaurant is cute and we had a good time.
Best spot for a latte in Mandalay bay. Great sandwiches, French fries, etc. always a friendly staff. I recommend giving this a try if you're near by!!

The food and service were very good.  I was thinking that we had a good waitress, Melanie S., when I saw her stoop down and have a conversation with a sweet looking older lady sitting alone in the corner.  I was so impressed.  She definitely takes her job seriously and cares for her diners.  Ask for Melanie to have an even more special dining experience.

Had another awesome lunch with my kids at Citizen's. Arturo Camacho was our server and he was fantastic! Service was great and he took great care of us. He made sure we had a great experience! Thank You!

Not sure about the bad reviews but we really enjoyed the place. Open 24 hours and serving comfort foods. We had the Mahi fish tacos which was very nice portion of 3 tacos. The veg had a nice Kale salad with goat cheese and a wonderful dressing. The food at the Mandalay bay was outstanding overall and made staying there a real plus. They also have a nice grab and go area in the lobby of the restaurant that had a nice selection.

Had dinner here on my last visit to Vegas and it was just okay.  Honestly, I was travelling solo on business and it was the only resto in Mandalay Bay that had open tables so, I really didn't have a choice.

I ordered their French Onion Soup to start, which was pretty good.  It was definitely cheesy and baked to perfection but the broth wasn't as robust as I'd hope it would be, however, they sure didn't skimp on the onions!  Soup was $12.

For my entree, I had their Lobster Roll w/Pasta Salad.  I've had my taste of what a true Lobster Roll tastes like from a couple spots in the East Coast.  Unfortunately, this Lobster Roll had more pieces of celery than lobster; it was really disappointing, especially with a $23 price tag. The Pasta Salad also seemed like it was under cooked; the pasta that is.

Overall, there are FAR, FAR, FAR better spots to eat in Vegas, can't speak for the other restos in Mandalay Bay.  So, unless you're in a pinch like I was, I'd skip this place.

Stopped in to grab breakfast in this place since it was in the Mandalay where we were staying and it was pretty good. It sits in the back of the casino and it has a ful menu including take out sandwiches which looked delicious and breakfast items. 

We ate some eggs and toast etc, but the best was the crumbled tater tots mixed with red peppers, best I have tasted. It gets pretty crowded and you may end up waiting but it was worth it. Prices were right and service was fast and friendly! Place is decorated like a kitchen and it was pretty cool inside. Not sure what the dinner menu looks like but it might be good!
Great food affordabke for Vegas most try onion soup giantnormous.
Food was just okay and no one was very happy.  When the waiter talked to us it seemed forced/fake. I would not go back.

I went here with a group of girls, late night, and wearing everyday jeans and t-shirts. The server was very nice, but the service sucked. Not to mention that they set him up with three tables at the same time. After we ordered our food, it took them over half an hour to get our food to us. Other tables were being served before us even though they got there after us with the same amount of people in their group. Not cool. 

The food was good. The pasta salad was not so good.

Experience it for yourself, but as for me and our group, we will not be going back. I think that I would rather get their to go before going back to the actual restaurant.

We had a breakfast meeting here during a convention. It was a bit loud even at 9am but then again this is Vegas. Service was very good. I had a stuffed French toast (banana and Nutella) which was good but a bit on the sweet side. I know- what should I expect when I ordered it! 

I came back the next day just to get coffee to go. But at $4 I thought differently! It doesn't seem bad with breakfast but just a cup to go...

Terrible service, terrible food , terrible music... The food did't have any flavor, the meat was all fat, the quinoa wrap had no dressing or flavor.. The server didn'pay ANY attention to us.. What a bad experience!
Great steak and rib-eye! Watch out for the portions! They are gynormous!
Horrible over priced food - poor quality, poor service and unprofessional management! Food that makes you sick is unacceptable. Avoid this place, much better options just steps away.

So this place was just ok.  

Pros:  Really bright clean atmosphere which is welcoming. Open 24 hours which is huge. Teriyaki rice bowl was very good, but in all honestly, it's probably hard to screw up. My husband really liked his pastrami sandwich. 

Cons: server was just ok. They messed up my husbands sandwich initially by sending it with no mustard and on the wrong bread which delayed our meal because I didn't want to eat without him. 

Overall, not bad, not great. I didn't advocate to return during our trip because it was meh.

Overpriced for.mediocre food. It seems they are more concerned with creating this hipster draw than serving food that warrants the price.  



The servers try hard but there is a weak link in this chain from kitchen to table
Good food, cool place to hang out and chill after losing your ass at the tables.  I would give this place 4 Stars but the service sucks.

OK I realize this is a tourist trap in Mandalay Bay where there is limited lunch choices for a reasonable price.  However, the service here is terrible.  

Saturday afternoon -- half empty.  We came in and were seated.  15 mins to take our order.  AFTER we ordered another group of four was seated, order taken, and food arrived for them before we were served -- our order was not complicated.  Order came wrong -- asked for cole slaw and got fries.  Other party paid and were gone before we got our check.  Never saw the waiter until we asked for him.  Two simple taco plates, two cups of soup, one club sandwich and four soda = $94.00 (minus tip which I did not leave).  

Walk down the Strip a little and get something more reasonable.

We spent the weekend at Mandalay Bay and visited Citizens at least 4 times over the three days and two nights.  Naomi was our server twice out of the four visits (the only reason she wasn't for all four visits was because she wasn't working the other two times we requested her) and it was as if she was a friend feeding us at her house.  Very accommodating and friendly.  If you want AWESOME service ask for Naomi or Bailey.  Bailey was mrs "Johnny on the spot" fun, spunky and there when we needed her, just as it should be!  There was one server (who shall remain nameless to avoid any scandal or shame) that we weren't super pleased with... not awful... just came off as a bit cocky and arrogant.  However the food more than made up for it (French onion is amazing and their breakfast skillets are D-LISH).  An added bonus was that the prices & food quality compared to the other places at Mandalay couldn't compare.  You won't be disappointed if you swing by!  (PS here's a tip, be nice to your server and they'll be nice back) Signed, Utah...  ((PSS Naomi, I could go for some Citizens right now, do you deliver 650 miles away?! ;0)

Great place to fuel up before you hit the clubs !!  

Portions are huge and delicious, FISH & CHIPS BOMB. Steak was lovely and tasty. Food great

Turkey Ruben is sooooo bomb, I'm drooling just thinking about it! Service was quick and attentive and menu selection is perfect for cheese lovers like myself. Its a bit dark in there but...eh...ambiance I guess. Would definitely go back to try something else!

My best friend Megan and I ate at the bar area. Steven was our bartender and server. He catered to us based on his very accurate observations. He was an excellent server and bartender, he had amazing advice, and was really easy and fun to get along with. Because of him, my friend and I will both suggest the exceptional service and quality of food and drink that we received. It's not overally common to get such tailored service that we did, but we both really appreciate it, and highly highly recommend this place, for both hominess, quality, and experience. This is a really cool place :)
Excellent food! Our best dinner in Las Vegas. We went to see Michael Jackson One to Mandalay Bay and a security guard in the casino recommended it. After dinner we went back to thank him.
The turkey avocado sandwich is the best turkey sandwich I've ever had. The bloody Mary's are delicious as well. Beautiful dinning area and accommodations wait staff.

After a long day, I wanted something quick and delicious. I chose to try Citizens and had their Reuben (no kraut) and fries.  This was probably some of the best corned beef I've had in quite some time and it certainly hit the spot.  Good food with great service.  A hit with me for something quick and simple but yet tasty.
I have ordered take out from here several times. The food is just ok. Prices are a bit high. The carrot cake is amazing.
French dip and shrimp cocktail were awesome. George Q. Was a great waiter. Ask for him if you get a chance. Coming back for sure!

This place is amazing located inside of mandalay bay it has the best brunch in vegas on sat and sun, known as the hangover brunch . If u have a late night in vegas and want to get back on track i definitely recommend there hang over brunch

Was a little disappointed that they didn't have any beers on tap, but was glad to have the Stone Arrogant Bastard from the bottle.

Got the 18 hour prime rib, and was pleasantly surprised.  The steak was very thick, and yet tender and flavorful.

Love this place. You can always get a healthy smoothy when it's 4am instead of getting some junk at some fast food place. I always get the chunky monkey protein smoothy. It's quick and it's 24hrs. I wish there were more of these is the city.

Let's start on a positive note. It's open 24 hours. The atmosphere can sometimes be fun. But mostly it's loud. The furniture is not comfortable and it's overly crowed. The food isn't the best but if u are hungry at 4 in the morning then it will do.

After drinking numerous shots of who knows what out of a leg-shaped chalice, I ended up here with my husband hungry as hell. Surprisingly it was open. It is actually one of the few restaurants on the strip that is open 24 hours a day. Thank goodness! I was told that no outside drinks were allowed, so I had to chug the last third of my drink on the spot. #Winning

Our server was smug and took our order quickly. We ordered a Stella (I had water, boooooo), fried calamari and home mustard buffalo wings. When our food arrived, it was more than enough for two people. The wings were juicy and flavorful. The bleu cheese dressing was creamy and not tangy like some cheap substitutes. Fried calamari wasn't greasy and we ended up scarfing that down first. All in all, a good experience. So why not 5 stars? Our server went M.I.A. after he dropped our food off and getting our food to us took longer than expected for two appetizers. Still, this is a place I'll be coming back to the next time I'm in Vegas.

I was staying at Mandalay Bay for the first time this past weekend. A group of us wanted to get something quick and convenient. I ordered the Corn-beef Rueben, it was good  and goes perfectly well with the coleslaw I got. The price was decent comparing to other options in the hotel. 

The Corn-beef Rueben was delicious, slightly on the heavy taste, but the flavor wise was good. I personally think it would have goes well with some mustard on the side just get a little kick to it. We also ordered chicken-noodle soup which is perfect for a hangover remedy. Last but not least, the nacho with chicken that comes in double size is not bad but it would have been better to have little bit more cheese and pico de gallo. Overall, I would come back to visit if I'm in the area.
Delicious breakfast.  We split the ultimate- tons of food and the hash browns were the best I have ever had.  Waitress was the nicest and best we have had in Vegas.  Definitely will come back.

Fantastic place to eat. We've been here a few times now and it's always been enjoyable. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable. Food is excellent, especially the brick  chicken and French onion soup. Breakfast is a good bet also with a wide range of offerings. Beer selection is very good as well.

I had the triple bacon burger which was a standard burger with 3 strips of bacon... There is something to be said about truth in advertising. I had the hamhock mac n cheese. The pasta was a bit over cooked for my taste. However, you do get the smokieness of the hamhock. If the pasta was bit less overdone, it would be one of my favorite mac n cheese plates. The burger is juicy with everything served on the side, mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles are on the side. You add whatever you want to add to it.

Great if you want a quick bite and coffee. There's however a price for the convenience: Our two mediocre sandwich and lousy coffees cost almost $40!  I'll go to the Starbucks around the corner next time for food and coffee..! To top it off, the cashier was not that nice and friendly, as she was annoyed at customers in her presence. OK, moving on....

We were the very first customers.  We're willing to cut them some slack because of that but everything was excellent.  We had blueberry waffles, crispy bacon, Denver omelette & tater tots.  The tots were Incredible and the food & service was top notch.  Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.
Rude, slow, food is bland.  You could get a better meal faster by getting in your car and driving.
The food and service are atrocious. The staff isn't friendly and the food we had was awful and took forever. Let's not forget the prices which are 2x what they should be. Never again.

Bland. Slow. Cold. Food came out one at a time - one of our girls didn't get her gross breakfast burrito until 30 min after we all got our food.  "crispy potatoes" inside of breakfast burrito were mushy French fries. Mgr. tried to "save" the service by offering "shots" which ended up being watered down blueberry vodka - I swear I saw him spit into one bringing it up to his mouth at the bar.  SAVE YOURSELF and avoid.

Best Reuben sandwich I have ever had.   The place is surrounded by expensive chef restaurants like Emeril.  Being a normal person, none of them appeal to me.  I would absolutely recommend that you eat here.

Stumbled upon Citizen on a quite Monday morning.  Tim was an awesome server and really was spot on with his recommendations.  French toast was great and the orange zest in the whipped cream was a nice touch.  The breakfast burrito was great and had tons of flavor with good guacamole.  Fresh fruit smoothie was made from scratch, not from a mix.  Cool vibe, decor, and good tunes.  A solid discovery!

Located inside Mandalay, I was in search of a good breakfast. This place was ayyyy-ok, but not the greatest. I ordered the corn beef hash skillet and was a little disappointed on how salty and greasy it tasted. I know, it was corn beef hash, but I was hoping for a little more pizzaz.
The coffee though was really good. I am happy I did not stand in the long Starbucks line in the morning.
Next time, I am not sure if I will visit this place again since it was not that memorable.

Seriously worst service ever.  The waiter didn't even acknowledge our table for about 10 minutes.  We put our food and drink order then.  We waited and waited and waited for our food.  We ordered a salad and grilled chicken sandwich.  It took over 45 minutes for our food and not once did our server come over.  We almost left drink money and left.  The food was good but the service was  ridiculous.
If rude hostess, and mediocre overpriced food is your thing then go here. Otherwise save your money and your time and go somewhere else. I've been here twice, had 2 bad meals and won't be back.
Even a hungry drunk person couldn't save this place. Seriously I am hungry and I am drunk but this place blows. I hate wasting food but I really don't want to take this burger home.

Are these ppl serious??! How patient do they think drunk ppl are? hahaa 

All we wanted was a bit of water n to be able to place our order ... No demands of the timeliness in which u brought it out... Just some water and attention. Ughh.  

They took so long we went to their to-go area and picked up our own "cheese platter" appetizer http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/citizens-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?filter_by_userid=True&select=VbTLyvrPncloIwfJ1XjaIQ&userid=ydIdyGQyO8eZe0yqgs0DfA#QS0SSvYIraRV0PTdWSQTzQ to hold us over until someone decided to come talk to us.  

Closest place at the moment that was open though.  I hate that beggars can't be choosers--I'll just be a whiny beggar then :/

Ate here while staying at TheHotel @ Mandalay Bay.  Our meal was very simple: Cobb salad, patty melt, 2 beers.  The burger was indulgent- it's basically 2 grilled cheese sandwiches (very thin bread) with a burger in the middle.  Came with fries and was pretty good, but nothing special by any means.  Given that it's Vegas, I forgive the $20/entree, but the food was just alright.  Next time I'll make the short walk to the burger bar.

My wife and I stopped in here after a night of fun, and arrived with a slight hangover...

At the suggestion of our waitress - I ordered their meatball sub. The meatballs were pretty flavorful and had a nice consistency. They proclaim on the menu that their sauce is a "12 hour" sauce, but I couldn't really tell because there wasn't enough of it on the sub... The best part though was definitely the sub bun, which was slightly toasted and had the perfect balance of crispy on the outside and soft on inside. My wife order the BBQ pork sandwich, which she enjoyed. Her only knock on it was that it was supposed to have jalapeño's incorporated into the BBQ pork, but she did not seem to taste them in her sandwich. Aside from that, the pork was good. Once again - the shining star of the sandwich was the bread. For our side, we both ordered the seasoned waffle fries, and they were excellent.

The ultimate mary was pretty neat, stacked with all the fixings.  Tasted pretty good as well.  We waited half an hour (no joke, had already finished my bloody mary + all the food on it) before the turkey burger would arrive.  When it came, the burger was luke warm at best, but the buns ontop and under were COLD.  It was as if they just came out of the freezer without being heated.  Disappointed.

Frank the server was very inappropriate in his attitude. We ate a quick breakfast here and paid with a credit card. The others in the group were paying the tip with cash. They quickly left for a conference and forgot to place the tip on the table. The server Frank came outside of the restaurant and chased us down. He then proceeded to scold us in public saying that he lost $6 on our table (although our bill was more than $100 and we would have tipped at least $15). He yelled at us "Is this how to do this" as if we purposely and routinely  dine without tipping. Very tacky and humiliating ....

Would I come here if I was not staying here at MB, no.
Would I eat here when I am, YES. One yummy dish and I'm sold. French dip all they way for those seeking to fill a simple light palate with some yummy meat. Light and  fluffy french dip all the way.

This past weekend we were in Vegas and stayed at Mandalay Bay.  We stopped at Citizens late on Friday night as we needed just a bit of food to get us through till breakfast.  I ordered the grilled cheese - which looked awesome - but in reality, it was awful.  It tasted bad from the get go and had me throwing up later that night.  $11 for a grilled cheese that will make you sick?  Ya, I think not.

Sunday morning on our way out, my girlfriends stopped there to grab a quick bite and it pretty much ended in the same result.  NO one liked the food. Service was meh...Definitely don't think we will be going back there.

This place is conveniently located in the Mandalay Bay basement shopping area. We came here specifically looking for healthier options, so we tried their fruit salad, Caesar salad, mixed green salad, and quinoa salad with seasonable vegetables. The salads have extremely fresh ingredients, which is great. But what I love about this place is that each piece of lettuce and ingredient is generously drizzled with the dressing, yet the taste is quite balanced and not overpowering. The decor of the restaurant is also nice and clean, which helps with the appetite for certain. For those that want to easily bring food to go, Citizens offers many easy to-go options right at entrance, which you can just pay, go, and enjoy!

Two stars for the server but this place is way overpriced. I don't even get why it's so expensive. I know Mandalay Bay is a really nice hotel but still, this place has ridiculously priced items on their menu. My boyfriend and I just wanted a quick bite and since this was the only place open at 12:30am, we tried it. We got the quesadilla with steak. It was alright. Not bad but not great either. $35 for a cocktail and Taco Bell Style quesadilla is just dumb. I might go back if it comes to that again, but it's not on my list of places to rush back to!

Have eaten here two nights in a row for dinner and two of the best meals I've had in Vegas.  Impeccable service.  Apaca and Joe were our servers for our dinners and Robert served us breakfast.  All three servers recommended excellent dinners and Joe recommended a great breakfast choice.  It's a hidden gem in Vegas. Staff is friendly, restaurant was very clean.  I recommend the Reuben, Meatloaf, Gumbo and for breakfast sandwich or Eggs Benedict.  

I have traveled to Vegas 5 times in the last 90 days and stayed at high end to average resorts and this is my new favorite restaurant.
I had a horrible experience and bad customer service, dry and lousy croissant that they wouldn't even warm and very bad PB&J sandwich. Beware of this cafe...

So when we landed and checked in were starving.  There aren't that's y choices to eat and this place looked decent.  I ordered the turkey avocado sandwich.  I felt a bit deceived because I thought I'd have pieces of avocado in my sandwich... But nope it's smushed in with the spread/sauce.  For $14 I guess I was expecting a piece of avocado.  Don't think I would go back for sandwich unless I'm desperate again like we were when we first landed.

Since we were in Vegas again and had the opportunity we made sure to eat here again. This trip the Wife and I shared the Nachos, then split the Ruben with the cole slaw on the side. Again I am not sure why all the low stars for this place. Our waiter was awesome, Greg, there when we needed him and let us chill when we needed to. We had a great dinner with great service. If that is what you are looking for then give this place a chance. And about the prices, your in Vegas, in a casino, you are not going to get prices like your eating at Denny's. Note: most meals are large enough to be shared. That can help you save some money.

After a night at Foundation Room, me and my date had a case of the late night munchies. Citizens Kitchen and Bar was like a shining beacon that drew late diners in like a moth to a flame. Honestly though, it was our our only dining option at 1AM inside Mandalay Bay (thank goodness for 24 hour eating establishments, right?). Citizens was actually pretty crowded at this time of night. We only had a 5 minute wait to be seated, so no sweat.

Citizens is washed in bright lighting and white decor. Me and my gal pal were seated at a small table amid all the hustle and bustle. Our waiter promptly arrived to take our drink orders. When I got to looking at the menu, I quickly realized Citizens wasn't really a vegetarian friendly kind of place. I wasn't too worried because I was hungry but not like starving or anything so I was fine with getting an appetizer. Artichoke dip and chips it is! Unfortunately, I wasn't able to get a photo because my phone had died. :( The food came out in less than 10 minutes and was a good sized serving. I wasn't able to finish it all and left full. The dip had a great consistency and tasted great. Chips were yummy too.  

Worth a Return Visit?
I wouldn't go out if my way for Citizens, but if I find myself at Mandalay Bay in the wee hours of the morning I'd have no qualms about coming back.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #138

Located in the Madalay Bay which was perfect after partying.  I had the Chicken Quesadilla which was really good.  My friend had the Turkey Burger which she loved and other friend had Potatoe Skins.  We all liked what we ordered.  Great spot to go to after hanging out in Madalay.

Stay away from this place. I gave it a generous two stars only because the manager offered us a free desert by commenting on the food (which we passed). I thought the place would carry on the same quality as its former self ( RED WHITE & BLUE RESTAURANT). Had the mahi mahi fish tacos from the servers recommendation. I couldn't figure out if I was eating coleslaw or fish tacos. Very runny tacos. Wifey had the quinoa and kale salad. Terribel. The quinoa was not cooked all the way thru. Pricey and lame.

I ate at Citizens twice on this Vegas trip. Once for late night and once for breakfast. Citizens is open 24/7. Good for breakfast, lunch, dinner, late night, etc. 

We never had to wait too long for a table. Both visit's wait staff were cool. Very attentive and nice. 

The food isn't bad either. A bit expensive but what else do you expect from a restaurant inside a hotel (Mandalay Bay). 

- Loco Moco was good, needed more gravy over the beef patty though. 

- Cheesecake was awesome...check into Yelp for a free cheesecake with your entree. 

- Citizens' breakfast (pancakes super good). 

Two good experiences here. Redeem your M Life card or use your M Life points.

I wanted to update my review to A-OK. The reason? The owner reached out to me and invited me back into the restaurant for a different experience, which really says something. I was impressed by this action. Thanks, Jara.  I'm going to say that the menu sounds really good. I'm hoping that the service has changed since my last visit. Best of luck to this restaurant. Keep listening to your customers and I think you will do A-OK.


Review from Feb 2, 2013.

The scene:

Citizens Kitchen & Bar
Hotel: Mandalay Bay
Date: Saturday, February 2, 2013
Time: 12:00 pm
There was a UFC fight the same day. Picture lots of men on steroids with tons of testosterone, pent up rage and Affliction t-shirts.  HA
Food: 1 Turkey Sandwich, 2 Iced Teas and Chicken Soup= $66.00

I was craving some comfort food to help revitalize my energy levels. I had a giant sandwich on my mind, so I walked through the Casino in hopes of eating at the Red, White and Blue Restaurant. I come to find out that my favorite sandwich spot is closed and Citizen's Kitchen & Bar has replaced my go-to sandwich spot. Citizens prides itself on non fancy, REAL comfort food. The vibe is new American mixed with old fashioned comfort.  The environment was great, the service and food..not so much. When we arrived for lunch, there was one other group at the bar. We were told by our server that we were the first lunch customers EVER. 

Since we were the first lunch customers, I didn't come with ridiculously high standards. I was here with the most relaxed group of foodies. I grew up in a restaurant, so I'm always pretty calm and understanding when things go wrong, however there were so many mistakes and unkept promises, I was embarrassed for the restaurant. Charles Barkley showed up 1 hour after us and still got served before us. Haha  It took us 2 hours to get a cup of chicken noodle soup and a hot turkey sandwich. We were told 6 times that our food would be out soon. The hot turkey sandwich with gravy was COLD. One turkey sandwich, one cup of soup and 2 iced teas cost us $66.00, no joke. 

The manager did not listen to us and acted as if we were an inconvenience.  We didn't get a discount, but they offered us free pastries. We  were not interested. We won't be coming back here. 

Tip of the day: You are better off going to Subway or a food court for lunch.  Take your $66.00 to STK, getting a mouthwatering steak + the mac and cheese and enjoy ridiculously superb service.

Ugh. Absent service and super rude when he did come by. When we finally stopped someone else to ask for more water and our check, our waiter came over with attitude and excuses. As we ignored him and stood to leave he yelled sarcastically at our backs about whatever he had been doing. Food was 24-hour Vegas food. Blah.

Came to Citizen, for a quick dinner with family.
