At 7pm on a Thursday they weren't super packed, they seated us immediately. I didn't drink however, a member of my party enjoyed their lemon drop martini. Our waitress, was very attentive and quick!
I order the Turkey Burger which was massive ( I added some pepper jack cheese to seal the deal) .I quickly chowed down and couldn't attempt to even eat dessert. I left happy and fell into a food coma less than an hour later.

For a city that doesn't sleep, it sure is hard to find a place to eat at 3 in the morning, and it doesn't come cheap. The food is not bad, but its nothing special. You're paying $20 for a Chilis burger, but drunk you probably wont mind, sober you will when you see the bill in the morning.

I was surprised to find this was the only place open to eat at 1:30 am on my last visit to Mandalay Bay.  This used to be my hotel and I always thought there were more options.

Anyways, I ended up eating here 2x within 4 hours.  

You can sit down in the restaurant and have a decent menu available to you or you can order from the counter.  The latter is better, over priced smaller bites.  The former has a wider selection - Vegas strip priced diner food.

I wish there were more options.  But at 4:30 in the morning after being up all night and still wasted, this place ain't bad.  

p.s.  the pastries at the counter are good.

one-word review: SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW

Surprisingly bad. Took forever to get drinks, took forever to get food. Server was apologetic and nice and friendly, but that only goes so far.

My friend got a burger. Asked for jalapeños on the side. Told it would be extra, no problem. Jalapeños never showed up, we complained. By the time the server returned my friend had already finished his burger. Server came to explain they ran out of jalapeños. Burger itself was a bad, obviously frozen patty. Oh, and they forgot the fries as well, which were uninspiring.

My salad was fine, a C+/B- level type meal.

I'd be shocked if that initial 5-star review was not a shill post. This place was baaaaaaad.

I typically don't write reviews but I was so blown away by the service. I have NEVER had such an amazing bartender as Steven!!!!  And I love his mustache!!  He knew the menu backwards and forwards. And gave us great suggestions for what to do and see here at the hotel and in Vegas. Plus his drinks were amazing! We  so have to come back!!!

I was in Las Vegas on the weekend of September 7 and stopped in to this restaurant on a Sunday around 11 AM. The place is pretty big and I went to the bar since I was alone, as a friend I was with could not handle Las Vegas :-)

I was served by the bartender Lizzy. I had just come off a pretty wild night so I was not looking for an all booze drink, but something tasty and classy for breakfast. Lizzie made me a double chocolate espresso martini. She used a rye based vodka which was very good. 

For breakfast food, I ordered off of their Sunday brunch menu and had a French Toast Crème Brulé.it was pretty good tasting and I would recommend it if you are here for a breakfast item.

I had a second drink which is also very good. The bartender was extremely attentive and professional and fun! The atmosphere is also very fun there with seating options in a dining room or the bar. There appears to be a 24 hour café as well located in the restaurant.

I highly recommend the place and do suggest you visit the bar when you are in Las Vegas.

I love this restaurant and especially their wonderful to-go counter.  The hostess always greet and are very polite as well as the counter staff. On several occasions the manager working named Margaret or Marjorie (not sure but she works morning and afternoon) has been extremely rude and unfriendly. She doesn't smile or make eye contact with anyone and looks miserable. It's very sad to see someone dislike their job as much as she does and I'm sure her employees pick up on it. Hire someone friendly they are supposed to turn around bad experiences not create them.
I ordered corned beef and ginger snap, quality of the food is great.  Corned beef is not overly grease, great crispy texture and very tasty.

Giving it two stars because the food is good. The service is terrible. 
Staying at Hotel been here twice already. Same problems both times. 
Stood there while three different employees walked past without acknowledgment. Had to flag someone down to get a seat. Coffee delivered without a spoon. Stir with a fork is not the best option. Food delivered. Asked for tobasco and watched the guy walk to the back and just start doing something else. Literally forgot to get it for me in seconds.
General uncaring atmosphere.

The important thing is they have breakfast food 24/7. It's an alternative to riding to Denny's 20 miles away. The other alternative to this place within a similar distance is Raffles... With a crazy hangover, though, guess where we didn't end up. Solid breakfast food and fast service is the solution to any Vegas ailment except maybe losing your dignity to a stripper. Also, coffee. Lots of coffee is the answer. The question? I forgot.
I had the spinach and mushroom omelette. Food was fantastic! Tim, our server, was outstanding. We will definitely be back.

Skip it, skip it, skip it.  Food was just okay, service was less than okay, and the prices for the food were the equivalent to spending steak money on a 10% patty.  When my wife asked the server what was on tap, he said "nothing" and walked away with no suggestions,

If you find yourself stuck at Mandalay Bay on a Sunday night, understand:
They know it too.  

They shut everything down but this hole, so you have no choice on where to go.

Tip, order a Pizza or walk to Jack in the Box!

First off, the hostesses offer you the option of sitting down to eat or getting the same food at the counter. They don't tell you that the people working the counter have no idea what is going on and you could probably finish two meals sitting while you wait in that ridiculous line. We opted for the line though b/c we didn't know. There were like 10 employees working behind this counter and they could barely pour a cup of coffee. Three of them were working on one person's order b/c she must have had a comp meal or something but really there were at least 20 people in line while we listened to this. Once we made it to order, I just got the yogurt b/c I knew the wait for eggs might take until lunch. My friends got the banana pancakes and eggs benedict. The pancakes were huge, doughy and honestly just gross. There was nothing redeeming about them. The eggs benedict was okay but nothing too great. I highly recommend the breakfast at Raffles as a good alternative in Mandalay Bay. The outside of Citizens looks great but it's really not work the $15 yogurt and coffee breakfast.

We had Gebriel as a server and he was so much fun! Great service, great food. We had the fish and chips, fish tacos, and chicken at his suggestion and all were delicious. Great flavor and good portion sizes given the price.
Good restaurant with a great selection of items. Menu has items that are good at any time of the day, and they're also open late.

Citizens is just a horrible example of a standard hotel restaurant.  The food was mediocre but priced on the high end of other similar restaurants.  The service was poor and the server was very inattentive.
Big Bloody Mary looks great, tastes ok.  Crab was NASTY in bloodyMary.  Fruit not good,choose else where if you can

Stopped by here because we needed a quick bite to eat before the Michael Jackson One show.  Thought it would be faster if we went to the bar. Took a while for the bartender to show up, but once she did service was fine. We had the chili cheese kobe beef fries, which hit the spot. Decent place to watch sports as well.

Got here at 10:45pm on a Saturday and got seated right away.  I had the fish tacos that are good but better for lunch. My hubby had the French dip that was a real winner. I'm coming back for that next time.
Green & mean smoothie was good but really? $10 for 1 regular sized cup of puréed lettuce? Overpriced and It didn't make me feel magical. Make it $5.73 a-holes!

Quick seating.  Great food.  My husband is a wing man; he loved the buffalo wings.  The BBQ ribs were great as well, but my favorite were the onion rings that came with the ribs.  Finished the meal off with a nice piece of cheesecake, which was excellent. I will definitely be back.

Horrible service, and we got food poisoning from here so will definitely not be back in the future. We came in around 9pm and the place was pretty much empty, but the staff (two females) wasn't very friendly, and it didn't seem like they wanted to take our order. My friend decided she wanted the Steak & Cheese Panini ($12, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/citizens-kitchen-and-bar-las-vegas?select=dgefLD8z6Vz861HvOIt6oA#dgefLD8z6Vz861HvOIt6oA), which was ready in 5-10 minutes. We tried to sit at the tables inside, but the staff said that area was closed, and forced us to side outside in the "patio" area, where the seats were not very comfortable, and where it was colder (even though we were still inside the casino). Some of the meat in the panini was still cold when we got it, since it wasn't heated evenly. However, since it looked like pre-cooked meat, we figured it would be ok, which was a terrible mistake since we all got food poisoning the next day. 

DO NOT EAT HERE if you can avoid it. If it's the only place that's open, make sure that your food is cooked thoroughly. However, if you see two females behind the counter, expect some crappy service.

I'll give it 3.5 stars, but I only got food to go. I found out its the only 24 hour place in Mandalay which is nice. Their take out menu is much cheaper than dining in. 

I asked what salad they recommend and they told me the Cobb so I got it. I was hoping it was the same size as the display in the counter but it wasn't. $11 for a salad is high, but it's Vegas. The salad wasn't bad.

Decent food, casual. VERY noisy. I had the Teriyaki bowl with brown rice and chicken. It was good.  Like most teriyaki sauce it was a but sweet for my preference but luckily there wasn't a ton on it. The chicken comes on a wooden skewer, fire grilled so it has lots of delicious flavor. 

Had a side mixed green salad to start, which was nice and fresh. Tell them easy on the dressing tho. Otherwise the dressing overpowers the salad. 

The bar seating is fine if you are in a hurry.

Story:  I ordered a slice if cake at around 11pm that my wife and I was going to share.  We had no idea of how much it was going to cost. Upon paying my wife asked for a cup of water. I followed. Total came to nearly 12 bucks and I hand over the credit card. Cashier hands me card back and wife says, why so expensive?  Found out it costs $1 per cup for tap water. I was upset but cashier tells me sorry, already ran the card. I left feeling ripped off.  While my wife picked up cake I asked for manager to come to my table. Sean came over and listened to my complaint. Afterwards I learned employee was new, and that the $1 charge was because of night club people often came in just for water.  He then asked how he could make it right. In the end he did way more than we asked. He turned around an a angry customer.  Having said that the cake was really good as well. I'd go back. Hopefully they will be informing customers about the charge for water.

We started off with the shredded chicken noodle soup with buttered saltine crackers like when we were kids, then ordered the grilled Mahi Mahi fish tacos and there were 3 with guacamole, salsa and sour cream.  We also ordered the grilled shrimp on a bed of quinoa with yogurt sauce and steamed green beans.  All were delish and enjoyable and our waiter was attentive.

Food is very tasty here but avoid breakfast items. They tend to be bland.

The late night menu was amazing!!!

The French Dip Steak Sandwich was the best French dip I've ever had!!! It came with Thin Sliced Prime Rib, Caramelized Onions, Provolone, Au Jus, and Crispy Shoestring Fries
The au jus alone was very tasty on its own but i agree that towards the end things got a little too salty. 

I also ordered the potato salad on the side! It was really good as well. It came with red potatoes and dill :)

Please don't go to this place. Management is horrible. This place never takes their customers seriously. Now I know why many people left bad review toward horrible/rude customer service and managers. When the good service comes along with the good food, then it makes the restaurant good.

Menu: I think this place has good selections from sandwiches to good soup menus.
But I have no idea how the taste are because I had to return the food. I bet the overall quality and taste decent by reading other people's reviews.

Price: Pretty high as a quick bite casual place. Of course, this is in Vegas. But Wynn has much better casual restaurants with the same price level.

Service: If you are planning to order something over the counter, don't expect to get treated nicely. Just think you are at the local $3 burger shop, but the price is 5 times higher. First, the cashier / hostess at the counter, is not professional (I don't think they are rude. It seems like they just didn't get trained enough about how to serve customers politely).

The worst part is the manager, who is even worse. This place's manager (Mike) is the RUDEST manager I have ever met in my life. I saw another bad review about this place's manger, now I know why. if you have any issue with this place, don't even try to make it fixed with a manager, cuz it will make you look like you are the one with the problem. And don't try to explain what went wrong with your order, because the manage won't listen you.

If you don't care about the service, this place is good to go.

Told you we'd be back before we leave!! Haha. Seriously, what is up with the low ratings for this place?? Second time here, on Sunday, on Mother's Day and still received amazing service and food! This time our server was Lane...awesome guy. Both times we've been, it was a phenomenal experience. See my other review. I can't wait till we come back next year. I will be thinking of this place until that time.

Husband and I went there for brunch I ordered the benedict with salmon and my husband got the chicken and waffles. We waited at least 30 min for our food and while my husbands food was nice and hot mine was not and my eggs were hard boiled. When the waiter came by and asked us about our food I told him I was not very happy with getting hard boiled eggs. He offered to get me more eggs but I declined he also said that he would talk to the manager. My husband loved his chicken and waffles and I thought my food was not good but at least the manager apologized for the wait and the eggs so we got the meal for free.

Late night Christmas eats in Vegas! Citizens is the only place open beyond 10pm tonight. But...mmm...this is still a great choice.

I had the fried calamari, French onion soup, Caesar salad, and steak frites -- to go. It was packed perfectly for me to take back to my room.

The calamari was tasty and lightly beaded. It was great even without the two sauces it comes with - cocktail and Thai chili. The salad was crisp and as fresh as you'd expect with a couple of large croutons. The French onion soup was savory with shredded onions and a layer of gooey cheese. No croutons in the soup and it was on the slightly sweeter side. The steak itself was good. I ordered it medium and it was a full 16oz steak. The fruit bowl was a nice way to finish it all off.

Service was fast but the wait for the food was over 20 minutes. *sigh* Pricey too but what else are you going to eat at this hour on Christmas day?

Loved the Mac and cheese w/ham hocks. Wife had Chicken Noodles which had more chicken than Noodles but still good. This place is better than average for 24 hour service. It was a little pricey, even for Vegas fare. However, the service was decent and it was a good spot to eat and watch a band play in the casino.

The food was great, but I docked off a star for the painfully slow service and inattentive staff. 

I came with a group of 4 and we came in the late afternoon for lunch. Even though there were empty tables, it took around 10 minutes before we were seated. We ordered as soon as possible because we were starving and it took 30 minutes for our food to come out even though none of the dishes we ordered were complex. We ordered two salads, an artichoke dip, and a teriyaki chicken bowl. I got the BBQ chicken salad, and it was pretty good. There were a lot of different ingredients, such as beans, onion rings, corn, and avocado, so I didn't get sick of it. Portions were pretty big, and I was actually full from the salad, but I don't think it was worth $19. I also tried the artichoke dip, which was pretty good! It came with two different kinds of chips. I liked the pita one better. The artichoke dip was hot, creamy, and cheesy.

Had lunch here. Sat in the outside seating, which unfortunately included the smoke from the rest of Mandalay Bay. Small table for 3 folks; can't imagine trying to seat one more.

Ordered the chicken wings with sweet chili sauce (GF!) and they were decent. My husband (who travels and dines out a lot for his job) said his French dip sandwich was the best he's ever had....The prices are quite high, but it's a nice resort, so we understand. Our server was nice but not over the top. 

I'd probably go back for late-night grub, but not lunch or dinner.

Build your own omelette ($14). Everything else is an extra .50 or .75 for meats. I will note, they ended up getting the cheeses mixed up when our food was brought out. (Not a big deal, but thought I'd mention it, and they did remove the cheese from our bill.) 

When the food finally did arrive, the omelette from the looks of it - was a little thin. It looked like it was made with egg substitute rather than real eggs. 

Round it off with 2 (maybe) 8oz orange juices and 1 coffee the bill came out to over $40.

Conclusion:
The place is okay, but a little pricey. Dimly lite like the rest of the places we've been to in Vegas so far.
Came here for a late night snack.  They're 24/7 and have a smaller menu during late hours.  The hot dip, chicken soup and corn beef hash were all super delicious.

Really delicious foods including sandwiches, appetizers, steak, burgers and salads. The service was amazing! They also have a bar and a cafe like spot where you can pick up food on the run. However, I did think the prices were a little high for what we got, but what else would you expect from a luxurious hotel!

We were in town for my boyfriend's 30th birthday and had a fantastic experience here. We were walking around Mandalay looking for a place to eat during a convention lunch rush. The hostess Daija was super friendly, she sold us at the door when we asked about what Salmon dishes  they had and she recommended the salmon teriyaki bowl. She found us a seat right away. Our server Robert was personable, knowledgeable and gave us great suggestions, the Ruben was on point. We loved the food and service so much we asked to speak with the GM Marjorie so we could make sure the staff was recognized. She appreciated the feedback and recommended some other cool places to check out. All in all a great place to eat!

Was just here, picked up a fresh juice. It was tasty. 

The cashier couldn't have been more unfriendly, totally flat and unwelcoming. 

I've been in the service industry for 8+ yrs even if you are having a bad day, you still have to suck it up, put a smile on your face and be nice to customers! 

So juice gets five stars, service gets two stars.

Citizens gets 5 stars in my book. Hands down the best place to eat after 12a.m in vegas. Prices might seem a little high but when you see the portions you won't be complaining and let's face it, this is vegas and you have to pay for quality.  The staff is great here and upbeat. If you find yourself in Mandalay Bay stop by citizens for a bite!

"Meh" sums it up....I felt that way about Red, White and Blue and Citizens is no different. Honestly, it feels like casino management said "hey, let's change the sign on this joint..but we're totally cool with the slow, indifferent service and so/so, overpriced food".

You can do better, and you probably should.
Don't order any steaks but the breakfast food and ultimate Bloody Mary was awesome. I would recommend just visiting the bar and doing appetizers. Entrees weren't much to speak of.

Eh, it's okay. It's a hit or miss.  When you're staying at the Mandalay Bay, it's late night and there's nothing else to eat, this is the only option (besides room service but I honestly think room service and this place are one in the same.)

The 3 times I had to eat here was all different, experience wise and food wise. I only utilized the take out counter, thinking that this would be the "faster" route but it's not necessarily.  Price wise it's all going to be pricey because you're at the Mandalay/on the strip, but again if you haven't eaten all day and you have not other options, a $16 sandwich is suddenly doable and you're at the mercy of their service. I'll sum up my review in my visits:

1st visit - Was 10pm, went in to grab a quick snack of fruit and a muffin. Really wanted ice cream but they don't serve that. Was expensive but at least service as quick as nothing needed to be prepped and there wasn't much of a line. Muffin was good, too. 

2nd visit - Was about 1pm, hubby ran in to grab a reuben sandwich, not sure how long his wait was but that reuben was way too salty! Could only handle 2 bites, not a fan...

3rd visit - It was 11pm and I have no idea what was happening but it took them 20 minutes to even acknowledge my husband standing there at the take out counter! My husband has the patience of a saint and saw that they were extremely understaffed but why the hell does it take the manager 15 minutes to make one espresso? The poor dude who ordered the espresso just seemed amazed at the whole process too, but you can't badger someone who's touching your food, ya know? There was people just standing there waiting to pay for a canned soda and the one of only two employees behind the counter just said, "take it" and waived them off.  The more annoying thing? That there was other workers in that restaurant meandering around the take out area! Come on now, help them out! 

Anyways, I was ready to leave after the first 20 mins but my husband was really hungry and again, we're at the mercy of being out in BFE Mandalay at midnight. After being in there for over 30 minutes and not even having anything to show for it, I forced my husband to leave and bought him a banana and some Dibs ice cream in the sundries store to quiet his stomach until we could get a proper meal in the morning. 

Thank goodness we were checking out the next day as well.
Poor experience, had to pay an extra $7.00 for a salad without  cheese, then they didn't give us dressing, and Heather had a ton of attitude. Food was good, service was not...

Food was great. But service not so much. Also when it came time to paying our bill the prices were a few bucks higher on the bill than the prices listed on the menu. Took forever to get checks adjusted and it was honestly a waste of 30 minutes. Don't come here.

If you're looking for juicing alternatives and something close, fast, healthy & convenient to the hotel convention, try the Green & Mean juice here. Juices seem to have a lil pulp included and are prepared like a light smoothie, but more juice. Includes Kale, Spinach, Green Apples and Banana just to name a few. Super delish! There are a few other juices to choose from, but this is the best among them. For to-go orders, they recommend placing your order at the deli area vs from the bar. Workers seem to be friendly & accommodating, yet understaffed. So, bring your patience then enjoy your juice. ;D

"Every time I come in the kitchen, you in the kitchen." -- Friday (1995)

So disappointing. After an amazing show at House of Blues, my friends and I were starving. We wandered through our hotel looking to see what was open and had a menu of lighter fare and found Citizens. They could seat us right away so we went for it.

The service was horrific. Slow, and when our waiter did show up he was so quiet you could barely hear him and anything we did understand, he was a but rude. We ordered our sandwiches, soups, pastas, etc. and he disappeared. Drinks were barely filled and it took ages to get our food.

Once we actually got our food, it was nothing to write home about - although my club-like sandwich was huge. However, it was so dry it was very hard to get through. My pasta salad was pretty decent, but not really what you want to be excited about when you order a sandwich. 

This is definitely on my list to avoid in the future - I'd probably have to be desperate to eat here again.  Pretty disappointing since it seemed like it should have been a good experience.

Honestly, how do you screw up breakfast.... Food was horrid.. Cold no taste.. 
Had a conversation with Manger Keith he was receptive & accommodating.  
After, the bad food the the server screwed up our bill.  Took another 10-15 to complete task to get the Hell out of there.  Pass on this place... Spent almost two hours in Citzens.. Two hours of my life I'll never get back. :((
The food was great, I had the bisquits and gravy skillet, I was so full I couldn't even finish it, my bf had the ultimate breakfast he loved it, the pancakes are supper fluffy

Better than I expected after reading all the crappy reviews.

I've been here at least 3 different times on 3 different visits and it's been consistently decent.  On our last visit, Greg took our order and was really cool and gave us attentive and thoughtful service.  The food was not bad and was definitely good enough for a cafe type of restaurant.  I liked the chicken soup a lot.

Iced tea is brewed which is a surprise because the buffet and Raffles both serve crappy soda fountain iced tea.  The sandwiches are filling and pretty good.  The presentation is nice and the fries are tasty. 

I personally prefer the tables away from the entrance but if people watching is your thing, the front location is the best part because you can see all sorts of people coming from the clubs and the arena when there's an event going on.  It's loud and lively and good to go at 2am for some steak and eggs or other late night fare.

I'm SO angry that they removed the lobster roll from their menu! Thanks, Hakkasan, for buying them out, and ruining the menu, WTF. Every time my friends and I are in Vegas, we come to Citizens just for the lobster roll and mac & cheese. I got all my friends into the lobster roll, and we all couldn't wait to come back and get it.

I was having such a horrible weekend, and on the day I was leaving, I went to Citizens to try and make the weekend up with an amazing lobster roll, and mac & cheese. I was so excited, and was anticipating it all weekend. I looked at the menu and boom, NO lobster roll. I asked the waitress, and she said they removed it. So I left. She didn't think I was serious when I said I was leaving, lol. I'm not interested in any other dishes on the menu. You lost a very loyal customer!

Got the turkey and avocado sandwich for take out to bring back to my room.
Got to my room and realized there was no avocado on my sandwich. With no avocado I just got a stack of turkey with one slice of tomato and some aioli on mediocre bread.

Would've been better if I got what I paid for. I could've gone to subway and got a $5 sandwich that is better than paying $13 for what they served.
Low quality food, I've had salads and their burgers, while not being terrible, it's not good.  Typical strip prices (relatively high) and quality comparable to a cheap grocery store deli.
Best Bloody Mary's around town. Food is delicious and couldn't get any better service. Bartender Raquel was  super nice, helpful and fast.

I enjoyed this place for lunch and breakfast (we came here twice during our trip to Vegas). It's located in Mandalay Bay, so it was close to us since we were staying at the Luxor. 

The service here was good, and prices are pretty affordable for being on The Strip. It's a casual place that's not affiliated with a celebrity chef, so you'll never have to wait for a table. 

Items we tried:

- French Onion Soup: HUGE portion. I think this is easily a two person starter. It was very flavorful, and had lots of cheese. The previous Yelp reviews on this did not disappoint. 

- Kobe Chili Cheese Fries: I saw "Kobe" on the menu and knew I had to order it. Seasoned waffle fries came out with Kobe beef chili and a mini pitcher of nacho cheese. It was good, but it was very high in sodium (probably all chili cheese fries are). I would suggest trying this if you like chili cheese fries. 

- 2 Eggs Any Style Breakfast: Yum! The tater tots were delicious! I ordered scrambled eggs and they were good. Not rubbery at all. If you order bacon as your meat, you will get three slices. It's breakfast, so it's hard to really mess this up. 

Overall, I good casual spot for a quick meal if you're hungry and don't want to leave the area.

Glad this place is 24/7... Came here straight from Light Nightclub ;p in dire need of something to eat. I got the turkey avocado. Such a good choice! It was soooo good! The sandwich consists of: turkey & avocado (duh! Lol), muenster cheese, sprouts, lemon aioli, and cranberry walnut bread. Everything went so well together... One of the best sandwiches I've ever tasted! And I really don't think it was because I was a bit tipsy lol. I also got the chunky monkey smoothie. Forgot what's it in... Chocolate, banana, and other stuff I think. But it's worth trying!!
They stop serving breakfast at 11am. The turkey avocado sandwich was super good. Chili cheese waffle fries not so much.

Dropping my rating from a two star to a one star DISASTER!

I just wrote a review for the Citizens Kitchen & Bar last week.  I mentioned that the waiter George was "AMAZING!"   I retract my statement.  He is unethical and unprofessional.  He automatically included an 18% tip in our bill (see my original review) and not tell us about it (he got a 40% or an $80 tip on a $210 total bill).   We would have been OK with the 18% tip for a party of 8, but just tell us about it so we wouldn't double tip you!

We just checked our credit card statements, and George DOUBLE CHARGED us when we asked him to split our bills.  This means that he charged us 150% for our food and drink bill!  UNETHICAL!  Here's a summary of this horrible restaurant:

1)  We weren't told that Waiter George included an 18% tip on our bill.
2)  We added an additional 20% tip, raising his tip to $85+ on a $210 bill.
3)  We were charged an additional 50% for our food, bringing our total charge to $300+ on a food tab of $168.
4)  To top it off, the food is HORRIBLE here!

AVOID!  Shame on the owners and wait staff of Citizens Kitchen & Bar!  We're working with the credit card companies to resolve this mess!

Food Grade:  D+
Service Grade:  F
Worth the Money Grade:  F
Overall Impression Grade:  F!

Las Vegas home of great service, NOT this place was a kick in the teeth for the MGM group, service was terrible server number 1 said we can't sit our selfs and to wait for the hostess (who was not there) then I asked to sit on a certain side and she said NO we are closed that side ( there was 3 family's sat over there eating) then our server shows up instantly hears my accent, thinks we are tourists so thinks I don't know how to tip ( so he didn't give a shit) little did he know we are Las Vegas residents!!! My wife got served a beer is a dirty glass, nothing got recommended, we did not get checked back up on ( servers who can't handle 3 tables need to get out of the game and move states) the food was ok but services from step 1 was the worst ever so would not go back and will be making sure I let every1 know this!!! O and I tried to contact the manger 3 times to give her some feedback  but she hung up my call 3 times and left a VM but nothing, I hope the owner of the company reads this and really thinks about the staff he has working for them!!!

First, let's talk exterior because obviously this is the first thing you see. It looks like a "Home Decor" Pinterest fan's wet dream. Everything about it is cute, warm, and welcoming - definitely a step away from the chic, haute couture-esque vibes that other Light Group places like Yellowtail & Stack aim for. 

This review is only for the beverage & such service, but I don't think it's going to be too far from home. I was meeting a girlfriend at the bar for some drinks after a long workweek and we settled on Citizens because neither of us had been. 

The restaurant was pretty much empty save for the bartop, which was close to being full. Next to us were a group of what looked like A/V or production guys that were just out from a gig at the House of Blues. With no seats, my friend and I posted up at the bar, and were quickly provided bar stools by two observant servers. The bartender was nice but it was hard to get a hold of her when we needed the check. 

I am usually a fan of Light Group venues for the most part, but this one just didn't quite seem to hit the mark. It seems like it could be something really great, but maybe it was just too much hype too soon?

Food was good 4 stars, the hostess Dana was a witch and needed an attitude adjustment. When a customer asks for a booth and you have one open sit them there even if your server is being double sat. Don't give them crap for their request. They are your CUSTOMER. They make your job possible like my clients make my job possible.

Love that it is 24 hours and it's not fast food. Cool atmosphere. Mahi tacos were good. My husbands grilled shrimp was fantastic! If you are looking for a light option go with that, you won't be disappointed.

$45 for two take out bagel sandwiches and two drinks?? The bagels were stale AND soggy...Plus, I was sick for a whole day after eating that!! Worst food experience ever. I cannot recommend this place to even my worst enemy.

We were totally hungry and wanted to grub before leaving Sin City. One of the homies recommended this place plus it was located in the hotel we stayed at. 

It was a cute spot. Service was not memorable.  My turkey burger was good but meat kinda fell apart. The bf liked his food. But, it was kinda priceyyy!  

3.5 stars for me!

Amazing food and great service if you get an awesome waiter. My first morning we had the best service ever. The waiter was spot on, the food amazing. The next morning the waiter chose to not listen and didn't communicate to the chef what my travel partner wanted. He asked specifically for Banana pancakes that were on the menu. He ended up with regular pancakes with a couple of bananas thrown on top. The manager was spot on and professional and took control of the issue. I was very impressed and will be back. The food is top notch and I highly recommend Citizens for breakfast. It was quite tasty. The overall feel of the restaurant is spot on.

Came here late night with my best friend and her co worker! It was literally not the first choice of dining but at 3:30-4 AM there isn't much of a choice in Mandalay Bay. The menu of course is going to be expensive because it's a hotel chain restaurant/deli or whatever. The down fall is that with it being so late they have a very selective menu to choose from so you don't really have many options! Our waiter was an airhead and we had to keep asking him for the necessary things that should've already came automatically such as napkins and water.. After spending over $60 for some basic ass meal I was completely over it because there's no way no breakfast burrito that small should've costed $13 and then the potatoes were basic with no seasoning.. My bf liked the food probably only because he was drunk but other than that I can't see myself eating here again unless I had a food and beverage credit from the hotel, but wait even then idk I would probably choose somewhere else...
